Reviews.Title: “basic”
Reviews.Author: Mal S
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in to the Astor we knew it was not ging to be good.Our twin room was so small and very basic.There was no where to sit apart from the bed and the beds were so close together that one had to put there feet up while the other got past.The room was dark because we had to keep the broken blind shut as we wre overlooked by the rooms opposite.It was also very noisey,when the people next door were having a shower it sounded like you were in the with them.There were no safety deposit boxes facilities available at the hotel, so we had to carry our valuables around with us.The room itself was clean and the beds were comfortable,the bathroom was a good size.

Reviews.Title: “small rooms...old tvs...noisy guests.still okay for nyc”
Reviews.Author: adrianmiami
Reviews.Content: i was really kind of surprised how small 2x3 meters maximum 7x9 ft hotel rooms can be. what i really disleiked was the doorman staring at me like bein transparent without helping at all with 2 heavyyyyy suitcases.strange i thought but no tip later :) the girl at the reception really the best of the whole ''hotel''. okay i am picky .they even gave me a park view toom the second day but come on. so small. old tv sets and 1960 cheap furniture. the windows were so dirty i thought it was raining outside but no.just lack of cleaning:) no breakfast,of course. rude recepcionist in the morning...or maybe just the new york way :) something positive? metro in front (110th parkway station, c-line) dont take a 70us cab from jfk.take the airtrain, then subway to 42nd street then c line. just 30 minutes ! 7.50 us ! then to la guardia from the hotel: bus m 60 leaving from broadway and 106th street. very practical. beds: kind of very used and to soft. rooms: small but inside clean bathrooms: at least they have tubs. sink had cracks but not my problem. clean at least. awful tv quality (picture) central park in front. careful when walking north. spanish harlem at night is conflictive. 10 blocks north you might get in trouble ! overall okay for the money but i would try to get a more centrally located hotel. i would rate this place 2.5 points. if you are 2 persons this is definitely too small.get another hotel. okay for solo travelers

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, personable staff”
Reviews.Author: YouthfulRotarian
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at this hotel, which comes at a reasonable price and really is just across the street from Central Park. It was only about a 45 minute wait (I arrived in the morning) to get switched to a park-view room and I was able to have an afternoon nap to the sound of bird song from the park. The staff are very down to earth, took me along to the tiny corner bodega to get a coffee, and it is where I ended up having breakfast every day. Coming home from shopping the staff (and other guests) were really interested in how I spent my day, where I went, and what I was able to buy. The downside is that it is a bit removed from the theatre district and other downtown attractions, but the M10 bus and the subway stops are within a block from the front door. In fact, I got to really enjoy taking the M10 bus, as I got to share with the locals who were on their way to taking their children to school or whatever. I got some great tips on what to see (the Gertrude and Leo Stein collection at the Metropolitan) from ladies on the bus. The M10, connected to the 86 crosstown bus, will get you to the Metropolitan, or you can just walk across the park.

Reviews.Title: “Very Basic”
Reviews.Author: Ambidextrous
Reviews.Content: This was the most expensive of the four hotels we stayed in on our recent trip to the USA. It was also by far the worst. From the moment we entered the reception area we had a sinking feeling. Our fears were realised when we opened the door to our room. It was so small that only one person could move around at once and the other person had to put their legs on the bed so the other one could get by. There was a broken venetian blind covering the window. This had to be kept closed all the time as there were other rooms immediately opposite (see photo). The beds were only about a foot apart. The wardrobe was very small and there were no drawers. There were no coffee making facilities and no room safe. Neither were safety deposit facilities available at reception, meaning we had to carry all our valuables round with us. Even though we were five floors up we could hear the noise of the subway trains all the time. The best part of our room was the bathroom, which was quite large by comparison, though the towels were rather threadbare. The room was very stuffy but the air con made a terrible noise. As mentioned in previous reviews, the lift was very small and we often waited 5 mins for it to arrive. The hotel is a long way from the centre of Manhattan, necessitating a subway or taxi ride. There is a deli nearby which serves a reasonable breakfast, and also a bar 3 blocks away. There is also an excellent supermarket opposite the bar. The only saving grace about this hotel was that the beds and towels were clean, or we would not have stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: aziesemer
Reviews.Content: What we liked: clean rooms, no bed bugs, comfortable temperature (it was winter), good bed, fair size, good location, good service and very good price (less than $60/night). What we didn't liked: the noise and the slow and undersized elevator: you'll probably have to wait several minutes to use it during the rush time. There is a subway entrance 2 1/2 blocks (3 min) uptown and another one 3 blocks downtown (4 min). You can find a Deli (to have breakfast) 2 blocks uptown and a Subway restaurant (plus some markets) in the corner of the Central Park. We could also find a good skating rink at the central park very close to the hotel for less then $12 (entrance + equipment). Less than half the price of the other rinks we visited in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MC9600
Reviews.Content: I stayed here March 10-14th..It was my second time in NYC, this time I traveled with my 11 year old son. We found this hotel through this website which directed us to Bookit.com. We paid a mere $79 a night for this gem!!! The hotel is in a residental neighborhood right across the street from Central Park, it is no where near Midtown/Times Square, but that is not a problem since there is a subway three blocks away!! As for dining options there is a deli two blocks away that serves great coffee and delicious bacon, egg and cheese bagel sandwiches, as well as other breakfast favs. Crepes on Columbus, about 3 blocks down, is also a great dining option. The neighborhood also has small shops as well as several produce stands and food carts. The rooms arent in the best shape, ours faced several buildings, but it was quiet and my son was fascinated by a family of black cats that had taken up residence on one of the roof tops! The paint job was sloppy, the floor was slanted, one of the light fixtures was broken, but these things didnt matter since we would leave the hotel at around 8am and not return until 11pm. The beds are modern and super comfy with lots of pillows!!!! The staff was super nice and the hotel does provide a car to the airport for $60, which isnt bad considering it's about $45 to take a Super Shuttle. We were greeted every morning and evening and they all made small talk with us. Excellent customer service! I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling on a budget and yes, you can do that in NYC!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent! You get what you pay for (plus a little more!)”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine T
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, friendly staff, comfortable bed, clean rooms and modern and clean bathroom! We left the hotel at 7am each morning and had breakfast in a little deli 2 blocks away and returned to the hotel to go to sleep, I wouldn't have wanted anymore than we had and would have been gutted if I had paid anymore for a plusher hotel for the amount of time we spend inside it! New York has so much to offer and there isn't enough time to do everything, you certainly don't want to be wasting time stuck in a hotel. The room (on the 5th floor) was cleaned every day, fresh towels were provided daily and if we had any queries about where to go and how to get there the reception staff couldn't have been more helpful. The reception area is a little run down and dated and it has a hostel feel about it but it didn't affect our overall experience. Location is lovely, its nice to get out of the main throng of things and experience a different area. Just across the road from Central Park it makes a lovely morning walk to 5th Ave. Would definitely return and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Best New York Trip! Refreshing Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ashley J
Reviews.Content: This was my second time to New York and it was one of the best trips of my life! I booked through the tour operator, letsgo2, who I knew to be very reliable but I was really impressed to how cheap the whole trip came to. First of all, I have to give credit to letsgo2 for putting it all together, the trip went on without a hitch and as it was my first time organising a holiday, this was really important to me. I would honestly recommend them to anyone. We even managed to get flights with Virgin Atlantic included in our tiny budget which was a huge bonus (free meals, free drinks etc). We got to New York and arrived at Astor on the Park to very friendly and helpful staff who happily stored our luggage until we could check in. (Check in wasn't until 3pm) Its located on the Upper West Side of New York and when we started walking, we were a bit bummed at how far out from everything we thought we were. However, after walking about 20 blocks downtown, we decided to cross on over 2 blocks to Columbus Avenue when we realised we were definitely walking down the wrong road! While there wasn't a lot but Apartments on Central Park West, we discovered that they were an abundance of shops and restaurants just 2 blocks across in a really bohemian area. We did all the tourist-ee bits in the day, which was amazing but I can't tell you how refreshing it was, after all the hustle and bustle of Midtown, to come back to our hotel on such a lovely street. There are subway stations literally just up the road which we used to get around (so cheap, $2.50 a ride!) and a lovely little Deli nearby where we had breakfast every morning. Overall the hotel was delightful, the staff were absolutely lovely and were always happy to help no matter what time, and the location really gives you a different perspective on New York. While we took advantage of the tourist spots during the day; it was nice to get a feel of what it might be like to be a New Yorker!

Reviews.Title: “Great Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leo_Assennato
Reviews.Content: People who goes to NYC and don't wanna spend money in hotel, this one is a good choice. It's simple, small, comfortable, clean and the staff is helpful. An old man on our first morning receipted us with a good morning in our language. That was really great and cool. There's no luxury, but it's secure. The internet connection is paid, but it's great, in a city that you won't find a lot of places with good free wi-fi. Nearby metro stations (110th), in front of Central Park, it's located in a residential area, that have a lot of babies schools. Crossing the park you will be in the 5th Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for! It's good for first timers to NYC”
Reviews.Author: Lorraine1965
Reviews.Content: Being someone who has stopped at many hotels in new York including the Helmsley this was quite a downgrade however for the price it is good value and if you are willing to travel on the subway or taxi every morning in order to get into the life of the city then this might be for you . There is a very friendly cleaner that goes round everyday and cleans the rooms and they are very tidy but very small and the decor of course is of quite a low standard but is still modern and what you expect. The most terrible part about this hotel is the elevator it sucks and after a long hot summers day in the city the last thing you want to do is travel up this hotels slow and cramped elevator this really bugged me and these are the sort of luxuries you sacrifice when goin to a cheap hotel overall I was suprissingly satisified and would advice it to first timers or short stays

Reviews.Title: “a little worse for the wear”
Reviews.Author: 2brighteyes
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Astor on The Park. I like the hotel, it is inexpensive, the location is terrific and the staff is courteous and accommodating. The condition of the hotel, however, is another matter. It truly appears to be down on its heels. We had a room on the top floor and it seemed to have been furnished with all the odds and ends in the hotel. the room was really ugly! The balcony door did not close properly and it turned out not to be connected at all because one strong wind blew it completed off the frame. There was mold in the bath tub and mattresses and bedrooms littered the stairwells. While i would stay again, do hope they have a chance to invest a little money in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Room was small but staff were very friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: Rachel A
Reviews.Content: I got to the hotel early (11am) so I could spend the day out with my friend in Manhattan. I didn't get any sleep on my long flight (with a layover in Atlanta), so I was actually falling asleep in the lobby waiting for my friend to come meet me. The front desk staff was very nice in offering early check-ins for me and another couple that were waiting for check-in time (3pm). I gladly took what was available so I could get a much needed nap before exploring the city. The elevator was busy with housekeeping using the 1 elevator, but I still didn't wait too long for it to be available for me to use. The housekeepers were friendly while I passed them by to get to my room. One of them even helped to make sure that my room was ready before I walked ion the room and bringing an extra blanket that she found missing. The room was very small but was very cozy. At the end of the room's hallway was one of the beds was very close to the wall and was obstructing passage to go around the bed. I have a picture of the bed near the wall and blocking the hallway. But, all and all, a nice small room. There were robes and nice bath amenities - which I gladly took home for a future bath or shower (the lotions and soaps, not the robes). The tv was small and didn't have many stations available but I didn't care since I was there to go out and be entertained by the city. I got a quiet room without a view which was perfectly quiet for me to take a nap and slept well later that night. The front desk in the morning were very nice and expedient. They also asked if I needed transportation and would help me if needed. The hotel is just across the street from Central Park. If I moved here I think this would be a nice neighborhood to live in. It felt safe. There were cafes and shops within 3 to 4 blocks and the hotel is half a block away from a bus stop and the subway. It's very convenient. I would recommend this hotel to someone who spending the day out and not staying in the room much (although, I think it's still cozy). You will have easy access to public transportation and will get a good night sleep at night. The price was the cheapest that I could find at the time. I would tell you what it is but it's irrelevant since room rates will change throughout Manhattan depending on the time of your trip. Oh, okay... It was $147.00 inc. taxes and fees.

Reviews.Title: “Astor on the Park is great”
Reviews.Author: sherryow
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 6 nights in June 2011. We chose it because it had decent reviews and also because it was cheap. There were some reviews on TA that did not paint it in a great picture but we bit the bullet and booked it anyway. I have absolutely no complaints about this hotel. It is not expensive so expect to get what you pay for, it is basic (no food/spa/gyms etc) and the bedrooms are not very spacious, however it is very clean with very helpful staff. It is located less than 2 mins walk from the subway at 109th st so getting down to lower Manhattan is very easy. This hotel is located on the upper west side so you are not in the heart of Manhattan, however do not let this fact alone make your decision. Across the road from the hotel is Central Park, where there are some fantastic walking tracks and green areas if you just want to sit back and relax. Also just a couple of blocks away is Columbia University and the surrounding neighbourhood. This is fantastic and there are some great little restaurants around. A little further away is Riverside Park which overlooks the Hudson. This hotel is a gem of a place and you get to see a bit of the real New York when you stay there. I'll definitely be booking back in here the next time I am going back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Close to subways”
Reviews.Author: K3RRY64
Reviews.Content: The first thing I would like to say is that we went in January when it was snowy and very cold..The Astor on the Park was so toasty. It was lovely and warm. The rooms are quite small but clean enough. What more do you need than somewhere just to put your head down...you're in the big city...get out there and see it! The AOTP is close to a subway station so you will never be without transport. We walked the full length of Central park one morning...it was lovely. Snow covered gardens. Dont be put off by the location way up in manhatten...as I said the subway was 2 mins walk away. We would definately stay here if we went NY again. There are plenty of deli's just round the corner too. Gorgeous bagels

Reviews.Title: “Small, Clean, Good transport links, great value for money. 7/10”
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New York and we were overall pretty satisfied with our stay. The hotel is small, clean and has a TV. If visting NYC for a cheap place to rest your head then this is perfect. If you are looking for something comfortable to spend a lot of time in, you should keep looking. Plus points: Two subway stops very close by. Right next to Central Park. A decent area and a nice walk towards Times Square along the Upper West Side with Strawberry Fields, The Dajota and Natural History museum all close by. The hotel itself is in a very quiet corner of Manhattan. Negatives: External Air Conditioning Unit on each window can keep you awake during a heavy downpour with rain drops loudly hitting the metal. It was enough to wake me up on 2 nights. Female member of staff attempted to order us a Cab for the airport, which would have been more than the standard "Yellow" charge. They probably have a deal with Cab drivers over there and will order you one of theirs. Simply stand on the street and wait for a maximum of 5 mins to signal one. Even better, if you're confident with the subway, just use trains for Airport transfers. As the local Subway stops are "Local" services you can easily head out of town later at night to catch a connecting train, it is likely you will be taken to a place less affluent than central Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Low Budget, Low expectations - Great location”
Reviews.Author: Alek P
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is amazing. It is very close to subway stations and right across the street from Central Park. Staff at the front desk are friendly and the hotel is clean, however it is a little bit outdated. The room that we had was very small, basically just for sleeping in and that's it. If you need to move around in a room, the only place to do it here is in the bed. We were here during winter and it got quite cold in the room at night. The radiator made a lot of noise but did not heat that well. You receive a room key and it has to be left at the front desk when you go out during the day. When we checked in we were assigned a room that already had someone else's belongings in it - we received the key that they left at the front desk when they left for the day. It could have been a one time mix up. Overall, not bad if you are trying to save some money. The price is amazing for a room in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean budget hotel near major subway line w/easy access to Broadway theaters, downtown”
Reviews.Author: NJ2RI
Reviews.Content: We go into NYC once a year or so for dinner and a Broadway show, and have usually stayed in the Times Square area. This year we chose to go a little further afield, and decided to stay at the Astor on the Park. What a totally pleasant surprise! We drove in from Westchester and found easy on-street parking for the duration of our visit. Once we parked the car, we got around via subway. The hotel is located very close to two subway stops that zip you right into Times Square in minutes--perfect for folks who want to go to dinner and a show, but don't want or need to stay in the middle of all the hubbub. Our room was typical of other NYC hotels at which we've stayed in this modest price range--generally tiny and a bit careworn, but very clean and tidy. This hotel was certainly much quieter than other hotels at which we've stayed in Manhattan, and I appreciated the residential vibe of the neighborhood after the frenzy of Times Square on a Saturday night. Our room overlooked Central Park--a nice bonus. Bed was hard, but pillows were nice and soft!

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, hot, noisy, dark”
Reviews.Author: travellingnerd78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, myself and my girlfriend.. Location is nice, right next to the park. We arrived very late (past midnight) and had let them know this would happen, and had no problems at all checking in. Staff are helpful and friendly. Price is good for Manhattan. Our room was on the ground floor with a single small window facing a small dark grubby courtyard. Almost no light was able to get to the window. The AC unit in the window was extremely loud (it seemed to be rattling itself to pieces) and wasn't able to cool the room much below about 85F (it was over 100 outside) making it a pretty unpleasant place to be. At night we had the choice between being kept awake by the AC or drenching the sheets in sweat. Mmm, Nice. Anyway, if you're visiting sometime when there isn't a killer heatwave and you don't plan to be in the room much, it's fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jo G
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on leisure for my first visit to New York. Personally I loved the location of this hotel, it has the residential feel over tourist. Right opp central park literally 5 metres from the hotel, there are 2 subways within a 5 min walk from the hotel and takes just minutes to all the attractions the city has to offer. If you are looking for a central location this isn't for you, I loved the peace and quiet of the location. The hotel is very small, the lift is tiny but certainly not worth knocking any points off. The rooms are very basic but clean and comfortable. The staff at the hotel were amazing, polite, helpful and nothing was too much trouble for them. To summarize........if you are looking for a modern, spacious central location book somewhere else, what this hotel offers is a clean, comfortable and excellent budget stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place next to Central Park”
Reviews.Author: DaniMolina
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for a place to sleep in NY? This is your place! The rooms are not very big, but they are very clean and confortable. Metro is just round the corner! The stuff is nice and helpful The area is very quiet, and there are a couple of restaurants near.

Reviews.Title: “Second time was less charming but still decent”
Reviews.Author: LilMissTraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my second time staying at the Astor (you can scroll down for my initial review). I won't rehash the same things that I wrote about it, as not much has changed. But this time, I was in a much less renovated room. This room was a little bigger (though not by much) but less "fancier." It clearly has not gone through their renovation process. It also had a DOOR leading to a rooftop! The door was locked from the inside as I wanted badly to climb out to the roof. If they could fix that roof (and the room), then they'd have one heck of a premiere room. I took photos of the door and the view. This room was in need of new paint and the bathroom was moldy but it was still fine. It was definitely a little cleaner (I didn't find any hairs). They STILL don't have free WiFi! C'mon, Astor, get it together! Free WiFi is a must in NY. And oh, the best part was the horrible TV. They had a crappy TV that was about 15 inches and that didn't even have cable so it was all snow! I took a picture because it was hilarious. Like I said, I clearly got a room that hadn't been renovated. I still think they can lower their prices since it's not exactly a premium hotel but it's also not a dump or a hostel and it's clean, safe, has a bathroom, and is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Itchyfeet76
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right across the road from central park, to get to Time Square it's a sub ride but that was no problem as the subway is a couple of blocks away. I loved the idea that the hotel was not in the heart of the city so if that's what you want then book a hotel closer? The hotel itself (because that's what reviews are supposed to be i.e. not location) was a great place. Okay the rooms are a bit dated and smaller than what we are used to in Europe but I stayed 5 nights and had no issues whatsoever. The staff are only to be congratulated on their friendly and helpful attitude and we always felt very welcomed. We used the hotel as a base for sightseeing I certainly didn't go to NYC to sit in a hotel room I can do that much closer to home. I enjoyed a good nights sleep each night and the bathroom was good enough, I particularly enjoyed getting up early walking to the deli at the corner for a coffee and sitting on the wall outside the hotel watching the world go by. I would definitely stay here again as the rate was very good compared to other hotels in NYC, and the big plus is the location! I got to walk across the road and sit in Central Park. So all in all thank you guys for a great stay and a fantastic trip to your fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Good Price and Location”
Reviews.Author: T_Rowan
Reviews.Content: The Astor on the Park was directly across from Central Park and 3 blocks from the Subway. The rooms were small but they were cleaned each day and were quite acceptable. It's a no-frills hotel and so you don't get coffee making facilities, refrigerator, or a safe but you do get a TV and a decent bathroom. We stayed in several rooms due to our travelling and the beds do vary quite a bit. Some were acceptable, one squeeked terribly, and one was so hard you could have been sleeping on the floor. There's one lift in a busy hotel so get used to using the stairs and if possible ask for a room at the back away from the street as it can get noisy but it is New York and you get used to the sirens and the constant horn blowing. The staff were very friendly and if you're not happy with your room they will move you if a another room is available. The cleaners were nice but didn't speak english and so if you need something done with your room talk to the front desk. Wi-Fi isn't free, you have to pay for it but the Park West Cafe 2 blocks away has free Wi-Fi and does a decent snack or breakfast. One word of warning, we were a family and so we had 2 rooms, we discovered our keys opened each others rooms, We didn't get anything taken but it did worry me that there was the potential for someone else to get access to your room.

Reviews.Title: “NOT IMPRESSED - NEVER STAY THERE AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: ayla11
Reviews.Content: The price was right, and the fact that it was opposite Central Park and close to the Subway....But that was it! Our shower drain and sink plug was not working, we complained for a few days, and then finally had someone come look and fix it. Discoverd on the 5th day, that the window in our room didn't lock at all!!!!!! Was quite upset about that....took 2 days to have them fix it! Did not replace washcloths and or towels, we had to ask for that quite a few days in a row. Then the kicker was that I had a bag of gifts/souveniers stolen from our room. When I went down to inquire...an hour later that bag re-appeared with one picture that I had bought still missing but the rest was intact!! They said the maid thought it was garbage!! Even though the bag was no way near the garbage, it was by my suitcase!!!! WAS NOT IMPRESSED! They didn't clean the sinks and or the mirror. We didn't mind the basic hotel at all, but the fact that some basic things were not even met.......day after day...no excuse. Would never stay there again. Be careful of your belongings...check the latches on the windows etc. The one doorman in the daytime was the only good thing about the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: travellover200219
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I traveled to New York City for the first time this summer. This hotel was very close to subway and bus stops and right across the street from central park west. The staff was so nice and helpful! The rooms weren't too large, but good enough for what we needed! They were very clean and that was very important to us! I would stay here again, if you plan to stay in your room a lot it may not be the place for you, because it is just a basic hotel, but if you want a great place that is close to all the things you want this is the place! Awesome staff and location!

Reviews.Title: “Very basic, and small!”
Reviews.Author: C C
Reviews.Content: Great location opposite central park west. Room was very small and very basic, needs updating badly! but clean. We had a twin room. Bed 1 collapsed few times! telephone did not work, Blinds did not work properly either! only good thing was the shower! complained a few times to reception staff, but nothing was done. Will i stay here again? don't think so.. Night receptionist not friendly at all :( Burst water main, not far from hotel, when did they do the roadworks? All night!!!! for 2 consecutive nights - grrr! stated on website that it was 3*, think it was more 2*

Reviews.Title: “Good quality / price”
Reviews.Author: guduains
Reviews.Content: On Central park West, between W 106th and 107th street. Clean, small room, essential (no fridge, no safe box, no brealfast as usual in NYC, no frills), enjoyed low price.

Reviews.Title: “astor new york”
Reviews.Author: starzyian
Reviews.Content: great location opposite central park, good basic accomodation, clean and tidy rooms very welcoming and helpfull staff,rooms are slightly date. but a quiet place to get your head down after a busy day in the city

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the prize”
Reviews.Author: hernargentino
Reviews.Content: When I got the low rate (compared with the rest of the same stars Hotels in Manhattan) I had my doubts about what I could find. The rooms are small but comfortable enough, AC, TV and a new bathroom. Is right in front of Central Park (great location if you dont attempt to be in the middle of the action, but close enough. You got 2 subway lines at just 5 minutes walk that will take you and get you back to and from downtown. The neighborhood is really nice and stuff is kind.

Reviews.Title: “A decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Savio5
Reviews.Content: We landed at the Astor after being in a really dodgy place far away from NYC so it was definitelly a better option for us. After going through all the other reviews I have to say mine are very similar. The hotels rooms were small.amenities inside the room were basic.there is only one elevator.room seemed to tilt towards one side! Wireless internet is not free. It was a safe place to be during Irene.Nice quiet location.Has a metro station few minutes away.Infront of Central Park and close to Columbus Avenue. Has vending machines and an ATM in the basement. Rooms has a clean and decent bathroom. I would recommend living there if you dont have any other better options for the price. But if you plan on walking to Times Square its far away! Also if the doorman organises a cab make sure he has also told the cab driver the rate he promised you!

Reviews.Title: “Old and dirty hotel feels like a cheap motel”
Reviews.Author: Rodeoboi
Reviews.Content: Clean but not much service, took forever to have a clean room in the morning, location is great but I would not stay in the Astor again, 120$ per night is way overpriced, the only thing I could say is that it was nothing more than 'ok'

Reviews.Title: “The door men are the best part about this place!”
Reviews.Author: kasinger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is on the north west side of Central Park, just across the street. My favorite part was the doorman Emil! He speaks many languages and has a true love for people. He gave us great recommendations for local restaurants. Favorites were-Crepes on Columbus (the best crepes and breakfast!) and Carmines on Broadway and 92nd. The hotel is in an older building and the elevator, stairs and rooms are small. The rooms are clean and refurbished nicely. The tv is small, but we did not spend much time in the room watching tv. This location is nice, it is quiet, no horns, no sirens, no train sounds. The price was good for NY City too. The only negative was parking. The closest good parking garage was 5-6 blocks away at $20 a day. There is free parking on the street, but on certain days, you must move your vehicle for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect a top-class hotel, but good value for money!”
Reviews.Author: LanoDJ
Reviews.Content: Good location, just in front of Central Park, between 103rd and 110th Metro stations. Rooms are small and bathroom is even smaller, but that's quite common in New York, also in more expensive hotels. Hotel furniture is not brand new, but everything was very clean. Hotel staff was very kind. Breakfast service is not offered. We would consider staying again in this hotel in the future, the value is totally good for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: odriscoll27
Reviews.Content: This was one of the cheaper hotels we found when booking our trip to New York, it was in a good location with the subway only a few blocks away and a nice little cafe/bar just down the road where many NY students used the Internet, this was recommended to me by the nice man on the door who always said hello and was very helpful, he was a greek looking chap. This cafe was handy since the Astor Internet was down for the entire 7 days we were there. The air con was loud but after a few hours your ears should adjust and you won't even notice it. The room was small but enough space to put the suitcase on the floor. It's in a great location to start a nice walk from the top of central park to the bottom, I recommend doing this early in the morning, amazing. I would stay here again if I want to go on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Half/Half but never going back”
Reviews.Author: Dissapointed8719
Reviews.Content: We stayed five days in this hotel and even though the room was clean and it didn't matter to us that the room was quite small, the motor of the air-conditioning was so loud that we could hear it from the hallway and it could wake you in your sleep. Our only window looked out to another building in a way that the curtain-thing wasn't even long enough for us not to be looking into the windows across. But these things didn't really bother us. The reason why we are writing this review is, because when we left a cellphone in the room on the last day, housekeeping took it. Although the hotel never admitted to this even though we phoned the same day we checked out. They said they found nothing and we also left a bottle of rum in the room and they did not even mention that. Furthermore the staff was really rude about it and did not apologise for this and made it sound like a discomfort that we phoned.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel on Central Park”
Reviews.Author: tkingsbury
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, had a king bed that overlooked the park. Staff was really nice and always helpful. Definetly a backpackers hotel, right by the 103st metro stop. Room was small but clean with a nice updated bathroom. Overall, good if you plan on being out and about most of your trip. The only negatives were that there is only one elevator that went out once while we were there and the bed was really hard (and we like a more firm mattress).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! Better Than Expected! Definately will go back!”
Reviews.Author: 1ammom
Reviews.Content: This was a terrific hotel. The staff was very helpful and the room was better than expected for the price. One of the biggest perks of this hotel was the fact that it was inexpensive and you had our own bathroom! The location is a little bit from downtown Manhatten but that really is not a problem. The C subway takes you to 103th Avenue which is about 3 blocks from the hotel! Easy walk! Our room had a balcony that overlooked Central Park. We could not have asked for a better, more reasonable place to stay. There is also a great little deli down the block for a quick breakfast. lunch or snack to take along. The worst part about this hotel is the tiny elevator. We were on the 10th floor and after visiting and walking around NYC all day, I really didn't have the energy to take the stairs. I just prayed everytime I got in that it made it made it up and down. It did without a problem! The weather was VERY HOT when we went and the air conditioner in the room was awesome. We even got too cold and had to turn it down. We will most definately be staying here when we return!

Reviews.Title: “Roaches on the Park”
Reviews.Author: Arturj1980
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for our summer vacation. Location is good (Just in front of Central Park and 3 blocks from subway station) but rooms are tiny and the second night we found a huge roach in the room. If you're traveling on a budget I guess it's ok, but otherwise stay some place else!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, great location and friendly staff...excellent choice for the price”
Reviews.Author: Priscilla111
Reviews.Content: We got a great price on the hotel room with 2 beds for 3 nights. It was directly across from Central Park West and near a great Turkish convenience store which we frequented at least once a day. The service from the staff was friendly and helpful, as they receive many international and out-of-state travelers and were great in helping with directions. The room was exactly what you need in a hotel room, with just enough space for some extra storage, a chair and table, two beds, and a full bath. The window view was nothing special but we did not stay in the hotel except at night. The location was excellent, near several stations, and affording us a chance to stroll around Central Park West, which was right across the street. Also, if you are into recycling, there was a place to do so only 4 or 5 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SandyNetherton
Reviews.Content: Loved the price, the neighborhood, the fact that it's across the street from Central Park, that it's quiet after a long day in the city, that the staff was wonderful, and the place is immaculately clean. The rooms are tiny but you get your own bathroom. It was just perfect for the three of us. (There is parking on the street if you look for it, and a subway close by.)

Reviews.Title: “Basic and far from action”
Reviews.Author: RedED29
Reviews.Content: The hotel has basic ammenties and room very small but on the whole very clean, very helpful staff and bed and towels changed on daily basis. It is a far distance from all the action that New York has to offer and using the cabs can be quite expensive. We instead invested in a 7 day unlimited rail pass for the subway and this proved to be much better, $29 for a week and we travelled up and down Manhatten easily, closest subway is 103rd street. Reception can provide a subway map. Enjoyed our trip but next time may stay closer to main attractions

Reviews.Title: “Really awful, even for the great price. NOT worth it.”
Reviews.Author: MB8590
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we chose this hotel because we wanted to stay in nyc but couldn't afford $500/night. We paid only $97/night here, but it was way worse than a budget hotel. The room was fairly clean, but nearly impossible to move around it. Tiny was not even the word for it, and we had a standard size room. The worst part of our experience were the beds. The room smelled like smoke which made our stay difficult enough, but the beds were the WORST beds I've EVER slept on. We booked two nights and only stayed for one. Don't bother wasting your $$ on this place. Stay somewhere in NJ where there are beautiful hotels and it's close enough to NYC that you can come and go as you please. Don't bother with this place.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK THIS HOTEL, ITS PERRRRRRRFECT!!!”
Reviews.Author: LIPZ
Reviews.Content: This hotel was grrrrreattttttt. I depends on what you are after and if thats a basic, good location, friendly staff - this is the one. If you want more than that then you need to spend the money and do so. We stopped here from 22nd Apr 2011 until 28th Apr 2011, only got back a few days ago. Myself and husband stopped in one room, my sister and friend stopped in another. The staff were excellent especially RE, he was a sweetheart. The rooms were basic but they had a TV, hairdryer, ironing board, their showers had great water pressure, realisticly what more do you want considering your going to be out most the time checking out New York. When we had trouble putting the heating on they sent someone straight away, we asked for an iron they had someone bring it up to us, they have drinks machines located downstairs. The room was cleaned everyday - fresh towels, bins emptied, beds made up. Speaking about their beds they were tooooo comfortable, we all enjoyed our sleeps there. Location is brilliantttttttttttttttttttt - it takes you away from the rustle and bustle of new york, subway from the hotel is 3 minute walk, and the hotel is right opposite central park-what more could you ask for. The least thing I liked was the rooms could have had a little colour too them, more brightnous, may be some themes, like black and white and pink etc. And may be tea and coffee in the bedrooms but i guess they do have vending machines downstairs. I would recommend it to anyone unless your after something more upper class but if you like basic - this is your hotellllllllllllllllllllllllllll xxx

Reviews.Title: “not what we where told to expect”
Reviews.Author: SHL1982
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as we went to NYC to get married and wanted and small, mid-buget nice hotel and we told that this was the one that we wanted the photos we where shown where completly missleading, it looked like they redeocrated onr or two rooms but not the others the room we where given was an upgrade and i dread to think what our original room would of looked like the carpets are thread bare, the lock on the doors where barley hanging on, the plumbing was hangging out of the walls and the whole place looked dirty and i cried when i saw our room and if we had more money we would of moved hotels the hotel for some people maybe the wrong end of the island however i ded love being so close to the park and my husband loved the food avalible in harlem but we if we go back we would be looking to stay the other end nearer tribeca or greenwich the staff where friendly and nice but i wouldn't recomemed this hotel as i was so disapponted by what we where told to expect

Reviews.Title: “Priced for what you need-a comfortable bed and awesome powerful shower!”
Reviews.Author: dracal
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel at the end of January 2011 for 9 nights. We got a deal at an incredible rate and were expecting a catch when we arrived. However, we were met with polite, courteous and helpful staff and a comfortable room in which to spend our 9 nights. When my partner and I travel, we don't look for special amenities in our room... All we want is a clean room, comfortable bed and powerful shower. It was exactly what we got and we couldn't have been happier. As it was especially cold at the time of year we visited New York, we were provided with extra blankets and a portable radiator for the room, however we didn't need it. We stayed on the tenth floor and had a little view of Central Park. But we're not the type of people to sit in a room looking out the window at the view, instead, we ran straight out and became a part of the view and had a snowball fight!!! Central Park is LITERALLY across the road from the hotel, it would have been rude not to!!! Highly recommended!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “More Pluses than Minuses for the budget Traveler”
Reviews.Author: artchik
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for an absolute steal at $75 per night, so on that basis alone I would rank it positively. We only use our hotel to sleep and shower and don't need luxury or a lot of amenities - just somewhere clean and safe. This place definitely fit the bill. First - the good. The staff is extremely friendly and checking in and out was a breeze. There was always a doorman on duty and by the second day they were greeting us by name and making friendly chit-chat. They also were helpful in recommending the best places to eat in the area. The room itself was nothing special but it was fine; on the smallish side but pretty normal by NY standards. The sheets and towels were extremely clean and we had a private bathroom, which was marble. It looks just like the pictures I saw on Priceline when I booked the room. The location is in the upper west side near the northern edge of Central Park but close to two subway stops. Unless you are the kind of person who needs to be in the heart of the action the location is fine and being across the street from the park is nice. Lots of restaurants and bars within walking distance and a 10-15 minute subway ride to get anywhere in Manhattan. TIP: the A and C trains run on the same track, but be sure you take the C train (local) b/c it is the only one that stops at 103rd or 110th, the two closest subway stops. The A takes you all the way to 126th and you have to get on the C to go back. We found the 103rd to be the more convenient of the two close stops. The mixed - our room had a view of the park, which was lovely, but the downside is that the street traffic was quite loud. We were on the third floor and the noise from the traffic made sleeping difficult, although by the third night I was better able to tune it out. Perhaps a higher floor would have helped. Again - for the price we paid, it was a minor complaint, and I'm sure the view was much better than the rooms that face the back of the building, which may be just as loud in terms of traffic noise for all I know. The bad - the noise from people walking in the hallways and in the room above us was much more noticible than any other hotel I have been in. The walls seem literally paper thin. This was much more disruptive than the traffic noise. If someone opened a door anywhere in our vicinity it literally sounded as if someone was walking into our room. It was a bit disconcerting. People walking normally in the room above us sounded like a herd of elephants stomping around. Also, while the linens on the bed are fine the bed itself was extremely hard. It was ok for a few nights but probably would have bothered me on a longer stay. Overall I would recommend staying here if you can get it for less than $100 per night - especially b/c most things in that price range in NY have shared bathrooms and this place does not. Anything over that, I would shop around and see what else you can find. We felt it was perfect for our needs on this trip and would not hesitate to stay again within the price point mentioned above.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LMcC79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very basic but the location was good with helpful staff. Location close to Subway Station for getting around. and across the road from Central Park. It was low cost and I guess you get what you pay for but our room was fusty and the radiator leaked and made a loud banging noise throughout the night. We were there for 3 nights as a break from visiting relatives in Boston so didn t spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for budget travelers”
Reviews.Author: april_79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 8 days in NY during February. We booked this hotel because of the price (was between 20 - 40 USD less than other budget hotels) and the location (it is just across the street from Central Park and three blocks from the subway). The rooms are fine, a little bit small, but then, if you are going to NY, you probably won't spend much time in your room. You will have a comfortable and clean bed a private bath and a properly heated (sometimes even too much) room for a really convenient price. The people in the front desk and the doorman are very nice and always willing to help and to provide advice. The only thing I would have liked is to have free Internet. There is wi-fi available, but you have to pay for it. I would definetily go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean, but at the wrong end of the park”
Reviews.Author: LondonJudithCharmers
Reviews.Content: Very clean but basic rooms, good view over central park. The only downside is the distance from Downtown. For a weekend it may be worth paying the extra to stay downtown as what we saved by staying at this hotel we ended up spending in taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location, comfy beds but a little shabby”
Reviews.Author: BethM7
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights at this hotel, and were made to feel welcome from the moment that we walked in the door. The staff really cannot do enough to help you, whether it be advising on somewhere to eat or arranging transport. They were unfailingly interested in our wellbeing and the quality of our experience of New York. The communal areas are maybe not the cleanest, and as someone else has mentioned the lift is tiny, but the rooms themselves are clean if a little compact. If you get a room with a view over the park then bonus. We didn't, but spent so long out all day in the city it was neither here nor there. You can hear some noise, but certainly not enough to disturb us. The neighbourhood itself is quiet and very family orientated so we felt very safe and comfortable there. The subway station is a minute or two away, and there are plenty of places to eat in strolling distance. The french vanilla coffee at the deli one block up is to die for! Even though you are not in the touristy centre of the city, it doesn't take long on the subway to get there, and the distance means that you get a little peace and quiet from the hustle of down or mid town. I will certainly consider rebooking this hotel when I go back to New York, confident that the welcome will be as warm as it was this time. Thank you very much indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Good staff, horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: StuartandNaomi
Reviews.Content: I recommend you do not stay at this hotel, the rooms were filthy (and I have back packed around Asia), small and freezing!! I must admit however the sheets and towels were very clean. We stayed at the start of Feb for 2 nights and were not to impressed, the first room we were given was small and filthy, we therefore asked to be moved and was given a slightly larger room (No cleaner however) When we went in the window was open which we assumed was to air it out however when we went to close it later in the day it would not close, I called reception who tried to close the window but with no joy, I therefore had to stuff towels in the window in the hope it would keep us warmer (It didnt) the central heating was not working and as there having one of the worst winters in years we froze for 2 days. Good things about the hotel?? the staff wre pretty good but to be honest there flogging a dead horse, the location is fine in my opinion (only a couple of blocks from the start of Harlem at the top of Central Park West) with only a 3 or 4 min walk to the nearest metro station.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are absolutely freezing”
Reviews.Author: weejemmy75
Reviews.Content: while the rooms are very clean they could be updated the decor is really bad, there is no tea or coffee making facilities, bathrooms are modern the only good point the windows are not double glazed, we used the window as a refridgerator could not sleep with the cold, could not recommend to friends

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugBAC
Reviews.Content: Was recently in NYC with a friend. After staying with some friends on the upper east side for a week then staying with another friend down in Brooklyn for 5 days, having our own space was something we were both looking forward to. Our personal experience was great. PROS: Cheap. Keep in mind, this is New York, where nothing really comes cheap and there are places that are constantly booked up. This was the cheapest available hotel we could find that was not a complete dive or a hostel where we'd be sharing a room with nearly 12 people. For the location, the helpfulness of the staff, and the amenities, the price was perfect. Location, location, location. This hotel is in a great spot. Our room (609) overlooked Central Park, a great view to wake up to in the morning. The hotel is right next to the subway. Convenient store, grocery store, deli, coffee shop, bus stop are all within 5 blocks. Since the hotel is on Central Park West, it's fairly easy to find a cab. Safe. Along with location, you'll feel at ease walking around the neighborhood at any time, day or night. It seems fairly family oriented. We walked by several schools, a lot of parents/nannies and children. Helpful staff. From the time we walked in the door, the concierge and front desk clerk were professional, helpful, and friendly. The day I was scheduled to leave my flight was cancelled due to all the bad weather. They were very understanding and helpful, got me on another flight AND although I was supposed to have already checked out, they offered to store my luggage free of charge if I had any errands/business to attend to. Room. Again, for the price we were paying in New York City, we were amazed at what the room had to offer. TV, a king sized bed, clean bathroom and bedroom. Basic. Perfect. CONS : Only a few things I would mention when recommending to anyone. Advertising. Online, the ad for the hotel said there would be a continental breakfast. There is not. Call the hotel itself to find out about their ammenities. The online ad agencies and hotel are not affiliated. Smoking. The people in the room next to ours were constantly smoking. My friend is an asthmatic and it was particularly uncomfortable for her. Although we called the hotel and they said they would address it, cigarette smoke lingers and the hotel can't monitor smokers 24/7. Unfortunate. Heating/cooling. It's confusing to figure out and get just right. If nothing else, call the front desk and someone will come up and tamper with the heater to get it just right for you. I would recommend this hotel to any of my friends visiting NYC. For larger groups or families, not sure if this would be your cup of tea. Again, it was just me and a friend staying at Astor. Enjoyed our stay. Will keep it in mind should I be looking for hotels in NYC in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: JeffandCheryl
Reviews.Content: The Astor is remarkable in several respects. The service is exceptional, the rooms, carpet, bathrooms, towels, and linen were very clean, the beds were comfortable, the water in the sink and shower/bathtub was hot, and the staff was extemely accomodating, friendly and helpful. Our family vacations a lot, and over the past decade or so we've stayed at scores of hotels all over the country and abroad. We've never encountered a better staff than that at the Astor. Our first hotel room there was quite small, but we moved to another room that was larger, with a nice view of Central Park. The hotel and its lobby and rooms are rather plain and devoid of any frills but the decor and aesthetics of the room were tasteful, pleasant and very reasonable given the price we paid. There were a few negatives. The walls are very thin, and we could hear noise through the wall from the adjoining rooms, including the sneezing of a guest and the running of the water in its sink and shower. In the second room facing the Park, the volume of street noise was quite loud at night. The combination of noises from the street and the adjacent room made it somewhat difficult for this reviewer to sleep. There is no coffee shop in the hotel, but there are vending machines for coffee, soft drinks, and candy, all at a reasonable price. The TV in the first room did not work, but the staff replaced it shortly after we brought it to their attention. The location is reasonable, and although its's about 50 blocks from midtown Manhatten, its a short 3 block walk to the A train subway and a 2 block walk to a small food store. I highly recommend the Astor!!

Reviews.Title: “Minimal, Clean, and Straight Forward”
Reviews.Author: natthology
Reviews.Content: This place is actually nice. My room 510 was clean and have everything I needed from a nice clean bed, clean bathroom (which is very important for me), nice toiletries. It's just all I needed for a trip. There is no fancy key card here, just an old school set of key to access the room. TV was silly because most channels were unavailable, but I wasn't there to watch TV. Also this place isn't exactly quiet but the noise didn't bother me much ( I was in a busy city afterall!) The subway wasn't too far anyway but there wasn't many running on the weekend, so the wait could be long. Overall, I was pretty happy with it. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never again would I stay here”
Reviews.Author: stereophonic2k
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to New York with my boyfriend, and this hotel was recommended by the travel agent, as somewhere she had stayed before and of great location etc etc the usual travel agent speak! I should have known better! We arrived from Newark Airport at about 12noon on the day went to the hotel hoping we could rest for a little and freshen up then but alas that was not to be the case, we were told that check-in was at 3pm and to come back then, we were allowed to leave our bags etc but at that point all I wanted was to sleep. We took a stroll towards Times Square thinking no its not that far.........what a crock! It took ages to get to where the action was, not to mind the return journey, I was on the verge of tears I was so tired when we got back! The other alternative is taking a cab if you want to risk your life. Their driving is manic and more often than not there were near accidents with other vehicles. As for pedestrian crossings, I thought when the little walking man was up then you as a pedestrian have a right of way, apparently not! Anyway, on returning to the hotel, we were put through a further wait to check in, they had my name etc wrong and there was a different girl on reception. She told us she had called someone to help with our bags, eventually whomever was supposed to come, didnt, so we got our own bags, and used the lift/rickety old thing the size of draculas coffin to go up to our room, with our room KEY..........to be honest that should have been the first warning about this place, i just don't trust this kind of place that hands you a key and not a key card for your room! we got into the room which was tiny, but i wasnt expecting anything more in relation to this aspect of the room. In this dingy room the radiator was leaking, there were stains all over the ceiling, the carpet was stained and extremely worn, the tv was crap, reception/and channels, the wardrobe door was falling off and the shower was like a power hose trying to take a layer of skin off you instead of washing you! The bathroom was not too clean either, and they never seemed to replenish the toilet roll while we were there for 5 days, there was simply 2 rolls there and that was it, the towels were always changed and fresh but they weren't of any great substance and ripped easily with simple use! I wouldnt ever stay here again, its not clean in the least, and it certainly is not in a great location at all, there really isn't much around it and it takes ages to get into the real hub of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Gremio
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights in this hotel right after Christmas. At this time of the year NY is crowded and it is really tough to get decent deals. We got a rate of $104 a night, which can only be found in Newark or close to LaGuardia. The location was pretty good. Right in front of the Central Park. We stayed at the 10th floor and had an amazing view. From the balcony it was possible to see the NY's skyline. There are subway stations 3 block away (B-C) and if you walk 8 minutes west you can catch the 1 train. The room itself was small and simple, even though we got an upgraded one. The carpet wasn't very clean but the linens were. The gap under the room door and balcony door were really big and wind blew thru it constantly making that "horror movie wind blowing" noise. The bed mattress was hard but fine to us, after walking all day long thru the snowy streets. Service was okay. The receptionist who first helped us was really helpful and polite. The others were okay. No complaints. Overall, this was a good hotel considering location and price. For a similar hotel in Manhattan the minimum prices we could find was over $250/night in all major travel search websites.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: cornwall079
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel, the price is right, and so central to everywhere. me and my daughter stopped in this hotel for 10 days, and came back 5th dec, it was basic, but clean and comfortable, clean fresh sheets and towels was changed every day. also the reception staff were very friendly, always gave you advice. There was a nice cafe down the road which has steps down to it, nice food, and lovely vanilla coffee,l very friendly people. I would recommend you to stop here.

Reviews.Title: “With a little more TLC, can be a real hidden gem hotel”
Reviews.Author: LilMissTraveler
Reviews.Content: I decided to stay at Astor on the Park to see what it's like instead of staying at my usual haunt of the Days Hotel on Broadway. Astor on the Park has a great location (just like Days Hotel). It's in a safe, quiet neighborhood, directly across from the amazing Central Park, and steps from all of the major subway lines. On the corner is a nice deli with nice folks, and if you walk up to the 100s and Broadway, you can find plenty of good restaurants and a cute dive bar called Tap of the Keg. Drug stores and banks are all within walking distance so the location is convenient, to say the least. The exterior of the hotel is nice, and the lobby, while very small, is welcoming. The hallway is super small and slightly alarming but I hardly heard outside foot traffic. The rooms themselves are quaint, renovated, and clearly trying to emulate hipper boutique hotels than the corporate chain ones. There are no amenities but like I said, you can get what you need by foot around the corner. My main issue with the room was cleanliness. I found several hairs on my bed that weren't mine, and the bathroom cleanliness left a lot to be desired. I wasn't disgusted but wished it were just a bit cleaner. The rooms ARE small but not suffocatingly so. They have enough room for a large bed and a second lounge-y chair. You won't be roaming around in your room but you also won't feel like you're in a jail cell. The lack of free Internet is disappointing but even more so, the cost. I believe it was $12 per day for Internet, which is too expensive, in my opinion. If Astor could lower the price or better yet, offer free Internet for guests, I'd like this place more. The elevator is very small and slow, so take the stairs for an adventure. The stairs are really narrow and it's almost like a roller coaster. :) The staff were all nice and accommodating. I'd be willing to give Astor on the Park another try but they really do need to improve their cleanliness and re-consider their Internet options to stay competitive with other hotels. The price IS good, though (well, not good because all of NY is a rip-off but less expensive than other hotels).

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Arcoiris12
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. good location, subway just 1 block 1/2 away...not many places to eat around but everything is close when you ride the sub...small rooms but clean, nice people. it does not incl. breakfast and internet has a rate but at the corner you have a deli that has wireless for free. It is just across the central park.

Reviews.Title: “Cant wait to stay again!”
Reviews.Author: NYCis4me
Reviews.Content: I'm from the south and demand to be treated as if I am the only customer you have and it was just that! We arrived at 1p and was able to check in immediatley, we even got to look and pick which room we wanted! The man at the door brought our luggage up immediatly. My friend and I wanted to hit the town, but we needed a little help getting to subway and a few other places. The employees at the Astor were more than happy to answer questions, tell you which way to go, and give you all the info you need. I must say I felt like I was at home with all the hopitality! The price is awesome$ for the fabulous room and the great sleep I got on the comfy mattres. If you are looking for luxury you find it here. This place is simple, clean and everyone is at your becon call. Having stayed near Times Square in the pricier hotels before this is absolutley the only place I will stay again. I felt like a real New Yorker!! The Subway is about 2 blocks away and $27. will buy you a pass good for 7days. This is the only way to travel In the Big Apple! The employees at the desk will give you a subway map and you will be able to go anywhere in the city you want. There is a little restaurant about 2 blocks away that have fresh pastry and the food prices are the same as you would find anywhere. Thank you Astor Hotel for making my stay even more than expected!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but nice”
Reviews.Author: yasmen108
Reviews.Content: My brother and I stayed here last month for 6 nights.This is a basic but nice hotel opposite to Central Park. The room was tiny but clean,good size bathroom, concierge very helpful, he booked our taxi to the airport. The hotel is situated in a quiet neighbourhood,the subway is just a few blocks away and there's a Turkish Deli just down the road for breakfast (they serve food all day). The only issue that I had was with the radiator/pipes banging during the night-our last one! kept us awake for a few hours. Apart from that........nice hotel,I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT SERVICE, GREAT PRICE”
Reviews.Author: Carly086
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my cousin and we stayed at Astor on the Park in November. We're both in our mid-twenties so we were a little nervous about staying in NYC by ourselves. We felt very safe in Astor. The front desk attendent as well as the door man were VERY nice and very helpful. The door man actually recommended a place for us to eat dinner but went above and beyond when he escorted us there and came back when we were ready to be escorted home. They also took care of calling a car for us to take us to the airport the next day. Only complaint was we couldn't get the hot water to work but hey, we were only there one night so that wasn't a deal breaker. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at Astor on the Park and would definitely stay there again. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In NY you get what you pay for.... but this is value!”
Reviews.Author: zoejmcgill
Reviews.Content: New York being very expensive, we managed to find this hidden gem..... it was around $80 Aus each per night which is just a bit more than a hostel! And you get your own bathroom... AND IT IS SO CLEAN! We were so surprised how clean the room was... I mean it is very tiny as you would expect it to be in NY.... but we were really happy with it. Just a few blocks from the subway (the subway is very safe) and about 10-15 mins to Times Square it was great! I mean if you want to stay where it all happens... go ahead and pay $250 a night... OR save the money and do awesome things in New York - like see a broadway show for just $65 Aus (you have to line up at 6pm in Times Square, but you get excellent seats!) or go shopping on 5th Avenue! You should only be sleeping in your hotel as there is SO MUCH TO DO IN NEW YORK there is no time to be hanging out in your hotel room. Our room did not have a view, but it had 2 double beds, our own bathroom and the people at the front desk were very accommodating. If you are looking to stay in Manhatten and stay in NY this is the place. the downside it does not have a website....

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: StuartHay
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel through a travel agent and knowing little about it i became rather scared as i couldn't find much about this hotel anywhere on the net apart from here and although everyone on this raved about the place, there was always something inside me being a little skeptical but all that changed when i arrived in NYC. If you are like me and your hotel room should consist no more than a comfy bed and a safe / clean enviroment for you and your belongings then this is the place for you. located between 106th and 107th street is is rather uptown but with the hotel located on Central Park West then the 40 odd minute walk is amazing and if you can't be bothered walking, 103rd Street station will take you to the heart of midtown in less than 10 mins. Neighborhood is great, everyone very friendly. Total bargain, highly recommend this hotel for anyone who uses a hotel as a hotel and not a living space.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, No-frills, but a Good Night's Sleep!”
Reviews.Author: Trentholme
Reviews.Content: This is a basic, no frills hotel situated opposite Central Park between 106th W and 107th W Street. (you need this precise address for the cab). It is some way from Times Square, but the pleasant and quiet neighbourhood ensured that we had a good night's sleep without the noise of traffic and wailing sirens all night long. We actually woke to the twittering of birds! The room was adequate, with two large beds (these would be 2 Double Beds in the UK) a small TV and a good size bathroom with a large bathtub and shower. The Air Conditioning is the typical American one, clamped to the window, and can be noisy if you need to keep it on all night. We could not get the shower nor the wall sockets to work, but this was soon put right with a demonstration by the very helpful and friendly staff of the hotel. Unfortunately there are no other amenities, not even a coffee machine, but the staff will send out for food etc. should you wish it. Otherwise there is a Deli only a few steps down the road if you can't wait for your first cup of coffee or breakfast until you get to a Diner nearer the Hub of the city. And, if you are someone who is into fitness, just jog across the road and join the Joggers in the Park! We stayed for 4 nights, leaving in the mornings and returning after dinner at night. A Taxi to Times Square will set you back $10, but the drive through the park each morning was, for me, an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal...”
Reviews.Author: jackii49
Reviews.Content: We certainly enjoyed this place after searching all over the upper West Side for something convenient and reasonably priced for what we were looking to do. Comfortable bed, extra blanket was nice since it was chilly, nicely stocked bathroom, helpful front desk staff. The reservation process was easy. We liked the brief walk to Amsterdam and Broadway and found convenient transportation. For the price, convenience, etc. I advise giving this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Great welcome”
Reviews.Author: karlolita39
Reviews.Content: I would quite particularly like to thank the doorman who is so kind with children and adults. A very good hotel for a short stay. In front of Central Park, ilt's a bit difficult to take the subway on week end because the closest line is closed. You must walk to find an othe line.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! My room was facing Central Park, 2 minutes from Subway, clean room, very modern!”
Reviews.Author: grks21
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel. I had won it on Hotwire for slightly over $100/night and I was greeted with a clean room, king size bed, flat screen tv, an a view of the park. The subway is only a couple of minutes away, just walk south along the park. Parking is also free along the park and it is not that hard to get a spot, just watch the signs because they have street cleaning twice a week. Great little hotel, I would highly recommend it and would go back anytime! About 15 minutes to Midtown Manhattan, door to door.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: 2brighteyes
Reviews.Content: Though room was small, it was very clean and nicely furnished. The hotel had a very euro feel. It was definitely nice to be across from Central Park. The staff was friendly and courteous. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Totally average hotel, very well located...”
Reviews.Author: VanRood
Reviews.Content: Totally average hotel, very well located near the subway. Concierge was nice. Rooms are small and not very clean. Front rooms have nice view of central park (though no overview).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: Sabientje
Reviews.Content: I've visited this hotel with my friend last week. It was our second time in NYC, but our first time in Astor on the Park. We were a little bit worried about the location, but when we arrived those worries were all gone ! It is a great location, across the street from Central Park and only 3 minutes away from the Subway. Even a taxi can bring you back to your hotel from almost every central location for about 10 $ till 15 $. The room was small but enough to sleep in it. There was airconditioning in the room and was even left on the whole day and not shut down by the roommaid. In the hotel there's a small elevator where fits 4 people. Sometimes you have to wait a long time but that's the only " bad " thing. Because the hotel is located at the street, you can hear some traffic sounds. If you really like to have a quite sleep, use earplugs.

Reviews.Title: “Very good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: conradsharp
Reviews.Content: Me and my brother stayed there for 4nights it not far from time square just a short cab ride away .I am thinking about booking for next year. The room was just the right size and the service was spot on. ....

Reviews.Title: “Easy hotel with a good price with a little off location”
Reviews.Author: Hakan00
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel was good for its price, nice clean room & bathroom and had comfortable beds. Its was quiet during the nights except for one saturday night when it seem like a Jazz-club of some sort was open. The TV in our room barely worked and wasnt much to enjoy. The hotel is alittle off, but its VERY close to Central Park which was a delight when you left the hotel in the morning. There is a subway-station not far from the hotel(3blocks) which takes you to Times Square in 10min. Going alot with the subway I found it very easy to travel with, cleaner cars then you expect and wasnt any problems in the cars. So to conclusion. Its an easy but good hotel for its price, is located in a quiet neighbourhood and it takes you only 10min with subways to get you downtown.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: apryl121
Reviews.Content: Our room was not very clean. Furniture looked updated but was worn. Bathroom was clean and updated, except for the worn toilet seat (paint rubbed off). We were on the first floor as to avoid the small, slow elevator. Overall, the price for Manhattan is great. But you get what you pay for. Extremely basic and shabby. Old mattresses (had double room). The size of the room is typical NY- small (but I expected that). The location is nice in that it is right across from the park and very quiet, but the trains are slow (wait time b/w trains is bad) on weekends making it somewhat time consuming to travel downtown. Overall, I didn't find it a very efficient place to stay if you're planning on being everywhere but the UPPER west side (back and forth travel is WAY too time consuming). Staff was good for NYC. I come to the city frequently and have stayed many places. Won't stay here again. Just not clean enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “We went to this hotel for my girlfriends...”
Reviews.Author: Gary-emma
Reviews.Content: We went to this hotel for my girlfriends 21st birthday,it was her first time to the states.the hotel from outside looks ok,inside is very very basic don't expect to much,it needs a very good make over.we did book a grand lit room,there was nothing grand about it,room must have had a bigger bulb init.location wasn't to bad right next to harlum,we had no trouble there,staff wasn't really help full either,just think it's worth spending that little bit more for a better hotel...Gary + Emma..11/06/10

Reviews.Title: “Great place to crash while sightseeing!”
Reviews.Author: Jane E
Reviews.Content: I was staying here with a friend while sightseeing in New York. I was a bit concerned at first as it seemed quite a budget hotel and there doesn't seem to be a website. We were told check wan't until 3pm when we arrived at 2pm having been awake and travelling for nearly 16 hours! We couldn't get a twin room as a 'two-bed room' must be specifically booked. The lift was tiny and extremely slow. The room was basic and small and there isn't any breakfast. However when I told reception that as friends we'd prefer separate beds, they did change us to a "king-bed room", which must have been a super king as the bed was massive and comfortable. The room was clean with air-con; noisy but definitely worth having. The private bathroon had a shower that was powerful and hot. The room was cleaned, with fresh towels, every day. It was also quiet inside and outside of the hotel, apart from the air-con. The Astor was opposite Central Park which was stunning to look at and great to relax in when jet-lagged. There were two subway lines within walking distance making sightseeing easy. There were places to eat and buy snacks within walking distance. I recommend this hotel if you are looking for a quiet, clean, air-conditioned, private, basic hotel just to sleep in while seeing New York.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: Solomon24
Reviews.Content: In June of 2006 my three children (ages 9, 6 & 3) & I stayed at Astor on the Park for our first trip to New York & a long overdue family vacation.
