Astor on the Park is located in a very safe area. I was extremely pleased with the service I received while staying at Astor on the Park. I had originally reserved a room with 1 king size bed, because it was the only room available at the time. However, once we arrived the gentleman gladly gave us a room with 2 double beds, which was actually cheaper than our original room. I have traveled for work & have stayed in many different hotels/motels over the years & compared to other places I have stayed our room was elegantly decorated & very clean. I have always felt a little uneasy while staying at other hotels/motels, but while staying at Astor on the Park, I always felt relaxed & at home. I was extremely please with the nightly rate as well, which was much cheaper than other places in New York. I believe Astor on the Park will always be one of my favorite places to stay. Someday soon I hope I get another chance to visit. We truly enjoyed our stay at Astor on the Park & we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay for the single traveller!”
Reviews.Author: llbdtiberio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 8 days during march 2010 and I was very surprised at the quality of the hotel despite the cheap price. The hotel is located almost at the northern end of Central Park, right below Harlem, the neighbourhood was nice and there are several 24 hour shops, bars and places to eat within 1 block (my recommendation is 110th street West, where there is a fantastic soul food place). The rooms are indeed small but it was very clean and the bed is a big comfortable double bed. The bathroom was tiny but it was clean and the bathtub and shower was fantastic, the staff was even kind enough to explain to me how to turn on the shower as I wasn't too sure. The rooms were also cleaned daily with fresh sheets and towels being provided, the cleaning lady I got ( a spanish lady) was incredibly friendly. The TV provided was not the best however, a few channels were provided, but I was in NYC, who has time to watch TV? One should not expect a view however, my room overlooked a courtyard. The only real issue I had was with the radiator in my room being too hot, but after asking the staff they got it sorted within 20minutes and for the rest of my stay I enjoyed a perfect sleep, no noise, no traffic, just peace. The hotel was easy to find, and being right between 2 subway stops one only has to walk for 3-5mins to get to a subway stop, bonus is that the local subway stations have several lines so one can pretty much grab any train that arrives in order to get to Times Square. The desk staff were incredibly friendly, despite of me arriving very late at night, the nice lady at the front desk was more than helpful and gave me a map with the subway lines on it and showed me where some good resturants and bars were located. Overall, if you're travelling alone, this place is a bargain and I can't wait to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: malyak
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews on here I went ahead and booked the Astor on the Park anyway. Check in was easy and the doorman helped my friends and I bring our suitcases to our room. Yes the elevator was very small. He had to come up separately. It was tight if there were more than 3 people in it but I'm not complaining! When we arrived in our room I was happy to see how neat and tidy everything looked. The sheets were crisp and white and everything was very clean. We ran into a few problems with our toilet not flushing, but a quick call down to the front desk and someone was there to help us within 10 minutes. The service was really quick and efficient the whole time. The hotel itself was very quiet. We didnt run into too many other guests and our room was quiet at night. The subway was reasonably handy, with the hotel being on 107 st and there being a subway at 110st and 103st. We took the 103 st one and we arrived in Columbus Circle (59th) in less than 10 minutes. We picked this hotel only so that we would have somewhere to sleep and it served its purpose well. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone, especially those budget conscious travelers like myself. It is really not even close to being as bad as some have said and I would and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “VERY good for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Chenchomelo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking for an affordable hotel in NYC mainly because we didn't need a fancy hotel since our goal was to make the most of our trip to the city and just use the hotel to rest. Well, Astor on the Park fit the bill and when I go back to NYC I'll definitely stay there again. It's located at the Northwest corner of Central Park and has 2 subway stations only a block and a half away; a bus stop is also very close. The area was quite safe and well lit at night but there weren't too many options to eat at night... except for a convenience store on the same block. The rooms were small but cozy and clean, the bathrooms were very clean and had no problems with leaks, noises or whatever. We switched rooms after our first night since we wanted a room with a view to the park and so we switched the next morning. The view was OK since we stayed in the 2nd floor but it did get a bit noisy at night. The street is not a very busy one but you do get constant traffic and the windows aren't that thick. Still we managed to rest well. All in all: the price was definitely right, transportation was very close by, the area was safe and well lit, clean and cozy and good service in general.

Reviews.Title: “Would have checked out the minute I saw the room, but ....”
Reviews.Author: Artemis2010
Reviews.Content: It was the smallest hotel "room" I have ever seen in my life. We check in around midnight, which may explain why we put on the ground floor (my friend was along the corridor). The room obviously hadn't been used for some time, the sheets were all musty (luckily I had bought my own pillowcase). The TV didn't work, the subway appeared to run under the hotel (at first I thought it was a rock band practicing), couldn't get the shower to work (scalded my hand) - would have checked out straight away but my friend would have been upset and she couldn't afford to move. We were moved to the 6th floor, her room was slightly larger, mine was the same tiny one (but at least no runway underneath) and relatively quiet. Just enough room to lay the suitcase on the floor, but no storage whatsover apart from a wardrobe with no shelves, and no bin, but there was a HUGE ironing board in the wardrobe. At least it was clean, that's about the only good thing you can say about it. Also was boiling hot (heating was off) 9C outside, can't imagine what it's like in the summer. From now on I'm not doing cheap, I don't hate myself that much and can afford better. Don't stay here unless you like it hot and small.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster on the Park!”
Reviews.Author: uptee
Reviews.Content: People, you are better off saving up and staying somewhere where you can enjoy. Poor desk and room service. The best person I have encountered was the Maintennce guy. Also, if you need towels or tissue be sure to call hours in advance, the clerks are very relaxed and laid back. Secondly, the beds are extremely hard and uncomfortable. There is a lingering odor of mildew and/or wet rot in the air . Not to mention the floor boards are so noisy you can hear every step from the room up stairs. The hot water will cause third degree burns so be cautious. A REAL NIGHTMARE!

Reviews.Title: “Great location & price but needs a real makeover”
Reviews.Author: Haraldsenb
Reviews.Content: When i booked this hotell for my NY trip i actually had to send an email just to ensure that the price was right, and it was! When u pay 218$ for 3 nights total for 2 adults for a manhattan hotel it must be a bargain. The location was just perfect with the park across the street, and not that many tourists around. Local breakfast at some of the nearby cafès is recommended. The metro is just around the corner to take you quickly downtown. Our room was situated on the 7th floor and had a "park view". The elevator was a trip of its own but safely took us up and down, but we had to walk a couple of times downstairs because of staff used it when cleaning the rooms and it took ages. The room itself was nothing to cheer about. Small, clean and out of date is three good words to discribe it. The main problem was the combination of heat and the loudness of the aircondition. Outside it was below freezing but our room was a sauna, and when the aircon was on it was like living in a construction site. There was a pipe in our room that was so hot, we were actually a bit worried that it could lite the room on fire. My conclusion is that i actually enjoyed my stay despite the sauna and noise from the aircon, we got "used" to it and we didnt go to NY to stay in our room. Location and price was why we booked this hotell and i would do it again!

Reviews.Title: “I sure do recommend it for budget minded”
Reviews.Author: newmind
Reviews.Content: Astor On The Park hotel was perfect: comfortable, clean, pretty and central. I found it in a web site called easy clickt travel for a very fair price( 30$ for a double room), so I felt lucky :) I sure do recommend it for budget minded.

Reviews.Title: “What a deal for $34/night!”
Reviews.Author: Bon_voyage79
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing for $34/night (through lastminutetravel.com). Wow! It was simple accommodations and far from perfect, but I’ve had much worse accommodations for much more money. I was very happy with this choice. We stayed for a week on the sixth floor and faced the park. It was pretty quiet, and we had plenty of light and a nice view. The biggest problem was the lack of temperature control. We were there in February and the room was sweltering. Though it was below freezing outside, we had to run the air conditioner to avoid burning it up. Luckily there was air conditioning though! It was a little loud and made sleeping a little difficult, but sadly this is a problem I’ve also encountered at hotels much more expensive. The bed was a huge king and reasonably comfortable. It had nice white linens which I appreciated. (Floral and paisley bed spreads scare me as I always wonder what they’re hiding.). There was quite a bit of storage space for luggage in the TV shelving unit and there was room for a chair and nightstands on either side of the bed. It was actually roomier than I imagined and perfectly adequate. The bathroom was fairly nice and included basic toiletries (but no shower cap). The towels and toiletries were only sometimes replaced. (Housekeeping was a bit hit and miss). The shower pressure was good and the water warm. As for entertainment, television was severely lacking, but again for $34/night what do you care? We got a few fuzzy channels but didn’t even get all the networks. We got used to it and didn’t spend too much time watching TV anyway. It looked like the hotel offered wi-fi for a fee. Being on a budget, we didn’t partake. As for location, the hotel is close to the B and C lines that run along Central Park West. When they are running (which was a bit of an issue while we were there because of subway maintenance), they are great. When they are not, it’s a bit of a hike to the 1 on Broadway, but still do-able. There is a lot of cheap food around, which is great – Mama’s for pizza (Amsterdam and 106th) and Wai Lee for Chinese (Amsterdam, between 106th and 107th). It looks like there is plenty more around, but we only sampled a few places. All things considered, I would definitely stay here again. The location was good and the price was right!

Reviews.Title: “So bad that I checked out IMMEDIATELY”
Reviews.Author: filmski84
Reviews.Content: My title pretty much says it all. I was so repulsed by the room upon entering that I immediately called Marriott and booked a room in one of their midtown hotels (using my points). I took me a year and a half to earn the points to cover the cost of two nights in the Marriott (60,000 points), but it was well worth it. To be fair, I do take some of the blame. That is, I should have learned by now that if something seems sketchy, it probably is. That is certainly the case with this hotel. Do yourself an enormous favor: pay an extra $50 and stay in a good hotel. When it comes down to it, you usually can't go wrong with a Marriott, Hilton, or other major chain. Me? I'm sticking with name brands from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel, but beware of dodgy heating”
Reviews.Author: Pete33LeicesterUK
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a very enjoyable 6 nights in NY. Hotel basic but very clean, staff generally helpful, good quiet part of town but only 10 minutes from mid town Manhatten by subway. Central Park on doorstep a great antidote to downtown frenzy. Local area seemed typical non-tourist New York, very mixed, plenty of local deli's and grocery shops, but a fair walk to any proper eating places, though Broadway around Columbia University is cheap and buzzy (about a mile away). Seemed safe and friendly, though very top of the park a bit iffy. Only real gripe is heating and plumbing. Antiquated radiators with only two settings: "too hot" and "off". First night kept awake by horrible intermittent bubbling and buzzing sounds from the radiator, eventually we went down in our nighties and embarrassed the night staff into sending up a workman who sorted the problem by basically turning it off. Various other clonking and grinding noises from pipes as well, but we learned to live with it. Also blocked toilet and leaking radiator in our other room, all sorted out quickly, but more hassle than you would really want. In conclusion, good value, no frills, honest accommodation in a good location, but best to consider carefully if you go in the winter and value your sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Lelya_RU
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Lastminutetravel.com, so until the confirmation, we didnt know the name of the hotel. It turned out to be Astor on the Park and although we were prepared to anything for the price $29 per night (!!!!!), it was far far beyond our expectations! Convenient location - it is 2 minutes walk from 103St Subway station. So it takes either 4 stations to Times Square or $10 / 15 minutes by taxi. Great bathroom! It is literally bathroom - not just shower. This was quite critical, as it was very very cold when we were in NYC, so hot bath in the evening was essential. Room is very small but sufficient. It was cleaned everyday. Friendly staff. The only problem is that we had to turn on heating everytime we came back in the evening, as they switch on during the day. But in the end we just substitutedturning the heating on with hot bath..) If you see a special offer for this hotel, just book it straight away! There are so many things to spend money on in NYC, that it is worth saving on the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel. Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: l0ve2travel85
Reviews.Content: Its a really nice hotel for the money. It was clean, comfortable and well decorated. A great option for anyone on a low budget. My room was small but comfortable, i think it may have been a single as it would be very cosy for two people. The bathroom again very small but the shower was very powerful. It did go hot and cold at times though. Hotel is located in Upper West side, near to the top of Central Park. Its too far to walk to all of the main attractions but has two subway stations within a few minutes walk. The subway is cheap and easy to use. Costs around $12-15 in a taxi. A couple of things could be improved 1. The hotel is a little noisy. I had a water pipe running through my bathroom, everytime someone put the water on above my room it was very loud. Strange clicking noices and i could also hear the shower, hairdryer from next doors room. 2.The room was a little rough around the edges, carpets a bit frayed, paint on the mirrors. Just a few really minor things. 3. The lift is small and slow. I was only on the 4th floor so used the stairs to get to my room. When i needed to use the lift to take my case down to reception i had to wait for about 10 minutes to use it. If none of the above would bother you, it is a great place to stay. Great value for money. This was my third time in New York and the hotel is just as nice as some of the more expensive hotels i have stayed at. Although a little out of the way. Worth the extra travelling for the money you save staying here.

Reviews.Title: “the radiator's drum solo”
Reviews.Author: purplesneakers
Reviews.Content: The reason i am giving this hotel two stars when individually the lowest is three is because of this.... My sister and i stayed here during january.. we were very surprised at the friendliness of some of the staff and the room was fine.. small but what you expect for paying so little and we came to new york for new york not the hotel room.. the first nights sleep i get woken up at 3am by a rapping.. thought it was my sister and went back to sleep... we both woke up again at 4am to a loud rhythmic drumming coming from the radiator... this continued until 5:30am... it was a mix between a drum solo and ball bearing popcorn exploding.... not only this but from a nozzle was spurting boiling water straight next to a power outlet.... after not being able to take it any longer we rang reception and was met with a guy claiming that this was happening in EVERY ROOM (we were on the second floor) of the hotel... which means everyone was awake because it would of been near impossible to sleep through that... by 5:30 the room was so hot we went outside for fresh air and to complain in person.. the guy behind the reception looked frazzled and assured us there was nothing he nor we could do to make it stop... by the time we got back up stairs it had finished for the night... and we attempted to go back to sleep... the second night we didn't have an issue.. but the third night of our stay we were woken up again by the radiator splattering boiling water again (and there is an outlet right near this) and the drumming.. however it only lasted half an hour and we were able to get back to sleep.... i really think this hotel falls under the "you get what you pay for" catergory and if you are in new york city for new york city then this is perfect... however don't go in winter for fear of the radiator's drumming solo.....

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in NYC - TOTALY RECOMENDED!!! I Swear!!”
Reviews.Author: Alexmilky
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC in the las september, and what I have to say about this hotel is: If you wanna stay in a charming, confortable, very clean, with a very good localization, and with good rates, it's perfect! So, you're gonna stay in front of Central Park, wich is great! There is a subway station very close to the hotel, it's about 10 minutes from Times Square! The staff is friendly and helpfull! Every time you get back to your room IT'S GONNA BE CLEAN!! There is a Cafe(L’exquisitus Café), right over the corner, that is a very nice place to have your breakfast, IT IS DELICIOUS!!! It was the best trip of my life, and this hotel was part of it!!! I hope to inspire you that is looking for some help to choose a hotel in a city like New York. Regards, Alex

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we wanted!”
Reviews.Author: 000Mari Posted by a Finn traveler
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a low budget, clean, basic, safe, nice and easy hotel - this is perfect. (for luxery, big rooms and extra facilities you have to pay more.) We are a young couple who looked for a clean, basic central hotel, and I'm glad we picked Astor. Very close to the metro, easy to get to the center of NY. And you could walk across the street and into central park, which we did:) We came early in the morning are the room wasn.t supposed to be ready for 7 more hours, but the staff arranged so we got a room after only 30min and could sleep off our jetlag. They were also very helpful when we had some trouble with a stolen credit card(not from the hotel). Great service - both day and night. The beds were good, and we slept well. the bathroom was nice and the hole room was clean. We had a geat stay. New York is not for spendig time in your hotel room - it's everything outside the hotel, and it's load of other things to use your money on!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Sambaez
Reviews.Content: A basic but pleasant hotel, well located next to Central Park, nearby Natural History Museum. (Seems to be far from city centre, but you can easily get there taking the subway, two blocks ahead).The rooms are tiny, but very clean (very comfortable bed), with a nice bathroom,The staff is very friendly and helpful.Nice stay for low prices. Internet access (from the hotel computer only) and coffee/snacks machines in the basement foor. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “ok but wouldnt stay again”
Reviews.Author: alichremi
Reviews.Content: Stayed last week but given the choice you have in NYC i wouldnt stay again. it was a little way out from the main tourist attractions. True it was very clean with a nice bathroom, cant moan about that but we wew on the second floor at the front over the reception. it was noisy you could hear the people, the roar from the subway underground. The walls were thin, you could here next door and one night the big bathroom pipe clanked loud for over an hr.. i also found the parts of the hotel a bit shabby. So all in all. Pay a few more dollars and get a bit better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “value/location/clean”
Reviews.Author: perry6162
Reviews.Content: This hotel is for those looking for location,price,and cleanliness, not 5 star. This hotel was on central park west, 2 blocks from a subway, basic but clean, helpful staff, fuzzy tv reception, private bath, requested room with a balcony and overlooking central park, got both. Paid with tax $134 in nyc november. I saw hostels with shared bathrooms for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with very friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: BublaSurrey
Reviews.Content: stayed at this hotel for a long weekend of shopping and sightseeing. The location is great, the room wasn't the biggest but it was very clean and maids came in everyday. All the staff were extremely helpful and friendly, especially Sam the doorman, lovely guy! The subway is a five minute walk from the hotel. Basically, the hotel is clean, cheap and cheerful and i would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: SamH6
Reviews.Content: This hotel is opposite central park and subway into the centre only 3 blocks away. Me and my friend stayed here. Clean, own bathroom, room small but we didn't spend much time there, just somewhere to sleep and wash. Hotel staff very helpful, we booked our sightseeing bus tour at hotel. Great little diner about 2 blocks away recommended by hotel and they even booked our cab back to airport, which was the same price as yellow cab but a licoln car, looked liked a limo. Price was good and couldn't fault this place. Definately recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent locations, and even better price!”
Reviews.Author: Beck048
Reviews.Content: After searching for weeks for a hotel I could afford for my first trip to the city, I had all but given up when I came across the Astor for only $55 dollars a night! I was weary of the quality or location of the hotel because it was so cheap, but it was perfect. The room was small, but perfect for me and my boyfriend. We even had a veiw of the park (which was directly across the street) and of the city, though it was far away. It was a nice quit snowy couple of nights. There are some good places to eat right arounfd the corner too. Im going back this december and we've booked this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for the Money”
Reviews.Author: vs1942
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights on our trip to NYC and found the hotel to be clean, the staff extremely helpful. The hotel is similar to many European hotels at which we stayed in the past. The location was good when you can't afford the $300 plus a night per person to stay in Manhattan, or don't wish to spend that kind of money. Although there is no breakfast at the hotel there are restaurants within easy walking distance from the hotel and the neighborhood is clean and safe. We did not use the subway, which is only a few blocks away, because it was down for maintenance but we found the cab fares to downtown and Manhattan to be reasonable. We definitely would stay there again if we visited New York.

Reviews.Title: “Minimalist accomodations”
Reviews.Author: isles_123
Reviews.Content: I booked a one-night stay at this hotel on a whim through lastminutetravel.com at an obscenely low rate. Check-in was painless at about 2:30 p.m. on a weekday afternoon; I was offered smoking or non-smoking room at that time. I was not given a room with a view of the park as I requested upon booking, but I did not make an issue of it because I did not intend to spend much time in the room (other than for sleeping). I checked out at about 7 a.m., and waited only a few minutes for a clerk (shift change). All the staff I encountered were very pleasant and friendly. Room: I was given a room with two beds, and there was more than enough room for my stuff (solo traveler). Storage space was limited to a wall unit that doubles as a TV stand. The bathroom looked modern, and was immaculate just like the rest of the room. As with many older buildings, the hot water took several minutes to become available. I did not wait longer than one minute for the elevator, although the car does move quite slow. Then again, I only saw one other guest during my stay, so the hotel was probably far from booked. Location: Just opposite several entrances to the north end of Central Park (between 106th and 107th on Central Park West), which is beautiful and relaxing with its ponds and wooded trails. The area is quite populated even during off-hours of the evening, and with the seemingly posh doorman buildings along most of the drag, it does not seem to attact many troublemakers. The B and C subways stops are located on the same block at 103rd and 110th Streets...very convienient. The 103rd Street station actually has a live person in the ticket booth (for tourists that need help, etc.); I did not use the 110th Street station. It is about a 15 minute ride to midtown on either line. I walked around the area to survey the restaurants and, quite honestly, I did not find any places I would have went into if I needed a meal. Bottom line: If you can snag this hotel for $50-$100 per night, I do not think you will be disappointed. Other than internet access in the lobby, the hotel offers no ammenities. So if you need all the creature comforts (like more than 10 TV channels), I recommend that you book a room at a chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Efficient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: piggipiggy
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal to this hotel through lastminutetravel.com and was happy to get a room with a private bath for the price of a hostel in NYC! The hotel is located on 106th and Central Park West, it is convenient to 110th and 103rd subway stations as well as plenty of buses that run near by. We arrived really early in NYC since we caught a red eye plane and we showed up at the hotel around 9am to drop off our bags. We were initially told we couldn't check in until 1pm at the earliest. My husband had to do some last minute stuff for work so we sat downstairs in their small computer station area. The manager saw that we were waiting for a room and was able to give us a room around 11:30 am. The room was small, a bit claustrophobic after the two of us were in the room with our luggage but it served its purpose as just a place to sleep for us. The private bathroom was small but clean. The shower glass was only half way so it made taking a shower a bit harder since I was trying to make sure I was splashing all over the place. The staff was friendly and we saw mostly European tourists around. It is an old building converted into a hotel so you can hear people walking above you and the water pipes going. It's a bit further from all the action but the subway and buses are just right outside and it was really nice to stroll to Central Park across the street. We didn't spend much time in our room so it sufficed our need for a place to crash at night.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for it's money, but it just isn't a 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: h0rsewithn0name
Reviews.Content: While LastMinuteTravel claims this to be a 3 star hotel, it just isn't. If you're looking a 2-ish-star hotel with private facilities, this is fine for the money. Near a subway station that will bring you fast into mid- and downtown Manhattan, affordable, and clean enough.

Reviews.Title: “Astor on the Park represents good value for money and forms the ideal base for sightseeing in New York”
Reviews.Author: AandDOnTour
Reviews.Content: First let's get the negative points out of the way. Yes, the lift is slow and sometimes it is easier to use the stairs. Some of the rooms are small, but all are clean and each bathroom is decorated to a high standard, the hotel having been refurbished in 2005. The individual air conditioning units fitted in each room are effective but a little noisy. There are no other facilities at the hotel apart from the bedrooms, a reception area and a drinks machine and Internet station (expensive) in the basement. Now the positive points about this friendly small hotel. It is well placed on Central Park West and is very reasonably priced. The staff all tended to be friendly and helpful and were happy to engage in conversation and offer advice on places to go and things to see. The hotel is frequented mainly by European guests making it feel comfortable for other visitors from the UK/Europe. Being able to walk out of the hotel and straight into the park is a real bonus. Even at the north end, the park is really well used, with many joggers and people exercising during daylight hours. It is a relatively short walk across the park to the Guggenheim Museum (at 90th Street on the east side). The hotel is very well placed for the subway (B and C lines) being located between the stops at 103rd and 110th Street (110th Street is slightly closer). A trip to downtown takes around 10-15 minutes, and with a weekly ticket for the subway and buses ($27) makes getting around NewYork cheap and easy. There is a very modern and well-stocked Supermarket on 110th Street (Cathedral View) and a small American dinner one block back on 107th Street (La Exquisite) that is convenient for breakfast with a typical meal of omelettes and coffee costing around $10/head. A short walk away from Central Park down Louis Armstrong Avenue (and across Manhattan, Columbus, and Amsterdam Avenues) brings you to Broadway which has a good range of reasonable restaurants at sensible prices. The area between Central Park West and Broadway is a little rundown, although it seemed safe enough to us. Two other places worth mentioning that are within easy reach of the hotel are The Hungarian Pastry Shop (near the junction of 110th and Amsterdam Avenue) for cakes and coffee and Miss Mimmis Café (on the corner of 110th and Columbus Avenue) for a really good taste of a Southern kitchen. Overall, we had a really good stay at the Astor on the Park Hotel and would certainly stay there again in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value hotel”
Reviews.Author: EdinTraveller_9
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel and then looking at the reciews, I was a bit nervous about arriving. We arrived after a long flight and nearly as long journey from the airport (don't book a shared cab as we were the last stop after battling rush hour traffic!). The staff were friendly and welcoming. While the room we had was at the back of the hotel, so no view, the room was clean and we were surprised at how quiet it was! As we were tired after the trip the receptionist ordered us a pizza which was delivered straight to our room. Although you are a bit out of the centre, being able to cross the road straight into central park for a jog or walk was wonderful. There is a small cafe just on the corner of where the hotel is for breakfast pancakes or bagles. As there are 2 subway stations on 103rd and 110th streets (less than 5 mins walk away) it is quick to get to the action downtown. A taxi back from Times Sq is approx $11, so not too bad for getting back at the end of a night. I would certainly recommend this hotel for those people on a budget who aren't bothered about travelling on the subway to get to the hub of the city.

Reviews.Title: “WYSIWYG - Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Stabsy
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is pretty simple, but very clean. It was cleaned everyday, new linnen and towels also every day. Air conditionning was a bit stressed, but worked (Pretty loud). Very friendly staff. The location is very nice, directly opposite Central Park, and within 5 walking minutes to subway and bus. So ideal for sightseeing in Manhattan. Cheap Shops and Restaurants in walking distance. We were absolutely satisfied. If you do not mix Astor with Astoria and expect the low price for the latter, you will be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: buttercupnewyork
Reviews.Content: My husband, 15 yr old daughter and I recently spent 7 nights at the Astor and were very satisfied with the accommodation, which was basic but very clean and fitted our needs for somewhere to sleep after very long hectic days. The staff were friendly and helpful. I loved the location of the hotel which is opposite the park, and in walking distance of the Mornington Heights area which is very Hispanic and has the most amazing restaurants. After the noise of the city the Hotel was a great place to retire to, with very little outside noise from our room at the back, so a perfect nights sleep. The Hotel is located between two subway stations 103 and 109th Street which were great for getting in to the hub of the city . I would deffinately, recommend this hotel is you want good value for money and somewhere just to lay your head.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy a quiet respite close to the hustle and bustle of NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Horizons09
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Astor on the Park for three nights and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. We booked a king room at a very inexpensive rate and had a nice room with a view of Central Park directly across the street. For those who wish to take in the Bright Lights, Big City, you can easily take the subway 3 blocks away and be in Times Square within 15 minutes. This is a great hotel for those who do not wish to duplicate the "big box" experience of the large chain hotels and instead want a more low-key, European-style hotel. The neighborhood around Astor on the Park on the Upper West Side of NYC is one of the selling features of this hotel. Walk or jog around the Central Park Reservoir, rent a row boat or sit by the lake at the Boat House Restaurant bar and enjoy a drink or snack. Within walking distance or a short subway ride uptown are the Metropolitan Museum of Art, the Cathedral of St. John Divine (the largest cathedral in the world), Grant's tomb, Columbia University and Tom's Restaurant---the diner which inspired the setting for the Seinfeld TV series. The room was not grandiose, but it was clean, quiet and comfortably cozy. The multilingual staff was extremely helpful and courteous and gave us their utmost personal attention. The Astor on the Park serves as a great base for exploring New York City and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pay a little more and stay some where else.”
Reviews.Author: Ra1nBoWs
Reviews.Content: Many of the reviews about this hotel rave about its location. Well the location aint great. The Hotel is situated around about 105th street. So thats atleast a 1 hour walk from Times Sq (60 blocks away). The subway station might not be far, but there are no bars/restaurants around this hotel, so you will spend every morning and every evening on the metro. That said, when i got to this hotel, i did not even stay here. I booked a twin room (travelling with my father) and on arrival was given a small double room. The bed was not even a double bed. The woman at reception had the cheek to send us up to the room, knowing it was not a twin room. The room was dark, and looked pretty unclean. My father did say the bathroom was ok, but i never looked at it. I was straight down to complain. I showed the woman on reception my printed hotel booking showing i had paid for a twin room, capable of sleeping up to 4 people. Did she care? No. She said, on our booking form it shows a double room. Great customer relations. I asked if they could move us into a twin. She said they were fully booked. So i was forced to move to a different hotel, and i did not get a refund. I am claiming for a refund through my credit card. Many have mentioned this is a budget hotel. Well it's not that cheap. We moved to a hotel opposite madisson Sq garden on 34th street, right in the middle of the action. Yes we had to pay around £125 more for 4 nights, but it was worth it. Just because this is NY dont think, this hotel is good value. The hotel is in a bad location. Its only close to the park. You will have to get on the subway morning and night, and the room i got looked awful. There are plenty of cheaper and better located hotels in NY. Dont be fooled by these positive reviews. This hotel is rubbish. I was fooled by these reviews, "great location". I guess these people have never been to NY before, or simply dont know much about big cities. The location sucked. The hotel sucked. The girl on reception sucked.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT RATES AND VERY CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: peitraveller21
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights loved it the rates were great and very clean just a couple blocks to the subway and right across form Central Park. Only suggestion is to take a cab to the hotel when u have luggage as the subway that was close didn't have an elevator but the cab to the port authourity was only $12.00. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: anners2006
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed for a week at astor on the park and considering we payed a very low price for the stay we were absolutely delighted with the hotel. the service was excellent and the really nice porter helped us with our bags to our rooms straight out of the taxi. i had a fairly small room but with 2 very comfortable double beds and myself and my friend were never on top of each other and the bathroom was roomy, modern and very clean. rooms were cleaned and beds changed every day. my other friends had 2 double beds also in a nice large room with view on the park. there was never a problem with noise, not even with the air conditioning. there are vending machines and internet facilities as well as an atm and the staff was excellent and always ready to help (24h/7). we felt like we had to leave a good review as we thought the hotel deserved it. never mind the bad reviews, but if you want luxury then you have to pay for it. the location was nice as it was by central park and in a quiet neighbourhood but within 5min from subway and with bars and restaurants. all we can say is that we will definitely stay there again! (we are 30yr old and have travelled a lot and stayed in a lot of budget places but this one beat them all )

Reviews.Title: “I recommend it”
Reviews.Author: AlonsoLeao
Reviews.Content: Small, clean, nice. I've been to hotel all over the world and this fits perfectly in its category. The location is much better than what I had expected. Walking distance to everywhere. No Restaraunt, but there are plenty of cafés and dinners that did not fail to please. I would not only recommend it, I'd go back to it. Exactly what I was expecting. A place to stay in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Is it me !”
Reviews.Author: paulsno1
Reviews.Content: Why do people expect so much when they know they only paid peanuts! I travelled to New York with my son back in April , and like a lot of people I had a budget . Eventually I found the Astor. (readers remember its a budget hotel you get exactly what you pay for !) We arrived about 11.00am , after a cab ride from the airport JFK (expensive!) the driver knew exactly the hotel location. The hotel is on a main road but this doesnt effect you're stay, the reception is light and airey for a smaller hotel , we were greeted by a very helpful manager and even though we were early for checkin he found the room was ready so straight in ! we were on the fourth floor the room itself was functional quiet and clean , and a maid daily, we didnt have much of a view but who needs that in New York ! and the location is excellant right across the road from central park with subway stations a couple of blocks away , which get you to the heart of Times Square in about 15/20 mins. As in all US hotels it was room only so the Astor is perfect for people on a budget like me , I don't quite know what a lot of people expect when the arrive , I read things like 'DISASTOR ON THE PARK' whats the matter with you why dont you stay in downtown Manhatten and pay hundreds of dollars a night . Locally there are cafes and shops and you feel like you are in a local area as aposed to a tourist trap ! Hope this helps most wont be dissapointed , just remember how much you paid ! and it in NYC

Reviews.Title: “Some of these reviewers must have stayed somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: tip43rr
Reviews.Content: This place is fine. Not really near any amenities but only 3 blks. from subway. Modern, functional and clean. Absolutely OK!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter3170
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at this hotel in mid-May. The room was small but functional. We got clean sheets & towels everyday. We did not have a view on the park but that was okey. Reading the reviews about the noise at night got me a bit worried but we did not have any problems. No noise whatsoever. Staff was friendly & helpful. The room could use some new paint though. The nearest subway is on 103rd street, maybe a 3 minute walk. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of peace in a big, busy city”
Reviews.Author: isie1980
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right opposite Central Park. For a fabulous introduction to NYC we walked the length of the park and into the city. If the hotel had been closer we'd have missed half the park, it's so big. Within a 3 minute walk you can jump on the Subway for a 10 minute ride to Times Square, or practically right outside the hotel you can catch a bus and from there you can get anyway at all on Manhatten Island for $2 - and it really helps you get your bearings and see places. We got the bus everywhere and really enjoyed seeing the various parts of the city that'd we'd have missed from the subway. The hotel location is great. Just a short, easy ride into the city and all the major attractions yet sufficiently far away to be able to get a quiet night's sleep. A taxi home at night was very reasonably priced, but the night-bus was equally ok, just took slightly longer. Some reviews state the hotel and being in Harlem which conjures up some pretty negative feelings - don't worry! This hotel and surroundings felt very safe, there is a cafe a 2 min walk up the road which serves fab sandwiches, snacks and breakfasts and is a fantastic place to sit with real New-Yorkers and get a feel for the place - cheap internet access here too. The hotel reception desk, stairwell and lift seem a little small and tired, but the rooms are great. Small, yes. But big enough to unpack and leave your stuff considering that pretty much all you'll be doing there is sleep and wash. The bed was huge - I didn't even know my husband was sharing it with me! It was also very comfy and perfect for a good night's sleep after being on your feet all day. The bathroom was good - clean and everything in good working order with some lovely complimentary toilettries. In the basement you can get snacks, canned drinks and hot drinks from vending machines as well as internet access. We ordered pizza one night and Dominoes delivered right to the room - fantastic when you're exhausted! We stayed in the Astor on the Park for 7 nights, and both agree we would definitely stay there again. For 500 quid each including flights it was a bargain of a holiday and the hotel far exceeded our expectations - especially after we'd read some of the reviews! We were actually on our honeymoon, and whilst it wasn't chocolates on the pillow or rose-petal baths for two, it was a fabulous base from which to explore the city and we'd made a conscious decision to save our pennies for the sight-seeing. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel for the budget-conscious traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a bit more & stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jopea
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel which at the time was listed as 3 star, I would say it is probably a 1 or 2 star. Although it was clean, that's pretty much all I could say for it. The noisy pipes kept me up ALL night, I seriously have not slept so badly in all my life and I live in Central London so I am used to noise, but repetitive banging that ranges in tempo and times is like being in a torture chamber. The room size is small but that didn't bother me, but it got really hot, there is an air conditioning unit, but it is very noisy and level with my side of the bed, as soon as you turned it off it was boiling hot again. The staff weren't particuarly friendly or un-friendly, they were mostly indifferent. When I complained about the noise, they said they couldn't do anything about it. I didn't feel too comfortable in this hotel and was glad that I was on the 7th floor, I can't say it was unsafe but it didn't seem that anyone would know who was a visitor in this hotel and who wasn't, as the reception is in the corner away from the entrance and the stairs and lift are directly in front. The lift was broke for about 3 days of our 7 day trip which meant going up and down the narrowest staircase you have ever seen. This was particuarly frustrating when we had our luggage as we had to wait for about 45 minutes just so we could get in the lift when there was nobody in it, luckily we gave ourselves enough time to get to the airport. It's a long walk from Times Square, but not unbearable, we pretty much travelled by the subway during the day and got a taxi back at night. In hindsight, it probably would have worked out the same price if we had booked a hotel closer to the centre, because we would have saved on taxi fares and we probably would have done more evening activities. There isn't much around in terms of restaurants and places to eat breakfast etc.. We had to wait to get into the centre. If you are expecting a 1 star hotel you will be pleasantly surprised, if you are expecting a 3 star you will be bitterly dissappointed. My advice is spend a little more and stay closer to the centre, you'll probably find it will be the same price overall.

Reviews.Title: “A balanced review”
Reviews.Author: kevb1964
Reviews.Content: Having booked the hotel on the spur of the moment I was a little concerned by some of the critical reviews that I read. I am pleased to say that my concern was unnecessary and we thoroughly enjoyed the stay.Firstly the staff were very friendly,helpfuland professional even when faced with my dopey questions all of which were answered quickly. The decor of the hotel is far from plush which might concern those to whom this is important however personally I found it to be clean and tidy. Our room was adequate in size and comfortable certainly larger than I expected having read some reviews .There isn't much closet space however we were content to operate out of suitcases which worked very well.The bathroom was a decent size and well cleaned (as was room ) every day.We also had a good view of Central Park just over the road. The hotel has subway which is very good 2 blocks away however if you are the type that prefers walking out the hotel door into the main city/nightlife then this hotel is probably a little to far out for you .There are some shops, cafes (which deliver to hotel and decent menu in hotel room) however you have a decent walk or short taxi ride to livelier areas in the evening . I would recommend the walk in the park opposite however as it is very scenic

Reviews.Title: “what can i say”
Reviews.Author: CUDDLESJ4U
Reviews.Content: my husband booked this trip to new york as a surprise for me and i must admit after reading the reviews on the hotel i was not looking forward to it at all. However, on the day we arrived it was very hot, the arrogant taxi driver who had picked us up from the airport had dropped us two blocks away from the hotel and after lugging heavy cases i was very hot by the time we got there. We checked in and went to our room and i was pleasantly surprised. The air con was on and room was lovely and cool. The room was clean and beds clean and very comfortable, i have never slept so well...lol The bathroom was spotless as was the room, there was plenty of space too. We were on the fourth floor and had a lovely view of central park from our window. The tv reception was not brilliant but we were not there to watch tv. The staff were very pleasant and helpful at all times and the one problem we had was dealt with within 5 minutes. As for the lift its not that small i have stayed in 4star hotels with smaller lifts. All in all we had a fantastic time so please dont let bad reviews put you off. Theres two subways close by both within walking distance. The only complaint i have is i did not like going under the lincoln tunnel, all the fumes from the traffic was bad. We had a lovely driver at the end of our stay who on the way back to the airport took us over the bridge instead and avoided the tunnel. We had a brilliant week and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: wildchick
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for the money; it is a BUDGET hotel, but saying that the bathroom and free toiletries were very good!! now some tips for this hotel: 1) you have two subways stations very close to you: 103rd and 110th street: both go on the B train! use them, the walk from central park to times square is quite long - very nice but long! 2) for a shower pull the bath tap nossel (??) down when thewater is on and the shower works! thats how we got it to work :D 3) In the lobby to the hotel there are stairs right beside the front door; down there are computers, vending machines and a phone card machine. I hope this helps, it is a good clean hotel, we did not have one problem and any issues with the heating are fixed especially in room 712. We did not have problem with noise; i am a light sleeper and I was only woken up once by funny noises coming from the pipes and managed to go back to sleep within 10 mins. Hope you enjoy this and dont worry about all the bad reviews, it is not quite as bad a hostel!

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for something cheap it's perfect”
Reviews.Author: nurahmc
Reviews.Content: Myself and 3 friends stayed there for 4 nights at the end of Feb. We were aged between 23-25 and weren't fussy. We were only looking for somewhere to sleep and leave our bags. After reading the reviews I wasn't looking forward to it. When we got there we were pleasantly surprised. The room were tiny but clean and warm and the bathroom was nice. The bed was fairly small too but very comfortable. We asked on the second night for a smoking room and we came home to find they had moved everything for us - great. The lift was very slow & I nearly gave myself a coronary climbing to the top floor. The radiators did bang very bad a night but we copped on after the first night and turned them off going to bed & on in the morning which worked, the room was always warm. It was about a 10-15 min taxi ride from Times Square but we got the sub way which is only a 2 min walk away. It looks out over Central Park but unfortunately our room we changed to didn't have a view. We left the hotel every morning around 8 & didn't come back til late so it suited us. If you want somewhere cheap it's perfect. Next time I will try to get closer to the Times Sq etc if I can afford it. I would not recommend to for someone who is going to spend all their time in the room, and i definitely wouldn't recommend it to someone snobby or fussy.

Reviews.Title: “This place should be shut down!”
Reviews.Author: kongbooster
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here! Any positive review cannot be legitimate. I made the mistake of using an awful opaque site (Lastminutetravel) and thought I was getting a three star. Sure enough this place lived up to its 1-star class as listed here. So much was wrong I'm not sure where to start. The room was lime green with florescent lighting that made the place feel like a prison waiting room. Repairs had been done to the walls and ceiling, yet they had not repainted. There was NO HEAT! I asked about it and all they could offer was an extra blanket. From other reviews below, their lack of heating is a permanent situation. The cable TV was on the fritz. Only three channels came thru clearly. The bathroom had a nasty odor, probably from the mildew. There was an ironing board, but no iron. I requested one and they gave me a corroded iron that left a copper stain on the tissue I wiped against it. It would have ruined my shirt had I used it. The bed was extremely hard and uncomfortable. The tiny elevator must be powered by a hamster wheel as it takes forever to move from floor to floor. There's a view of the park... BUT the windows are so filthy you can barely tell. Oh, and you'll have to listen to the people in the bathroom next door when they do their bizness cuz the walls aren't sound-absorbing in the slightest. The Astor on the Park is the place to recommend to your enemies. Seriously, I cannot stress enough that this place is worse than setting up a tent in Central Park. And please be wary of using opaque sites when booking in NYC. (I just checked out of the place two hours ago and I'm so upset by my experience that I had to write this immediately to blow off some steam.)

Reviews.Title: “a cheap and basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovethecityantwerp
Reviews.Content: the rooms are small but comfy enough because you are mostly outside. In the middle of the night we've heard some loude noise from the heating en it was very disturbing. The night after, we've shut our heating off so we could sleep, but we've asked for an portable heating in the room and we did get it. the staff is friendly and helpfull. i will recomend this hotel for people who are just sleeping in the hotel and are willing to live back to basics for a couple off days.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: jasperLondonderry
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in Dec 2008 although we booked for 7 nights we only stayed 1 The room was very small and the bathroom had a pipe running from floor to ceiling one of our party caught hold of this whilst climbing out of the bath and got a nasty burn, the bed linen and towels appeared to be clean but the carpet was very dusty when we complained to staff they laughed at us and said 'it is New York' the corridors and stairwells are grimey and very narrow and their is only one lift for staff and guests, the air conditioning could not be adjusted and the room was extremely hot, this hotel should be reclassified as a hostel and to anyone thinking of staying here I would say don't.

Reviews.Title: “Astor on the Park - the good and the bad”
Reviews.Author: geepee7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is up near 128th Street, quite a few stops up from say 51st where it all happens! That said ,it's an easy journey on the subway and the view from our window was a snowy park - beautiful! Our room was painted in lime green (so you didn't need a hangover in the morning - that's for sure!) and tiny for the two double beds they put in there (for the three of us - two adults and grown up son) which left no room even for a chest of drawers! Nothing in the bathroom next to the sink to put your stuff on but - hey - it was relatively cheap for a hotel within easy reach of downtown Manhattan. There was internet connection but that was definitely not cheap. Worst thing was that for two of the four days we stayed, the lift stopped working. We were on the 8th floor and the only way down was a narrow, marble stepped staircase with NO handrail - pretty treacherous when hauling down three heavy suitcases! However, all in all it served us ok - doorman was friendly and helpful. Certainly have stayed in much better hotels but for the price and location - not too bad providing you have a sense of humour (oh, and adventure!!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Doogle123
Reviews.Content: We were given a large room with two double beds overlooking the streets. I asked to be moved to a Park view, which we did the next day. I was pleased as that night in the big room was spent with loud banging coming from the heating, but thought we were lucky to be moving anyways so didn't complain. Our Park view room was small but very clean BUT the banging was still there which went on around 5AM was even louder. We put up with it,... both our rooms were on the 7th floor. The staff are excellent and very very helpful and the subway is 2 mins walk away. I would recommend ear plugs, but take a chance as you can find this hotel at bargain prices.

Reviews.Title: “The worst I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: businesstraveller095
Reviews.Content: Arrived to be given a basement room with one small window looking on to a grubby dirty void full of rubish. Room was dark, depressing and very very small. I asked to be moved but was told that it was not possible until the morning. Tired and fed up I went to bed only to be kept awake most of the night by a strange clanking noise coming from pipework outside the window. The next day I demanded to be moved and was given a room on the 4th floor. This room was bigger and had a view of the park, but the window frame was broken and the window had dropped and so did not fully close which meant apart from the fact that it was letting in the cold (5 degrees F outside) it was also noisey from the traffic on the main road (even 4 floors up). Additionally the central heating did not work. When I complained I was given a plug in oil filled radiator. After failing to convince myself that I could suffer staying in this room I demanded another move. This time I was moved to the 11th floor to what I believe to be one of the best rooms in the hotel. This room was bigger and the window did close and I couldn't hear the traffic. However the heating still didn't work (luckily I had taken the plug in radiator from the previous room with me) and there was no heating what-so-ever in the bathroom. When I questioned why the central heating was not working I was told that the hotel policy is to only turn on the heating boiler when guests complain about being cold. Firstly, I don't think that approach quite grasps the basics of hospitality and secondly, this was the coldest January for 5 years, how could they expect us not to be cold with night temperatures of 3 degrees F (-16c). This place is a dump. The only positive thing I can say is that the staff were sympathetic to my complaints and acknowledged them without any dispute. Every day I saw and heard guests at the reception desk complaining about something or other. In 30 years of travel this is the worst hotel I have stayed in and I don't expect 5 stars at this price, but I do expect something along the standards of a travel lodge or a premier inn. This place was way way down on that standard. With broken window frames, peeling paint and no heating I get the impression that the owners of this hotel don't care at all about guest comfort or satifaction.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money with caring and very helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LadyL44
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights in this hotel after having cruised to New York from the UK. In all honesty after being on a luxury ship and then arriving in the hotel`s lobby and seeing corridors with painted brick walls I was not impressed. However, my first impression was wrong. Our room was newly decorated, spotlessly clean and comfortable. The bathroom was also newly fitted with marble and glass and there were complimentary toiletries by Gilcrist and Soames. All the staff went out of their way to be helpful and the Manager, Ari, was exceptional. The situation across from Central Park was stunning and covered in snow.Getting around was easy and the restaurants recommended by the hotel were excellent. We would definitely stay there again. Lynne and Peter C.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: Shooterz
Reviews.Content: Having just returned from NY and staying at the Astor on the Park myself and my husband were happy with this hotel for what we paid to stay there. Having read some of the reviews we were a bit aprehensive of what to expect but were pleasantly surprised. We took our 3 year daughter with us and our main thing was that it was clean. And one thing that can not be said about this hotel is that it wasnt clean. The room we stayed in was on the 10th floor looking out onto Central Park and had a kingsize bed in it and bunkbeds. The room wasnt massive but it was ample for what we needed as we only slept in there! The staff by far were very very friendly and very helpful, they couldnt do enough for you and made us and our daughter feel very welcome at all times. We would definatley stay there again and would recommed it to others for a CLEAN WARM place to stay whilst visiting NY. The Hotel is at the top end of Central Park but a Taxi into Times square was around $15 and was there in just over 5 mins. All in all a good CHEAP WARM FRIENDLY place to stay.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location Good Room Good Price”
Reviews.Author: wonderingwandererHK
Reviews.Content: New York: Astor on the Park - Good Location, Good Room, Good Price! Date of Stay: 18-19 Dec 2008 Reviwer: Wandering wondererhk Room was small but very clean. You will love the toilet and bath tub as it appears to be newly rennovated or well kept. We were put in a room with a king-sized bed facing Central Park. I would agree with the other reviews that there is not much room to put big bags but we just had backpacks so it was no problem for us. Staff were very helpful in giving tips and directions on how to go around and where to get some eats. Locationwise, it is just three blocks from the 103rd street subway station. The M10 bus is also just on the next street. I took the Airtrain-subway from the Airport and did ot find any trouble finding the place. It is located in a quiet stretch of the Upper West Side, amongst apartment buildings mostly. Family friendly I should say. I was with my 9-year old daughter on this trip. Central park is just across the street! For food, you can walk one block and you will see a bunch of delis and other restaurants. Walk further to Broadway St (4 blocks from hotel), you will find more restaurants and shops. Via the www.agoda.com website, I got a pretty good deal for a stay 18-19 Dec 2008, at an unbelievable rate of US$62! Cannot beat that!. Only drawback I can say about the hotel is the heater. As it was freezing while we were there, I opened the heater of course but between 2am and 5am, it got very noisy, like trying to literally blow its steam (I think). Overall, value for money and location, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great, Great Value, Great location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissBNI
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were heading to New York for a wee holiday and were looking some cheap to stay, After spending hours going through various websites we found this hotel. and booked it. Due to the price I was a bit concerned that it would be a dump to my delight it wasn't!! We got a lovely room over looking the park with 2 queen size beds each with 5 pillows on them. The room was clean and so was the bath room. Our room was warm at all times and was always freshly made when we got back to it (even my pjs got folded lol). as for the tv, it worked. It didn't have many channels and the signal could be a bit dodgey at times, but we weren't there to watch TV. The hotel staff were excellen and got us whatever we needed, from a UK-US adaptor to a bottle opener. The area was lovely, although it was a bit far out there is a subway 3 blocks from the hotel which in 10 mins got you into the centre of Manhatten. It is a lovely comfortable no frills hotel.I would recommend this hotel to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Poor Hotel, Ok location away from the city noise.”
Reviews.Author: Sallan4825
Reviews.Content: New York, USA: Astor On The park, New York City: Initially a big disappointment. Date: December 6th - December 12th 2008. Arrived early pm and initial impression was 'OH MY GOD'. Our hotel room was a very small bedroom approx 5m x 4m. The bathroom was clean and the bed was queen sized for my daughter and i. The room had just been painted and the smell of paint was unberable. We decided we were not staying there and went to reception to ask for another room. We were offered another room, smaller than the first, if that was possible!! Again we refused and were offered another room with a view of the garbage bins and old patio furniture. This was the last straw. Again back to reception and asked for a refund to find this was not possible. We were then given another room, king size bed and bunk beds, that we had to take due to the no refund policy. It was the best of a bad bunch and it over looked the park. The receptionist was very helpful and apologetic, it was not her fault the hotel was so dingy. The televisions in all the rooms we were offered did not have a good reception and 80% of the programes were not in English. The hotel is at the top end of Central Park which was a blessing as the city is so so busy. The subway is literally at the end of the block and takes you to all over Manhattan. The hotel staff were very helpful and obliging but i would not stay here again it is in much need of a complete upgrade and it would be a good hotel with good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt use this hotel again, pitty as it could be so much better.”
Reviews.Author: DEHari
Reviews.Content: We didn't read the reviews about this hotel before we booked, if we had, this wouldn't have been the hotel of our choice. I want to make my review as accurate as possible and after all, this hotel was cheaper than many others, you get what you pay for. One of the previous reviews said The Astor on the Park was like an upmarket hostel and I think that sums it up. We booked 2 rooms and specifically asked for rooms with a view of the park with one room to have twin beds. The rooms we got looked across a small yard right in to the bedrooms on the other side, the window blinds had to be closed all the time or people in the rooms opposite could see right in. Whose fault this mix up was is still up for discussion so maybe not the hotels fault. One of the rooms wasn't too bad but the other was dirty, 2inch of carpet all around the room was thick with dirt, it just hadn't been cleaned for months. The room size was 10 ft by 12 ft and although the bathrooms were alright with excellent showers they were just not clean, dropping your clothes on the floor meant they were covered in fluff when you picked them up. You do need to read the instructions located on reception desk of how the shower works as there are no instructions in the bathroom. You are provided with soap, shower jell and shower cap which was a nice touch with clean towels every day and the bed was made every day but nothing else in the rooms seemed to be cleaned. A bottle top we dropped on the floor on our arrival was still there when we left and the small dustbin in the room was never emptied so we used a carrier bag for the rubbish. The draught through the window had to be packed each night with pillows or whoever slept next to the window couldn't get to sleep for the cold draught that blew freely through the air con. We took a kettle as there were no tea/coffee making facilities in the room and the draughty window was an ideal place to keep the milk and it stayed fresh all week. There was a coffee machine in the basement which we didn't need to use but we were told you had to pay for it, you could also access the internet from the basement and again paid for the privilege. It seemed there was a 3 inch wide pipe from floor to ceiling in each bathroom, these pipes were VERY hot, the pipe in one of the bedrooms was lagged but the other wasn't and would have been very dangerous for children or older people. One small lift services the whole hotel so it was always busy and we used the small stairs most of the time which were about 3ft wide and we did wondered how everyone would get out if there was a fire. On the whole the chipped paint, the room doors which were hard to unlock until you got the hang of how they worked, the beds with thin mattresses that were too firm and the walls which were so thin you could hear every footstep both from outside and from the floor above, didn't make this a hotel of quality. The staff were friendly but make sure if you book any trips via the hotel you get the trip you want. We were told the trip to the Statue of Liberty couldn't visit the island, maybe that one couldn't but others can and to be honest the trip isn't worthwhile without landing on the island and seeing the great lady up close. The location of the hotel wasn't the best, its away from the tourist area but close to the underground which isn't bad if you don't mind a bit of adventure. We bought a weekly ticket for just over $12 and used the underground to get all over New York, it can be complicated if your not used to the labyrinth of tunnels but even if you get lost just jump on the next train back. Taxi up to the main shopping area could cost about $25 so can be expensive if you use it a lot and unless your really fit its too far to walk. Id recommend this hotel to singles, couples or young families with plenty of energy who don't mind roughing it a bit and don't mind doing the extra walking or travelling before they get to places of interest. The locals are friendly and being further out you meet a lot of them travelling to work etc. This hotel isn't suitable if your the kind of person who spends time in the hotel, its alright if you just need a bed and a bath and you dont mind things not being too clean.

Reviews.Title: “Astor was clean, great and freindly. Excellent value !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jameshen
Reviews.Content: The Astor was Excellent value. The staff on the desk were helpful and courteous. The rooms are very clean and comfortable for the price. I would recommend the hotel any time. Thanks to all for an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: tripper9945
Reviews.Content: Hotel was small, and lovely. Recently done up I'd say... an old building, with modern amenities. Room was small, with no view, but it was modern and spotlessly clean. Bathroom especially was lovely. Maid service was faultless. It was nice to be on the upper west side - you see parts of Manhattan that no one else would bother to come that north to see! Right on the subway lines to downtown and all the sights, and literally over the road from Central Park. (Again, not many people venture that far up the park, so nice and quiet.)

Reviews.Title: “simple, clean, great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cookie31
Reviews.Content: For the price this is as good as it gets in NY city. It is located on 106th St on central park west. About a forty five minute walk into the hustle and bustle. However there is a Subway stop about two minutes along the road which costs $2 into town. The fact that the hotel is right opposite central park is a bonus and a morning stroll around the park is a must. For food and drink, nearby the hotel, columbus ave, provides ample choice. The walk into the centre is well advised, you pass the natural history museum, strawberry fields and a little restaurante/bar called the tavern on the green, a draw for tourists so a little expensive but well worth popping in for a drink and a look around the gardens. Now for the hotel, check in was swift and friendly and the doormen are more than happy to give any information you require. The rooms are small but modern, a double bed, one small wardrobe, television, CD/ radio alarm and telephone. The bathrooms are surprisingly spacious, modern marble tiled walls, power shower/ bath, bath shower products and fresh towels each day. If your going to NY to sit in the hotel don't stay here. However if you want a clean, cheap, confortable, decentley located hotel then stay here. I would have no hesitation in staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice doorman, small room!”
Reviews.Author: louveyret
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews warning me of bad service and a tiny rooms - but they were only half right! The room was tiny - to explain this further -- the double bed/queen was placed in the middle of the room, and you could reach the side of the wall with your hand from laying in bed. But as they say, you don't intend to spend much time in your room when you're a tourist, especially when Central Park was literally across the road. I had a late flight (2am!) into NYC, and the nightman working was rude and unhelpful. However, the doorman in the morning was very informative, polite and provided some nice suggestions for breakfast. Overall, the place was fine, the rooms were clean (albeit small) and I really was only there for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: musheded
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Astor on the Park in early February. It was cold cold cold when we were in NYC, and yes we did have a bit of trouble figuring out the radiator but once we were shown how to work it we were fine. They even gave us an extra heater to use because my wife was sick when we were there. The Astor was the most affordable hotel we found on Manhattan, and the location was plenty convenient for us. The bus line right outside the front door takes you pretty much everywhere you could want to go and allows you to sight see at the same time, and if you want to go farther faster the subway is right up the street. We had a blast in New York, though next time if we go in winter we'll bring even warmer clothes :). The people at the Astor were nice, and the rooms fine for a home base since most of us visit NYC to see the City not our hotel room, and we found the bed to be comfy and the room clean. Where else can you stay in New York for $75 a night and have views of Central Park from your room! We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Room, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Glassskye
Reviews.Content: When planning my trip to NYC I relied quite a bit on TripAdvisor for as 'honest' and opinion as one could get as well as candid pictures and such.. After almost being conned out of a lot of money for an apartment in NYC I was pretty stressed and dubious about this place but with just 2 weeks left before leaving for NYC I really had no choice but to just hope for the best! Thank god I did! I can understand why a family, or someone who is used to having what one can only call 'Hotel Holidays' would find this place maybe a little less exciting than a grander hotel but for the price and location I was incredibly pleased with the Astor. Me and my boyfriend stayed there for 9 nights in total and we had a room with a 'park view' which to be honest is just a view of a mass of green but hey! It's better than a wall.. The room was incredibly clean, and yes the walls are painted green but I found the whole place to be very neutral and calming as there was no fuss with wall paper and odd curtains.. The room has a large double bed, two bed side tables with lights / a phone / alarm clock and paper + pen provided. There was not much room to 'move around' but both our suitcases and shopping fit in the room perfectly.. and we had a lot of stuff!! The bathroom was actually a lot bigger than expected! There was a bath and shower (and although the bath may seem small a lot of Manhattan baths are small due to size of apartments.. so this is not just a hotel thing...) and you get a complimentary toiletries basket full of goodies.. The room was cleaned every day with bed linen / bathroom towels and toirlet paper changed every day.. We found the room to be very secure and the cleaning sevice to not only be very thorough but also very honest! (One of the ladies accidently knocked over a glass foundation bottle I had on the bathroom shelf and left me a note asking for full price so she could pay me back!) The staff were friendly and very helpful, we had about 2 hours left before we departed after check out and we left our nags with them free of charge whilst we wondered around town for a bit more!! LOCATION!: Although people here are saying that it is 'too far' away from town we found this ridiculous! The upper west side is a very good area to stay in.. The hotel is 2 blocks away from Columbia University which means a safer place, shops, great places to eat, two super markets near the hotel, and a 24 hour pharmacy that is literally a life saver for tights, sweets, etc etc. There are two main subway lines by the hotel, one which has two stops literally 3 minutes away from tbe hotel (whch is the AC - Blue line and the BD which stops at 110 Cathedral Parkway) and the other which is about 2 blocks away which is the the orange/red colour line 110 Cathedral parkway which is the 123 line) (you can also get off at 103 if needed but you have to walk a bit :) The subways takes less than 15 minutes to get to times square and the lines take you right to times square, ground zero, ferry for statue of liberty and other great places! If you want a quite place to sleep, a somehere thats safe to walk around then seriously this location is amazing! I'm 22 andthis was perfect for me to get our and about! I was not expecting to write such a long review but I always think it's best to get stuff out there, a lot of the time people write these reviews who are used to staying in a hotel for hotel luxery but I went to NYC to see NYC, it was like having a bedroom whilst I was there.. I wa snot interested in the cable, or if I could run around the room, I felt safe, was able to have a great holiday and saved on a lot of cash that I wa sthen able to spend on presents! I am a girl that is used to having the best and so to be so comfortable here is super, I will go back.

Reviews.Title: “The best New York hotel I've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: HookaDuck
Reviews.Content: ... but I should confess that it's the only New York hotel I've stayed in. I'm a great fan of Tripadvisor; however, it does tend to rely upon someone's subjective view of the hotel. This can sometimes be coloured by how much someone enjoys their holiday. My fiancee, girlfriend before we went to New York, and I both enjoyed this hotel. The rooms were clean and well equiped.
