The staff were friendly and the hotel was in a fantasic location. It's near enough to a subway station to allow easy access to the whole of the city, but at the same time, ideally located to be quiet at night. Central Park is a delight and is worth a day by itself. I would be happy to stay at this hotel again and can't believe there's a hotel like this available at a reasonable price. Great hotel, great city...

Reviews.Title: “WE LOVED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JulianaNovicki
Reviews.Content: When I read some reviews of the hotel my expectations were low and I'm afraid. But I have a very nice surprise!!! Great location. The room was very clean and comfy and not so small, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful! The subway was 2 safe blocks walk and bus stop was a pleasant and safe 1 block walk. The only complaint I would have is the cable issue. If you are looking to watch a lot of TV on your vacation, I wouldn't recommend this hotel, but if you are looking for a GREAT deal on a great room in a great location, this place should serve you as good as it did us!!! We paid $119 per night for a room (hotelconxions) we thought excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience in my life”
Reviews.Author: Paolo018
Reviews.Content: So ugly, unclean, plenty of noise. Never seen a room so ugly like that in my life. Garbage in the court and inside a trap for rats. Check-out immediately after one night there. Pay attention to the electricals broken!

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again - No Airconditioning!”
Reviews.Author: Adventureville
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights in July 08. If you are staying in winter then this hotel is probably okay, BUT not summer! When we first arrived we were given keys to our room, only to go up and find the room was full of rubbish. Then we were shown two rooms, and told we could have whichever one we wanted, but one didn't have a key, and we would have to get staff to let us in every time?? So, we took the third option, and the room was small and clean - no complaints there, but the airconditioning is fan only. It was so hot that I nearly passed out (and we're from a hot part of the world so I should be used to it). Each night before going to bed, and again when waking up we would have to stand in the hall and fan as much air into the room as possible. The windows did not open so when it was cooler in the hall than in your room you know there are problems. We would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect all around!”
Reviews.Author: sl121
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews of the hotel my expectations were low, just in case it was as bad as some reviews make it seem. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, the rooms were very clean and comfy, great location to get out of New York's fast pace! The subway and bus stop was a pleasant and safe 3 block walk. The only complaint I would have is the cable issue. If you are looking to watch a lot of TV on your vacation, I wouldn't recommend this hotel, but if you are looking for a GREAT deal on a great room in a great location, this place should serve you as good as it did us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Astor on the Park -> great value for money!”
Reviews.Author: helen040
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel last week and found it just perfect. Especially when taking into account the rate compared to those of other New York hotels.... The rooms were a bit small but very clean and had good bed. If you cross the street you are in central park and just 2 blocks walking for the metro. Within 10 minutes you can be in downtown Manhattan! We highly recommend this place to those looking for a clean and comfortable hotel for a very reasonable price. We we certainly come back here! Rodey & Helen, Amsterdam The Netherlands

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Eva-Marie81
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first visit to New York last year. The accommodation is basic enough but the room and bathroom were very clean and there was a daily cleaning service. It is situated a little too far out of the city centre - we found we wasted a lot of our trip getting subways into the city. However, for what we paid for it - during high season - we couldn't fault it. The staff were friendly and very helpful, giving directions, etc. And it is literally just across the road from Central Park!

Reviews.Title: “NO WI FI”
Reviews.Author: annaoc
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean but room was tiny and painted an horiffic green colour with a view of a cement wall. There was a phone in the room which was very convenient as we could call reception to find out what the weather was like in the mornings. The view from the hall was was only slightly worse - curling barbed wire fencing. When I arrived the porter watched me struggle up the lift with my luggage without offering to help. The key, (yes and actually key) didn't work so I had to struggle back down and the porter had to come up and show me the trick of lifting the door handle, pulling it toward you before turning the key. My sister and I took turns trying to open the room door at night as it was almost impossible. The Wi Fi was "not working" the 4 days of our stay with the hotel and we were directed to a cafe around the corner from the hotel where I got to see my first ever cockroach before the owner killed him. I honestly don't believe the hotel have a wi fi facility at all as no hotel staff seemed to know anything about it. Lastly, it wasn't very nice when you gave taxi drivers the address "central park west" souunds so nice, but the reply was usually "oh, you want to go to Harlem".

Reviews.Title: “Fish Palace”
Reviews.Author: jenbee100
Reviews.Content: Hotel was cheap so didnt expect much. It was clean and basic but slightly further out that I would have liked. Main problem was that after the room had been cleaned each day the bathroom absolutely stank of fish. I have no idea what they cleaned it with but the smell was very bad, as there were no bathroom windows and only a small window in the bedroom it was a case of having to get used to it!

Reviews.Title: “Little Gem”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina587
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there for 12 nights. Only downside is the size of the room, I have never seen anything so tiny, however as most of the other reviewers mentioned its only somewhere to put you head after a long day out. The beds were extremely comfortable. The location of the hotel is wonderful. Its on the upper west side, subway only 5 mins walk away from the hotel,or you can take a bus M10 which will take you through Times Square and drop you off outside Macys. Overall hotel is very good, however, size of rooms toooooooo small.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bokkie32
Reviews.Content: Normally check in is not until 3 but my friend and I had arrived after a 10 hour bus ride around 8:00 in the morning. The lady at the help desk said she would do her best to get us in ASAP and by noonish it was all sorted. Excellent location, clean room so overall a great experience and you cannot beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise”
Reviews.Author: 2doggies
Reviews.Content: Great deal at a good, clean hotel. Mattresses were comfortable and we had a fantastic view of downtown and the park. Staff was very friendly. Only negatives: tiny sink that was impossible to wash your face in, elevator broke on the day we left and we were on the 10th floor. Also they ordered one of their cars to take us to the airport instead of a taxi and we paid twice as much. But overall, what a find. I hope they stay affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the money...”
Reviews.Author: AUS911
Reviews.Content: Just back from two nights at the Astor on the Park. I have to say that I was a little surprised by how small the room was when I arrived, but honestly for the price it is a great little hotel. The room and bathroom were recently renovated, clean and well kept. The young staff were cheerful and helpful. Nice and convenient to the subway made getting to meetings fast and easy. You go to NYC to see the city, this is a great place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Astor on the Park!”
Reviews.Author: Misty_River7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Astor on the Park for a two night weekend getaway. We booked online through nychotels.com and got an excellent rate for the Central Park area. The hotel is located at the north-west corner of Central Park at 106th St on Central Park West. It is a quick 5 minute walk to the subway stops at 103rd St or 110th St. We really liked the location as it is outside of the hustle bustle of the southern end of Central Park. We had a room that faced Central Park. The Room itself is tiny, but clean. There was one double bed and an armoire that had a closet and a television set. Some of the channels didn't come in very well on the TV, but we weren't there to spend time in the room. The bathroom was a good size and had all the amenities we required. The Staff were friendly and courteous and were always there to open the door and greet us with a smile. It was also a bonus that with a 3pm check-in and a 12pm check-out that we were able to store our luggage on arrival and departure and enjoy the city without being burdened by our bags. If we return to NYC again we would probably consider staying at the Astor on the Park again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Relief”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuru15
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our father/son trip to New York and our stay at the Astor on the Park. I have to say I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews. However, I was pleasently relieved when we got to the hotel. I won't say it's fabulous, but I will call it sufficient. At the price, though, you can't beat it ($145/night). As most people have suggested, you don't go to New York to stay in your room. In all honesty this hotel is not a place you would want to spend to much time in your room. The rooms were tight to say the least, but we had a double bed room. There was enough room for two double beds, a t.v. and a small cupboard for your clothes. There honestly was not a whole lot of room to move around. The rooms would be very crowded for more than three people, and three adults would be pushing it. The beds were actually very comfortable and I got the best sleep I've had in six months. The bathroom had to be the high point of the room though. Our room was clean and was newly tiled. There was no mildew and the shower had great pressure and hot water!!!! The rooms did not smell and the air worked. The down side was the t.v. which didn't really work and there was no remote, but again we only watched it for the weather and news in the morning. Otherwise this is a very sufficient hotel for the tourist. I would definitely not recommend it for a buisness traveler unless you don't mind minimal accomodations. The location was actually great, in my opinion. You're far enough away from the high traffic areas, but two blocks from the subway which can get you anywhere fast. It's about a 10 minute ride to Times Square. Also Central Park is right across the street. It is a very small hotel with minimal accomodations, but as I said it serves the purpose for the tourist. Our group had four rooms and some other rooms were slightly bigger, but not by much. Some of the other rooms had warped floors and older bathrooms, but again everything was clean and everyone raved about how well they slept. The staff was very friendly and accomodate our needs to the best of their ability. Again there's not a whole lot of ammenities, but they will help if you ask.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: lyndybob
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed for 5 nights at this hotel . We were disappointed because the room was very small and crowded. It was said to have been recently renovated but the room was dark and shabby. The furniture was of poor quality and the wardrobe was damaged. The television was unwatchable because of poor reception. There were no facilities to make tea or coffee and nowhere else to get a hot drink. We did ask to be moved to another room which the hotel staff agreed to, and the alternative was a bit brighter and the tv worked. The floor however had an interesting gradient, sloping up from one side to the other! On the plus side, the standard of cleanliness was good and we always had fresh towels. The hotel also claims to offer park views but I think the number of rooms that could possibly have them must be limited as the hotel frontage is small. Our view was of out back... not very attractive. I would not return to this hotel because I think it was poor value.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: ESLTravelerCharlotte
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, the bathroom was excellent. Good bed, good pillows. The front desk did a good job EXCEPT for one guy who failed to give me a wakeup call that I had requested. Fortunately, I had awakened early. The phone never rang, but when I mentioned to the man at the front desk that I hadn't gotten my wakeup call, he said he had rung the room but no one had answered. The woman the next night *did* give me a wakeup call. Clearly the problem was with that particular man, not the system. As might be expected for a hotel that I paid $108/night for in New York, it was tiny and no rooms with a view were available when I checked in. I had read reviews that said that there were problems with the heat, but I found the heat was so high that I occasionally had to run the air conditioner in order not to swelter. No coffeemaker in the room. However, having read reviews at this website, I was prepared and brought a heating coil and a mug and a small jar of good instant. There are a number of small grocery stores and restaurants only a few blocks away. I took the subway a couple blocks away. If you plan to take the train back at night, be sure to find out which trains stop there at which time, as lines you take in the morning may not always run late. (I bought a one- week MetroPass, and found that it was very handy not to have to add money.)

Reviews.Title: “If you want to stay in a hotel that costs $48 dollars less than the”
Reviews.Author: Libetta
Reviews.Content: Sheraton Times Square then this is the hotel for you. We requested an extra night on arrival at this hotel to find the hotel manager and receptionist had not bothered pursuing our request , leaving us without a hotel room on the last night of our stay in New York, despite their assurances on arrival it would not be a problem. When it got to the day before our due departure date we still had not got a confirmation of our extra night. The receptionist did not even want to call, leaving us to call the central reservations from our room, the following morning not only did they not care we had no hotel room for our extra night, I even had to pay $1 to access the internet in the basement to see if I had an email confirmation. The manager did not try to find another room for us, telling us to call later in the day or acces my email. We finally were told they had no room. The manager handed us a card to call or email www.nychotels.com. If it had not been for a friend in Chicago who arranged a night in the Sheraton we would have had to have spent the day finding a hotel. We managed to get a room in the Sheraton, Times Square for $226 with all the facilities that this type of hotel delivers, restaurant, concierge, shuttle services to the airport etc. This is not a budget hotel, the hotel is at least a 40 minute walk to Times Square and you need to catch a bus which cost $2 each way, ladies if you want to shop, it will cost you $10 in a cab. This hotel offers nothing but a room, you have to shop for water and breakfast, the rooms are small and twin rooms even smaller, we had absolutely no where to put a case not a chair or a suitcase stand. I will not be recommending this hotel and to be honest, for £27more booking direct with the Sheraton in the middle of Times Square, then what else can I say

Reviews.Title: “No Problems for me!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kidan
Reviews.Content: I had read a few reviews on this hotel and to be honest they wasn't a million miles from the truth. when we arrived we seen the rooms were quite small however who goes to the big apple to stay in your room? in my personal opinion it was fine for me to sleep in after the days you have! The staff were very friendly and always helped if we needed anything, i had read on a review that the rooms were very noisey and you could hear the subway, i never heard a thing however the plumbing was a little noisey, but if your anything like me after walking around new york for 6-7hrs a day i'd sleep through a band playing. The view from the window in my room was not great but again im not there to look out the window all day. This hotel is quite far out from times square and def would not recommend the walk in, as i'd say it was a gud 4 to 6miles but taxi's really was not that expensive and 3blocks away was the subway, the taxi's were about $15 and the subway was $7 for an all day ticket. My only problem with the hotel was there was not a bar there so once you went back to your room you sort of had to stay there as there was no where for you to sit around. Overall i enjoyed my stay here and didnt once feel like i needed to move, i personally would try not to stay in this hotel again due to it not being in a central location! That is my personal choice as i like to be near the centre. PLEASE NOTE: On arrival at the hotel they Will ask for a credit or debit card, this is incase you use the telephone in your room and check out without paying, i was a litle worried at first they took down my number, as checked out i seen the girl behind destroy the copy! upon my return to the UK i went to the bank and just checked that no money was taken out of my account, no money had been taken :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money, clean, comfortable, no-frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: 2OldestTravellers
Reviews.Content: Reviews for this hotel in general are unfair and are likely to put possible guests off booking. The hotel is very clean and linen is changed every day, plenty of hot water, rooms are adequate for a good night's sleep, staff are very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very good value for money and one of the cheapest we found - for the price of a $25 for a 7 day Metrocard - the bus stop is opposite the hotel and the subway 3 blocks away - you can be in the centre of town within a very short time. Our room was at the back so very quiet - we couldn't see the sky so it was difficult to see what the weather was like outside - however, we only wanted to sleep there! No food available but plenty of delis in the area for simple snacks. We would highly recommend this no-frills hotel as you can spend the extra you would pay at other hotels on enjoying the delights of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise after reading bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: JohnRD
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel, my wife & I read reviews which started to worry us. At one point, we were tempted to book another hotel, as some were really bad but we need not have worried. On arrival, we were given a room on the second floor, which was very nice but to close to the street noise. My wife went back to Reception, to ask for a room higher up & we were given one on the sixth floor, which was ideal as we are both light sleepers. The room was on the small side but fine for our needs, as we would only be using it for sleeping & showering in. We hope, that the following points are helpfull to anyone considering a stay at this hotel. The hotel. The staff are friendly & helpfull. The lobby is clean & Comfortable, with vending machines & internet downstairs. The only problem we found, was the small lift. It is a bit tight fof two people & a couple of suitcases. The rooms. These are slightly on the small side, with not much storage space but how much room do you need. The rooms are cleaned every day & the bathrooms has all you need, with towels changed daily. This is a buget hotel, which is all you really need when in NYC. Its only real let down is the location. Being at the top end of Central park, it is a bit of a trip every day into the city but not a real problem, if you don't mind travelling on the subway, or a bus. There is a station at 103st, which is only a short walk from the hotel & an M10 bus stop just out side the door. We would stay at this hotel again, soon hopefully & have no problems recommending it to others, travelling to this wonderfull city.

Reviews.Title: “You Get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Sheridan23
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Astor on the park for Christmas 2007 and found it very dingy. Severall problems including room temperature - the room was either freezing cold or boiling hot - no control over the heating, Was quicker to walk 5 flights of stairs then wait for the anchient lift, no bar, toilett kept overflowing - once even on Christmas day! Its a good $10 n a taxi to get into New York City.The room was cheap and fairly clean, it was the only place we could find in new york where you had an en-suite bath.... would never stay there again...pay the extra..its worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for the money!!”
Reviews.Author: BachNewYork
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Astor on the Park for 6 nights and I have absolutely no complaintes at all! This was my first visit in New York and was a bit nervous as I had read that hotels in New York could be a bit disgusting so I didn´t expect much from this hotel as we only paid 110 $ per night. So I was very pleased when I first came to the hotel. From the outside it looked nice and clean and when entering the reception it continued looking nice and clean. The receptionist was kind and there was no problems checking in. I had read that the rooms were very small so expected a very packed room but when I saw it I was really surprised. There were to big beds with very clean sheets with plenty of room around it and a nice medium sized, spotless and extremly clean bathroom, There was a tv, an ironboard, hairdryer and some soaps, bodylotion ect. in the bathroom. After European-standards this was defently a quit big room. Remember that this is a two-star hotel (after my opinion a three-star hotel) so I think that the persons who has given this hotel bad reviews just expected to much. The location of the hotel was perfect. The area was quiet right next to Central Park and the subway was only three blocks away so in five-ten minutes you could be down in the city. This hotel made my holiday perfect and I would deffently come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Does exactly what it says on the tin!”
Reviews.Author: shiglini
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights mid April. Yes a credut card was asked for at check in but this is soemthing which I experience when I check in at UK hotels now so was not a problem. The room was of adequate size with a comfy bed with crisp clean sheets & HUGE pillows. Private bathroom with plenty of clean linen and complimentary toiletries. We had a problem with trying to work out how to use the shower but when we enquired at reception, someone came up to our room straight away and got it sorted for us. True what previous reviews say about location but once you have got the subway sorted then it is not a problem. We had a great view of Central Park & we did not experience the noise which other reviewers have noted. The only thing which I did miss not having was a kettle to make a cup of coffee in the morning but there is a vending machine in the basement which despenses soemthing which nearly resembles coffee!!

Reviews.Title: “Enter at own risk.”
Reviews.Author: gingermoon
Reviews.Content: Having never been to New York before we booked a package deal of flights and accommodation, Astor on the park was choice of Hotel with great location and affordable price. Having read reviews before booking we decided based on the handful of good reviews that it was worth a shot. Upon arrival at the Hotel we were greeted by an uninterested receptionist no hello just ‘you want to check in?’ After asking for a credit card as deposit she then demanded $100 also her reasoning in case we take something from the room. Reluctantly now checking into our double room supposed to be twin room after being advised due to overbooking will move you tomorrow. Being exhausted from 9 hours of travel we decided to deal with it the following day. Having crammed into the tiniest double room in history with no amenities other than a bathroom and a TV that had good reception of static (which makes me wonder what we could have stolen to lose our deposit) was not a good start to our holiday. The morning receptionist was quiet pleasant advised they would move us to a twin room that day. On getting in late that night from a full day of sightseeing to collect our key from the ever friendly night receptionist, only to find out they hadn’t moved us to a twin room based on the fact that all twin rooms were booked the entire weekend. Verbally displaying my unhappiness to the receptionist I advised her we would like some sort of compensation in the form of a refund for the difference of a twin room only to be told ‘we don’t compensate bookings on package deals’ that’s that. I am afraid this is not a Hotel there was no one to help with luggage, no room service, no fridge food or water in room, basic rooms with electrical problems ie: plugs hanging out of wall sockets and lighting busted from roof, hot water was great but shower didn’t work. I am sorry to say I do not recommend this place as you can get a 4 star Hotel for the same price and Im sure better service. Good luck, happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay on the Park”
Reviews.Author: icatlanta
Reviews.Content: Arriving on a Wednesday just after 3PM on April 9th at check in time, friendly staff checked and we waited and extra few mins to get a room with a view of Central Park which became available. We stayed in room 603 with windows towards the street and the Park. The room is perfect for the traveler wishing to explore New York rather than hang in the room. No table or desk but who needs it when visiting for pleasure. Just hook up the notebook and kick back on a bed plush with nice pillows. The bath room was spotless and brand new looking and polished top to bottom -- something I normally would associate with the 4 star hotels I have often stayed at when paid for during business travel. We found towels and complementary toiletries all refreshed when we returned in the late PM the next night. Would have stayed longer if we could. The afternoon sun warmed our room without need for the window AC/Heater unit. Located in a surprisingly very quiet neighborhood almost at the north end of Central Park, the lite background sound of the occasional subway passing below at night added a nice NYC city flavor. Otherwise I would have thought I was at home. A short walk south get's you to the "103rd St Station" subway stop which connect you to north-south B (Orange) or C (Blue) lines ... i.e. very easy 10 min travel to midtown and 20 min to downtown. As we were on a bit of a budget, the amazing special price we found was a god send. I'd give it a three star + rating. Great service ... no complaints. We had a great time ... highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Budget Travelers!”
Reviews.Author: FliteAttndnt
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent four nights at Astor on the Park in mid-March. We had a wonderful experience there. The hotel staff was friendly, and our room was ready and waiting for us right at check-in time. The room was great - clean and attractive with a good-sized bed and a very nice private bathroom. We were never too cold, despite frigid temperatures outside. A subway station was just three blocks away - an easy five minute (or less) walk. The area was well-lit and highly trafficked - as two young women alone, we didn't feel nervous in this neighborhood. I think the key to enjoying this (or any) hotel is to do your homework and know what to expect. In all the negative reviews I've read about this hotel, I think the problem lies with guest expectations, not the hotel itself. Is this a luxury resort? No. I never saw any advertisements claiming that it was. Are the rooms spacious and does every room boast a sweeping view of the city? No. But if you spent any time researching NYC hotels at all, you'll know that for the price (we paid $108 per night), you're not likely to find better. Astor on the Park has private bathrooms - and very, very nice ones! That is an extreme rarity in $100 Manhattan hotels. No, it's not next door to any NYC attractions other than Central Park - but again, if you looked up the address you would know this, and with the nearby subway, getting to the heart of the city is very easy. If you need a full-service tour guide, enough space to play twister in your room, or plan to spend the majority of your trip hanging out at the hotel, spend (a lot) more money and go elsewhere. But if you want good quality and your own bathroom at a good price, this is the place for you! We absolutely loved it and would recommend it to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish”
Reviews.Author: Ny08
Reviews.Content: The hotel has negatives and positives. However the negatives out weigh the positives. The girl who was on check in, was moody and unhelpful and was more concerned with playing on here phone that printing off the reservation, this resulting in a misunderstanding as to how long i was staying. Reception rang my room at 3.30 in the morning to question my departure date, not at all professional. Upon checking out there were further complications due to the absent attitude of the staff. The room was reasonable, clean, but very dark. In future i will be booking my hotel long in advance as to avoid staying at this dump.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you can get a good price”
Reviews.Author: loranse
Reviews.Content: We paid too much for this hotel and I know we could have done better for the price we paid. If you can find a 100 dollars a night rate or bellow it is a good deal, otherwise try to find something closer to downtown and a bit more luxurious.This is not the kind of hotel that you go to to relax but just to sleep. As a matter of fact , there is no view from the room, it is very dark and you have to twist your neck to see the sky and if the sun is there. The room was very small and very basic but extremely clean, the bathroom was adequate and also very clean, great powerful shower with plenty hot water. The subway is 2 blocks away , 7 stops to 42th street. if you want to eat in the area there are plenty good reasonably priced restaurants. THE WORSE PART: NO HEAT IN THE ROOM ( and for that matter in the entire hotel, you could feel the cold as soon as you exited the elevator.I told the front desk but nothing was done. I was told that they were out of space heaters and said they would give me more blankets. What they called blankets were VERY THIN cotton spreads. I started to feel a little warmer after pilling up 4 of those. THE BEST PART: friendly staff for the most part. Specially Emil the doorman, really nice and helpful . He made all the difference. Good , cheap eating in the area on Broadway and Amsterdam in not so touristy area, more like real New York.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wanalulu
Reviews.Content: Staff behind the desk were not particularly friendly but not rude either. The music playing in the small reception area was perhaps a little loud but not too obtrusive. The interior was a little tatty in places, but as long as you're not expecting a luxury hotel nothing to worry about. Room appeared very clean and of ample size. Bathroom was spacious, clean and well stocked with towels. Had to pay $100 deposit on checking in but this was fully refunded. There was a small room downstairs, with coffee, cold drinks and snacks available from vending machines and computers which you can use to surf the net (for the rather pricey sum of $0.20/minute, so dollars go rather quickly when you're looking up times/places/subway stations etc). The walk into the centre of town took 45 minutes and you can go via central park which is very pleasant. The area itself is rather suburban but felt very safe. The hotel is two blocks from 103 st subway with regular trains into town (around every 5/10 minutes) the journey takes about 10 minutes. There are also a regular stream of taxis passing by if you're feeling extravagant. The beds were very comefortable with ample bedding provided. The walls were very thin so you may be at the mercy of your neighbours if you're a light sleeper. The heating system was a little noisy aroun 5am but should only be a problem if you're a very light sleeper and doesn't stay loud for long. All in all, by no means luxurious but clean and comefy.

Reviews.Title: “ok hotel”
Reviews.Author: somigoso
Reviews.Content: hotel locates a bit far from the midtown. $16~$25 from grand central st. by taxi. room was clean. a door man was too kind. I paid $145 per night and it was a quite deal in NY. but hotel stuff have a kind of problem. they never offer detailed info about anything like sightseeing, musical, bus schedule. they only recommend me to use the internet service downstairs. furthermore, they only provided $45 taxi ride to LGA, which is too much. usually, its $25+3.50 to LGA. maybe they get bucks from taxi drivers. I recommend to book taxi by own, or book airlink or supershuttle. even you can get $2 off coupon from NY guidebooks.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Believe what you have read about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: KezzyBee
Reviews.Content: I was really dreading the hotel from the reviews i had read on here and was expecting the worst from the price i had paid. Got to the hotel and a very friendly doorman helped us with our bags. Lady on reception wasnt overly friendly but not horrible either. Word of warning take a master card or visa with you if u dont then u will have to pay $100 dollar deposit until you check out. The decor was clean and the atmosphere was pleasant. After checking in we got into the lift which is very small but it took two of us and two people sized bags. The room was fresh clean and smelt nice. It was soooooo hot in the room but we turned off the radiator which i would advise. There is an ac/ fan unit attached to the window and we had it on most of the time. The bathroom was lovely with fresh folded towels and the toilet paper had even been folded! a lovely touch. There are the soaps shower cap shower gel etc. A maid visited the room every day to change the towels and bed covers. The tv didnt really have many channels but your not in new york to watch tv. We were never disturbed once during our stay and the staff were friendly. Alot of people mentioned the loud noises in the morning.... I am a very light sleeper and the morning noises didnt disturb me once. I would recommend this hotel for anyone who is going to new york and wants a lovely location 2mins to the subway and still on a low budget. I stayed with two friends and we had a brill time. I will definately be stayin again.

Reviews.Title: “not a good start to new york”
Reviews.Author: robertssnowy
Reviews.Content: we stayed at this hotel on feb 29th for 2nights .the only good thing about it was its good location to the subway . we had a package deal booked by a travel firm as we were only sepnding 2 nights here before moving on to a cruise . as soon as we walked through the door i knew we would be dissapointed .It has a very small reception which is just desk by alift with a bench to sit on it has no other facilitys whatsoever . we were allocated a room on the 4th floor , on exiting the lift we were in a corridor that was littered with empty cleaning buckets and general rubbish and this was 8pm at night , we wound our way down the dirty corridor to what you called our room , it consisted of a double bed ,1 bedside cupboard , a wardrobe that looked about 50 yrs old with a tv of the same era dumped on top.Yes it was clean and so was the small bathroom , however the decor needs seriuos attention. , the window had blinds of the same era which when opened gave the most depressing sight of 4 brick walls around you with other windows you had to keep them shut and block out all light or you were looked in upoun . had we not had good weather in new york and had to suffer being in this hotel i do not know what we would have done we only went to the room to sleep as we were out sight seeing for most of the 2 days . the sleeping was not easy either when not being woken up by noise through the the thin walls or people talking in the small corridors , you were woken up by the very noisy heating system at approx 5 am it comes to life with the most alarming noises of banging and gushing water . the subway is only 2 blocks away which was good but other than that there is only a small cafe /takeway on the street a few doors down or a small cafe bar about 3 b locks down near the garage , so nothing to keep you occupied near the hotel this is not a hotel i would ever recomend and i would never ever return we were with freinds who were also not impressed . If you are happy to rough it then fine but if like us you expect a good standard of room then stay away

Reviews.Title: “Cheap Price, Cheap Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dadoudoune
Reviews.Content: My teens and I have just come back from New York where we stayed at the Astor on the Park from March 5 to March 8, 2008. I was so concerned about the negative reviews of this hotel that I tried to change my reservation but it was too late. Overall, the hotel is rated 2 stars and it worths 2 stars. Rooms and bathrooms are very clean (although the carpets need to be changed). We first had a room with a view at the back of the hotel (awful), I asked to change the room and it was done with a bigger room on the 8th floor. I recommend that hotel only if you don't want to spend much on your stay, otherwise, maybe pay a little more to have a better hotel. Astor is located near the 106th Street, Broadway is on 42nd Street.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely good value”
Reviews.Author: mhg
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astor for two nights in February. Searching the Internet I found a very good rate, only USD80/night/room incl tax - that´s below hostel prices - so I didn´t expect much. We arrived late, but was well taken care of by the man in the reception and the friendly doorman Hamilton. We got a room on the 9th floor, obviously recently renovated. The room was really large, with a dubbel bed and a bunk bed, perfect for a family. Small, but very nice and clean, bathroom. Even for a considerebly higher price, this would have been a bargain. Now it was a steal! I can imagine, though, that other rooms are not at all that attractive. But if you are lucky enough to get the room we had, at such a low rate, you have made one of the best hotel deals ever!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding - Clean - Good Value”
Reviews.Author: gjc02790
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ator on the Park for a weekend trip to New York City. Having read the reviews online and being the unbiased person that I am, I decided to give the establishement a shot. It was a VERY GOOD DECISION! The lobby was very very clean and the rooms were also. The bathroom was exceptionally well maintained and clean. Unlike other botique hotels that I have stayed at this one is the exception. The pipes and heating system are just a hair nosiy but if you can get past that little hurdle you have yourself a great place to stay at an unbeatable price. The Astor is located in a very safe, clean neighborhood on the west side of central park. It is worth the $75.00 we payed a night to stay and a short taxi ride or a few stops on the subway and your in the heart of it all, TIMES SQUARE!

Reviews.Title: “Basic”
Reviews.Author: rixiq151
Reviews.Content: First impression was awful, a dingy 'reception' with what appeared to be the local Mafia in charge. The room (a triple) was very small but acceptable although it took a can of air freshener to dispell the musty smell. The room was cleaned and fresh towels every day and the bathroom would not be out of place in a Holiday Inn. The heating was erratic and very noisy from about 5 am when it wheezed back into life. Overall it represented value for money as we did not pay much. This hotel should really be designated a backpackers hostel.

Reviews.Title: “No no no”
Reviews.Author: gjayne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from the 25th to the 28th of january and prior to our holiday we were apprehensive about staying at this hotel as the reviews were quite concerning. Yes! The heating system was unpredictable. On arrival the rooms were extremely cold and necessitated us moving rooms and during the night the heating was extremely noisy. On a plus note, bed and bathroom was clean. Not an ideal area to stay, it was a long walk to mid town.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Astor on the Park”
Reviews.Author: dianaswim74
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights 24/25th January 2008 No problem with location bus stop opposite hotel and tube station close by, room clean comfortable bed , good shower, no view from room so kept blind closed, after all you do not go to NY to spend time in your room. After a long day travelling from Scotland decided to walk into central NY only took about 45 mins. Took local bus back to hotel arrrived back at room about 10.30 pm -5 degrees outside about same in room no heating on, went to bed very tired, only to wakened at 4.30 am with pipes banging and clanking till 6.30 am when heating went off again and I mean loud sleep was impossible. Glad we were only there for 2 nights I would not recommend this hotel as it spoiled our time in New York

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, that overlooks the park, great views of skyline too!!!!”
Reviews.Author: KayLancs
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from New York on the 9 Jan 2008 after spending 5 nights there. This hotel was fine! We had no problems, i was VERY apprehensive after reading the reviews, as we stayed neared the theatre district last time, but we were pleasently surprised. Ok so its not The Plaza, but it doesn't pretend to be. It is a bit out of the way , but we were grateful at night as it was very quiet and we had a room on the Central Park West side and slept with the window open. The subway is a great way to get round, there is a station on 103rd street only 3 blocks away(approx 5mins to walk) We got a 7 day pass for $24. It took approx 25 mins to get to Battery park which is right at the other end The room its self was fine too small but comfortable, it you are not expecting a posh hotel then you will be ok, most hotels in New York have small rooms after all you only really sleep there! We found our room a little too warm for our liking so left the window open at night, as for the noisy plumbing- i can honestly say that we heard it only in the morning as people were using water, we would shut the bathroom door and couldn't hear it!! the staff were helpful and friendly. Our rooms were cleaned daily with fresh towels and toiletries. The view from our window was great Central park opposite and then the skyline if you reached out of the window, the only problem i had was that the windows were dirty on the outside, but i suppose it is expecterd in such a busy city!!! At night we would get a taxi which was approx $10 one way Good tip , book into the Tavern on the Green, it is such a magical experience, and not as pricey as you might think!!! Just remember to have a great time, and if you are not happy ask the hotel staff that is what they are there for after all!!!

Reviews.Title: “cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: jwoodjapan
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights Jan 3-6, 2008. We got a great deal via Hotels.com ($80/night). The rooms are small but clean and the showers are hot. Our first room had a leaking radiator, so we told the front desk and were moved the next day to a different one, no problem. Overall, the staff was friendly and helpful. We usually left around 9am, returned 11pm, so just needed a place to sleep and this fit the bill. We liked walking in Central Park, the bus stop is just outside the hotel, the subway near. If you come to NY for the city and not the hotel, if you'd rather spend your money on shows and meals than on a room, then this place is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly a little gem by the park!!!”
Reviews.Author: DebandFrank
Reviews.Content: If you want 5 star luxury then the Astor is probably not for you but if you want a clean comfortable room, with friendly helpful staff with a subway opposite then it is ideal. We used the hotel as a base and although it is a bit off the beaten track the subway was cheap and easy to use and ran 24hours- a daily ticket is $7-buses also run past the hotel. There is nothing flashy about the Astor- it does not pretend to be a luxury hotel but we really enjoyed our stay and had more money to spend on christmas shopping,shows and meals as it was a cheap break. A delightful surprise was the view from our room. The blinds were down on the window and I decided to raise them to get some light in the room and WOW- what a spectatular view!! The entire Manhattan Skyline-- you wont get a better view from a 5 star hotel!!!! Check out photo!!! I spent a lot of time at that window- it was great by day but breathtaking at night- that alone makes me recommend the Astor-- a little Gem on the park

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money in the shops....”
Reviews.Author: Mothy07
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old daughter and I stayed at this hotel in December this year. Yes the hotel is basic, but clean enough. Rooms were small but adequate for 2. I agree with peoples comments on the fact that you are only sleeping in the hotel so why pay a lot. We got a reasonable deal here flying with American Airlines, whom were excellent with masses of room on the plane. The hotel is quite a way out but after the hustle and bustle of Manhattan the peace is most welcome. We to suffered from a cold room but we asked for an extra blanket which we got straight away and were then more than comfortable. I was a little concerned before we went about getting to and from the hotel but after the first night's long walk back to hotel we tried out the subway. Not pretty but cheap and reliable. We travelled on it at various different times of day and night and never felt unsafe even when we got on the wrong train and ended up in Harlem. Please use the subway, it's by far the easiest way to get around. Shopping as you would expect is fantastic in New York. Try Macy's, Century 21 and Armani Exchange (Time Warner building). Bloomingdales for UGG's, if your lucky enough to get them. Finally TKTS on times square for a really good deal on theatre tickets. New York was brilliant. Only one word of warning, I found exchanging sterling to dollars a little difficult. Finally found a strange place in 5th Avenue but exchange rate was really poor. Did spot a Travelex on times square near the end of the holiday, but banks, unless customers of HSBC won't exchange currency. Last word from me, try Virgil’s of Times square for dinner, it's great, large portions, good quality, reasonable value. If your looking for tourist tat, try RAG. Always, Always pick up leaflets, there are lots of offers for cheap or money off vouchers. New York was brillaint.

Reviews.Title: “Waste of space”
Reviews.Author: Wundering10
Reviews.Content: What a complete waste of space this hotel is. Unless, of course, you were looking for a cheap and nasty little hole with no character, no services, located on the dark side of the moon and you were happy to pay $10 a night for the pleasure. We were booked for 4 nights in New York staying at the Astor. We booked in about 1400ish on the day we arrived, went up to the room and immediately groaned. The room was small, stuffy and impractical. Smoking in the place means that non-smoking rooms are far from clean or in fact, non-smoking. A filthy and unpleasant experience. Hanging space for clothes was limited, no drawers, so the case had to do. OK, maybe not a big deal, but certainly not at all comfortable or convenient. There was no room for two people to be moving around the room, so one had to be on the bed and the other could move. Breathing was optional. The central heating was abysmal, with night long gurgling and whistling from an air relief valve. It sounded like a kettle on the boil all night. Appaling noise that made for a very unpleasant night. The only positive comment is the thanks for one of the best hot showers experienced in a hotel for a long time. But, the bed made up for it by scoring in the high negatives. Sleeping between the tracks at 103rd street Metro station would have been more comfortable than the bed contained therein. After one night on that bed, one was next to paralysed. The most uncomfortable night spent in paid accommodation so far, save a nasty event in Doha which was to be expected. After one disastrous night, the first task was to book a new hotel to enjoy New York. We did, easily. It was in the Theatre District, similar price and a quantum leap better (meaning it was a hotel and was worth praising) Please don’t waste your stay in New York and be foolish enough to waste the tariff on this place, there are so many acceptable in the ‘cheap’ end of the market that aren’t nasty.

Reviews.Title: “What a mistake”
Reviews.Author: GeeaHampshire_
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 7 night stay at Astor on the Park. I too had read differing reviews but as one person said "you will only need it for sleeping" The first room we were given was on the ground floor at the back off the building overlooking a concrete pit!! We asked to be moved as as the hotel suggests it looks over Central Park!! We were offered a change for an additional rate of $25 dollars per night, declined this offer but were then given room 501 again at the back of the hotel but at least we could hardly hear the subway. This room was ok but in the smoking part of the hotel so was a bit smelly!! The windows did not lock so as there were 3 women on our own we were slightly concerned, the maintenance guy fixed it with super glue so just as well there was no fire as this was our exit out!! I absolutley loved New York but this was a huge blight on our holiday, the area around the hotel was not pleasant and we did not venture out at night as the thought off returning in the dark was not good. However it did mean that we spent at least 12 hours out visting sites and shopping etc. Would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TipperaryCatherine
Reviews.Content: Before staying at astor on the park i read a lot of bads reviews about the hotel and was worried but i was pleasantly suprised when i got there, me and my boyfriend spent 3 nights there, the hotel was cleaned everyday and the staff was friendly and really could not complain, the room was boiling at first but when we turned off the radiater and it was perfect, located 15 mins on subway from time square etc, and 25mins in taxi with traffic around $15, really safe location,for the money we paid it was excellent, i really dont no where all the people writing bad reports where staying but we was very happy and i would advise others to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly Adequate”
Reviews.Author: Pip28
Reviews.Content: Astor on the Park is conveniently located on New York's famous Central Park. Although this hotel is situated on the upper west side and on 106th street is quite far from the action, it is approximately 20minutes walk to the Museum of Natural History and around a 30min-40min walk to fifth avenue, Broadway, Times Square and the Rockefeller Centre. It is also in easy access of the subway on 103rd street or 96th street with all of the above in easy reach on train lines B and C. The hotel itself is very clean- fresh towels and rooms cleaned everyday. Other reviews have described rooms as being small but the twin double bed room my sister and I stayed in was surprisingly adequate in size. The staff are friendly with a hint of the stereotypical straight-talking New Yorker!! They were excellent when it came to ordering a taxi to the airport, costing $55 and allow guests to store their luggage until they depart for their flight. The down side to this hotel- as mentioned in every review- is the heating- or lack of!!! The heaters are controlled by the management and the rooms see little benefit of them which tends to leave the room quite cold. The heaters come on at 5am with an incredibly loud banging and spitting noise which can be quite unsettling on the first night when you do not know what the noise is. Depending on the type of sleeper you are, once knowing what the noise is you get used to it or earplugs could be the way to go!!! All in all this hotel caters for all your basic needs and for someone who's more interested in exploring New York than spending their holiday in the hotel room then this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Would Go Back Again”
Reviews.Author: NettsEngland
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at this hotel for 5 nights and had no problems at all. Its true the rooms are quite small but it was perfect for us. They were cleaned every day and the staff were fine. There was some work going on in the hotel but it didnt bother us. I would definitely go back again and really do not have anything bad to say about the staff or the hotel. If you do decide to stay here at the Astor there is a lovely sandwich place on the corner (take a left as you come out the hotel) and the tube station is also round the corner which is a great as its not far to go. I dont really understand the other reviews maybe we were just lucky but it was perfect for us. I hope you have a good a time that i did - cant wait to go back again!!! x

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear!”
Reviews.Author: Formatge
Reviews.Content: We booked in and paid in advance for three nights and stayed only one. The basic problem is that this is a workman's, contractors or backpackers hotel being sold on many UK websites as a tourist hotel! The hotel is dirty with very cheap broken furniture, broken televisions and no facilities beside a quirky vending machine and a one dollar for five minutes internet service that crashes every two minutes. I could list many things during the short time we stayed. The room heating was either off or on with whistling kettle noise from the rad. We had wet lime green paint throughout the corridors which made the rooms very smelly. The admittedly clean bathroom had either very scalding hot or freezing water and blocked drains. We were given the choice of three rooms and turned them all down. All were tiny and way too depressing for a tourist visit to New York. The young receptionist was very apologetic with a weariness that showed she had experienced this every week. We paid almost $300 per night for a hotel that should charge a maximum of $100 in it's present state. We paid only slightly more for an amazing hotel room for the other two nights. Please avoid this scam!

Reviews.Title: “Astor 3 & 4 December 2007”
Reviews.Author: dkz1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is adequate (small rooms) for the money and clean, but no heat (typical NY radiator heat that managment controls - only turned on the first night and then too late to do much good), TV did not work, no wash clothes the second day, staff was pleasant but on morning we were leaving two employees got into a heated discussion complete with profanity.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lynnie82
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at this hotel for a week at the end of November to the beginning of December and can't fault it for the price. The accomodation was relatively cheap so we weren't expecting 5 star (rated 3 star by the travel agent and it lived up to this rating) however when we arrived we were kindly greeted by the doorman who helped us with our luggage and a very pleasant receptionist who checked us in. We had a view of Central Park which we requested and the room we were given was quite small but adequate. The room next to us was larger which would have accommodated our luggage better but the room was clean which is the most important thing. We had fresh towels every day, as expected and the room was well tended despite our untidiness. The shower had great pressure even though we were on the 7th floor and the bathroom was new and well kept. The lift that serviced the whole buiding was not a problem and only a 2 minute wait at the most and that was usually in the busy times. The hotel is a few blocks away from 2 underground stations (103rd Street stop in the South and 110th Street in the North) which are within easy walking distance. We purchased 7-day metrocards which were great value for money as it is the fastest and easiest way to get around the city. Of course, there are a plentitude of yellow cabs which the doorman of the hotel will kindly flag down for you as well as booking airport transfers for you. Excellent service. I suggest the other review which stated that the hotel was far out of the centre should either choose another city to visit that is smaller for their convenience or pay premium rates for a hotel that requires no walking or any effort to see the sights as they seem unwilling to make any effort to experience the city. The hotel is located on Central Park West which is the road directly bordering the park so it's great to be looking over onto trees and not another building. The hotel itself had internet availibility in the basement which was excellent and not too expensive. They also have vending machines for drinks and snacks if required. I agree with the comment that a tea/coffee making facillity would have been beneficial but for all the time spent in the room it wasn't a bad point. There is a great cafe just one block north that serves excellent home cooked food that we visited every morning - very tasty! New York is such an expensive city for accommodation that we couldn't fault this hotel on any major points. It was great value for money. The staff were all very friendly and we will definitely be staying there again the next time we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: ej1985
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 10 night stay in Astor on the park and it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. We arrived on the Friday night and was shown to a room that was just big enough for the double bed and had a view into another persons room. The room was freezing cold and then about 5am the radiators came on and all we could hear was banging and whistling from the radiator. The next morning after complaining we were moved to another room that was abit bigger and had a view over the park so thought things were going to get better, how wrong we were!!. The TV did not work in the room, the toilet overflowed twice and the heating was only turned on about 4 times throughout our whole stay and this was always about 5am so again we was woken up by the banging and whistling of the radiator. When we complained about the cold we were given a heater that could be plugged in which was ok for a while but then the wire started smoking and almost caught on fire. The windows were dirty and the vending machines in the basements were not working some of the time. The only good thing I can say about this hotel is that the room was cleaned every day and we were given clean towels. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and do not believe the reviews on this hotel that say it is good value for money, it definitely is not!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly pleasant !!!!”
Reviews.Author: djm28
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from this hotel, ok, we had some minor problems, soon as reported they were fixed, staff on reception what can i say but FANTASTIC, room and bathroom cleaned every day, absolutley spotless.I have no issues whatsoever with this hotel you get what you pay for , lets face it yre in New York you dont want to spend all day in yre room, do you ???? Debs & margie x Chadderton England

Reviews.Title: “Adequate Stay @ Astor On The Park”
Reviews.Author: Stvhales
Reviews.Content: So, I got home yesterday (27.11.07) after staying at the Astor On The Park for 4 Nights! My partner and I arrived on Thursday (22.11.07) to a lady at reception who was on the phone, so instead of finishing her conversation she proceeded to check us in whilst still on the phone which meant that we had to repeat ourselves a few times as she wasn't concentrating. We got in our room which was room 311, small but clean and adequate. The room had an amazing view of some walls and windows but that wasn't really a problem as it was just a room to sleep in. The bed was comfortable and the pillows were GREAT possibly the best pillows ever, At night when we were sleeping it was cold, so we turned the radiator on, at about 2300 hours, but didnt kick in until about 0300 - 0400 hours and when it did you knew about it. The banding and the rattling was SO loud, we ended up turning it off because the noise kept us awake so we slept being very cold. That was the worst thing about the hotel. The rooms were cleaned everyday and the maids did a marvellous job of that. It is quite away from all the main things in NYC. The surronding areas seemed a bit dodgy when we went for a walk to find some food but that could be down to being somewhere we didn't know. The hotel is situation on Central Park West 106th Street, the nearest subway is 103rd Street which takes you into Times Square, takes about 10mins once on the train but we did wait for some time at times for a train to arrive. Overall, this is a good place to stay in Spring/Summer I should imagine so no need for the radiator to be on, and it is ideal if you just want a place to crash and that isnt a hostel. I won't come back to this hotel, because I regret not staying in central more as after a massive day of shopping/sightseeing you just want to get to your hotel as quick as possible. Overall 5/10 is my rating.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Astor”
Reviews.Author: kayWexford
Reviews.Content: Have just rerurned from a very disappointing encounter with the Astor on the Park hotel New York. Soaking wet floors, mouldy carpets and a three inch gap under the door were only the beginning. We viewed four rooms before we decided we could not stay in such conditions and moved to another hotel. We are now in the middle of the lenghty process of trying to get a full refund. A nighmare!

Reviews.Title: “Shocking !!!!! never again”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandAlan
Reviews.Content: My wife and i arrived 06 Nov 07 walked in to reception and thought [--] what have i done. i accept total responsibility for booking this hell hole the room was 8 foot square,plumbing was the loudest i've ever heard the out look was into more windows,the wardrobe had 2 hangers and only one drawer the location was a bit out but the subway system was excellent but a bit dodgy for women at night ,getting the lift was a bit of a wait ,in the morning it was occupied and under the command of the cleaning staff(that's got be the joke of the year)the coffee out of the machine $1 would have been the only value in this joint but it only half filled the cup Needless to sat the park bench across the street looked inviting but was too cold.but cleaner

Reviews.Title: “Its only ok!”
Reviews.Author: gemmacotter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel on 106th street in manhatten. the room was tiny and the double bed was really small. there are no amenities in the hotel like a bar, or restaurant. the heating was either blasting or off. but its in a nce location and the staff were nice. its not as if you soend much time in the room anyway!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: happybagger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Astor on the Park for 4 nights in early October 2007. After trawling through all the reviews we thought we were selecting a medium range hotel for the cost of £477.00. We were bitterly disappointed. Upon arriving at the hotel we were shown to our room which measured eight foot by eight foot. We asked to be moved but were met with such a negative attitude that it was obvious that the staff could not be bothered. As we had pre-paid for this hotel we were trapped. The room was delapidated, shoddy but just about clean enough to sleep in. The TV did not work the wardrobe door was hanging off. There are no facilities at this hotel other than a vending machine in the basement, which was always empty, which to get to I had to clamber over dirty laundry. The hotel is located on the Upper West side of Central Park, a couple of blocks walk to the Subway which was a 15 minute ride into Times Square. Life is full of mistakes and we learn all the time. You only get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy plumbing!!”
Reviews.Author: sunbeam57
Reviews.Content: Have just come back from New York last Friday, after staying at the Astor. If only there were coffee/tea making facilities in the rooms, I would have rated it higher! Having to get dressed and troll down to the basement at 7am wasnt fun! The basement also serves as internet/vending machine area/staff room. When we put the air conditioning on at night as it was quite warm, the radiator in the room started to bang and clank like it was going to explode!! (it was switched off) This happened every night, despite asking for it to be looked at. I found the manager very pushy, and seemed not to be as amenable if you dont book trips with him! I was slightly annoyed at the end of our stay, as we had planned to catch the Port Authority bus back to New Jersey airport, but as we were leaving the hotel to do last minute sightseeing and check for bus times - Mohammed (the manager) - told us that the Port Authority bus took 3 hours, and why not use the hotel car at $65? Of course we did - only to find at the airport that the Port Authority bus took 25 minutes and cost 25$!!!! This from a fellow passenger who had caught it!! So just beware!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: cahald
Reviews.Content: We arrived here on Sunday the 4th November 2007 from Ireland for one week,The housekeeper took us to about 4 different rooms before we setteled and at that it was a total kip. On Monday morning i askedo speak to a manager and told it was not possible as he was not there at that time we asked a few times to speak to him but was told each time that he was not available, we tried to move but could not find any other accomodation for that week due to a marathon everywere was booked out. The room was rotten dirty and the carpet was stinkin there was a terrible smell from the bathroom and it was tiny. The lift was also terrible and once you went in you would be afraid that you woudnt come out alive. If it was the last place on earth i woudn't stay there again and i would not recommend it, all redidents said the samething that week, We could have got far better accomodation for the same money we paid and a better location all i can say it was an a experience and it will be the last time that i will ever book through a travel agent again dont be fooled by this please if you are thinking of booking this hotel please reconsider and sleep on the street as it would be cleaner and warmer.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible”
Reviews.Author: ned1Ireland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weeks holiday in New York. This holiday had been booked for a year and we were really loking forward to it, and this hotel almost ruined the experience!! We arrived late at night after a very long flight to find we were not allocated the rooms we booked, the receptionists answer was a shrug, and she got worse as the night went on. Our room was tiny, could not fit our cases past the bed! The sheets had hairs and stains on them,(clean linen is a fairly basic requirement). I asked at reception for clean sheets, twenty minutes later a young man handed me sheets in order for me to change our own sheets, these sheets were wet!! In all we were moved three times that night. I requested to speak to a manager and told it wasn't possible, asked if I coul get a refund, was told I would have to ring a booking handler. Eventually given a room with two beds, carpets were filthy and wet and we slept in tracksuits it was so cold. Huge gap under bedroom door, dread to think what might have been able to fit under it, bathroom door hanging off hinges!!! Location is by no means convenient, its 55 blocks to downtown Manhattan, so be willing to take taxis everywhere, also its not exactly the type of place to be walking around at night time As soon as the travel agent opened on Monday morning we told him our problems and were relocated to a much cleaner and central hotel. I have stayed in hostels that were far superior than this and I am not exaggerating, all I was asking for was a clean place to stay at night, and eventhough you spend hardly any time in your room while in NY you don't want to sleep in someone elses dirty sheets!!! Do not stay in this hotel, I do not understand how anybody has one positive thing to say about it, avoid it at all costs, NY hotels are expensive but you can get alot more for your money than this!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic but clean, not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: User0910
Reviews.Content: Astor on the Park is extremely basic, but what more can you expect from the price! For what we paid, we couldnt expect any more. The first room we were given was tiny - there was literally a foot of space surrounding the bed!! you could touch both walls at the same time.. However we asked to move and this was done swiftly and with no complications. The second room had 2 double beds and therefore was larger, but proportionately it was the same. The room was fully equipped with a wardrobe, drawers, a small but spotlessly clean bathroom with a ledge for toiletries, plug sockets, tv, alarm/radio and phone. Each day the room was cleaned to a very high standard (and my standards are high!!) and clean towels were provided. Yes, Astor on the Park is small and basic, but in NY you are hardly in the hotel during the day, just at night to sleep and shower! There is a diner and grocery stores 30 seconds walk away, and the hotel is directly opposite central park, which is great (and very quiet). The subway is also only 3 blocks away, and it takes about 15 mins to get downtown. 15 mins walk from the hotel is a street full of restaurants, diners, pharmacies and nail bars. The only down side is that the hotel is all the way uptown, but that's not too much of a problem if you're out all day. If you want a relaxing spa-type holiday, dont stay at the astor, but if you want a clean and efficient base in NY and are on a budget, it's the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: patnancy49
Reviews.Content: We arrived early, about 1 ish and didn't have to wait until 3 pm but were promptly given a room.I asked for a low floor and a good view and we were given the 3rd floor overlooking Central Park.How cool is that! I don't know where these other people were staying ,if at all in the same hotel.But the place was spotless & kept clean everyday. The bedroom & bathroom was fine,lovely sheets and pillows...........clean towels everyday and the lift was working also. As for noise from the air conditioner,I have never heard a completely silent one. I suffer from inflamatory rheumatoid arthritus and with the aid of todays wonderful medicine ,I am now very mobile. We were able to either walk a couple of blocks to the subway or wait over the road for the bus hardly a trek to the moon! Or indulge in a yellow cab for coming home..We went on tours ( the concierge guy was very helpful) .If people bothered to look there were eateries nearby.All in all we spent 5 lovely and unforgettable days there. We can afford to go to places with bars etc...............why bother when the idea of seeing a great city is to GET OFF YOUR MOANING BACKSIDES AND HAVE FUN!!!!!!!!! We come from Brighton and price for price you cannot even compare New York..............value for money it wins every time.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: maddyMiddx
Reviews.Content: Only stay here if you are used to living in a student bedsit!! Room very small window looked out onto bird poo and dumped furniture. Room felt like a prison cell. Bathroom door did not shut, torn carpet, plug socket and shower head falling off the wall. If your on ground floor the subway runs all night keeping you awake that if the air con unit does'nt already. We lasted 1 night instead of the 4 we had booked for. The only good thing is the staff are very friendly. Never ever again!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I cried!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyTW
Reviews.Content: We were expecting the Astor to be basic but when we got into our room that was only just big enough to fit in the double bed I cried. We were on our honeymoon and I was very upset. My husband complained and we got moved to a larger room that was slightly better but under par. There was no natural light in the room and we couldn't even tell what the weather was like from the room as we couldn't see the sky. It was very depressing. The staff were mostly miserable and tried to con us into getting a cab to the airport through them that was greatly over priced. When we said we'd rather get the subway we were told that that wasn't a good idea as it would take 4 hours to JFK when infact it took 1 hour. I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A flea-pit!!!”
Reviews.Author: Soheila
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to the 'Big Apple' and stayed at the Astor on the Park. Do not be fooled by the other reviews - this place stinks!!! It is filthy dirty, the toilets overflow, the staff are surly and downright rude, the concierge gives you false information - ie $65 to the airport - flat rate guaranteed - when we got there the driver said 'no - $83 - he always says that!!', beetles crawl the walls, the carpet is so disgusting I wouldn't walk on it without my shoes and the lift ensures you say your prayers and ensure your family know your last wishes before you get on board. It was a terrible experience and one I would not like to repeat. This place should be drummed out of business.

Reviews.Title: “got my ipod stolen from the hotel room”
Reviews.Author: maybenot12
Reviews.Content: this was the worst hotel I have ever stayed in. The pictures of the hotel look lovely but when you actually get there it is grotty, grubby and rough. The lift was broken and we had to drag our cases up the narrow stairs without any help. If that wasnt bad enough, our IPOD WAS STOLEN FROM THE HOTEL ROOM while we were out. when we complained to the manager he smirked and muttered at the other staff in spanish, without even offering an apology or help. he said that it was our fault and we lost it, even though the maid remembered "leaving it on the bed" never stay here, it is a waste of money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Kimber4
Reviews.Content: Staying at this hotel was great!!! We say an excellent price on hotelrooms365.com for $99 a night. When we checked into the hotel on July 12th we were so amazed by how good it looked for such a low price. At first we had one queen size bed, but we met the front desk clerk and asked her for a room with double beds and she let us switch for free. Central park in right across the street. I would recommend to take the subway train on 103rd street, it's alot closer and also safer. My best friend and I had a wonderful time in New York. The hotel guest were pretty nice. We met such great people here. Also I would recommend the C train, because it takes you to timesquare, canal street etc.. The D train takes you to Coney Island. Staying here at this hotel was great. It's right in a safe neighborhood. You can do walking through Central Park, or walk through the neighborhood. Also you can take the M10 bus late night if you don't want to use the subway. Also get a unlimited Metro Card. I plan to travel back to NYC next year and I will be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for your money!”
Reviews.Author: JudyGrace
Reviews.Content: If you just want a clean, safe and inexpensive place to sleep, then this is the hotel for you. Yes, the rooms are small but I was quite impressed with the cleanliness and level of comfort. We had large fluffy towels and big pillows. The beds were neatly made every day. Our room was brighter than that of our children, and this made a difference. Ask for the room at the end of the corridor (the one with the patio door -- don't worry -- it is sealed shut). The staff were very friendly and helpful. Parking was available at a fairly reasonable rate a few streets down, at 20 dollars a day. Do be aware however, when taking the subway at night, that not all trains function. We spent over an hour one night waiting for a train that never came.

Reviews.Title: “Staff were very kind to us - they really made the experience.”
Reviews.Author: paolonz
Reviews.Content: Well! What can I say, my girlfriend and I came her all the way from New Zealand. Maybe it pays to be from far away, because the clerk was very impressed and chatted away to us about Lord of the rings and NZ things. Anyway the hotel itself was quite small, but I wasn't expecting the ritz. The room was small but had a great bed and the whole place was clean including the bathroom. I think it is a U.S thing, the toilets have such a narrow hole and kept blocking because of us. But service was so quick and a guy nicely unblocked it late at night for us and wouldn't even accept a tip, really thought this was beyond the call of duty and so polite - didn't get his name but think he was the janitor. We found the subway stop was a short walk up or down from the hotel, and once on there you are in times square in a few minutes. When we left, the clerk took us outside and for ten minutes attempted to hail cabs as we were running late and hadn't booked a taxi. Such a nice guy, he eventually got us a cab and we made it in time to our connection. So to sum up, this was September 2006 - and what the hotel lacked in size\features\location. It made up in amazing staff who seemed to make the most of this place, and really gave us an amazing memory of New York which i will remember for a lifetime. Thanks to all the staff at Astor in the Park who were so kind to us.

Reviews.Title: “It will pass if your looking for somewhere to sleep”
Reviews.Author: nordicgirl8
Reviews.Content: The neighborhood is pretty good and quiter at night compared to being in downtown Manhattan, but the lobby is very small and the elevator can accomodate 2 -4 people unless you have luggage then it will only fit 2 people. So you wait or use the somewhat treacherous stairs. Our room had that old smoke smell - but the air conditioner kept it comfortable, which is easy to do because the room is so small. The bathrooms were clean. The beds comfortable. They did supply nice linens. Request 2 beds and you may get a larger room. They have vending machines somewhere - possibly in the basement. But you have to go elsewhere for any kind of food. They do have do have a doorman posted it seemed at all times and we felt safe inside the hotel. Central Park is right across the street.
