We rode the subway to get to most of the other attractions, not a lot to see within walking distance. If you ride the subway you should buy an unlimited ride pass for the time you are there. I would rather stay somewhere with a lounge and a restaurant available and ice and vending machines on all the floors. I don't know if any of the rooms have fridges but it would have been nice to put your bakery purchases into something to keep them cold.

Reviews.Title: “Good base and value for money!”
Reviews.Author: chocolatespot
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights, which we booked last minute on the internet the day before we went. It was a good base for sightseeing New York. The concierge doesn't have great local knowledge and generally wants to sell you trips in order for him to get commission, i would suspect! We booked a helicopter trip with him, which we are glad we did - as you need to reserve a place the day before and it was the same price if we'd booked it ourselves. We also booked a car to the airport with him-but this was a bit of rip off compared to the cost of the taxi from the airport. Paid $47 from the airport, plus tips, and the cab he books is $55 plus tips and also $5 for a toll bridge - which they don't tell you about. If you've got the time and aren't too tired would recommend you get the subway instead - much much cheaper! Location - only 3 blocks up from the subway, right opposite the north west side of central park. Recommend you get a day or week pass, as it's the best way to travel and it starts early, runs late and it's frequent. The doorman will probably try and sell you a red bus sightseeing tour - which we purchased, but it wasn't a great way to get around as the traffic is so busy, so wasn't great value for money - although nice to have a guided tour. Also there is a voucher for $5 off the tour (on the table of leaflets in reception) if you buy the tour yourself! Rooms - Beds comfortable, nice bathroom, and very clean - daily cleaning is good. The rooms are quite small, but you don't get much for your money in New York. If get a cheap deal like we did, then it's def worth the money. There is a TV and Air con, but no safe! Food - The cafe around the corner does great breakfasts and massive lunches. If you like seafood and want to eat local to the hotel - suggest you walk (or get the subway) to the national history museum and go 1 block over to the left onto Columbus Avenue- where you will find a raft of restaurants - would recommend Ocean Grill - 384 Columbus Avenue....great fish! Would also recommend Ruth and Chris's steak house - 148 West 51st Street. Summary - This is a good basic hotel and although it's been recently refurbished, could still do with some decor improvements. Overall good value for money and out of the city enough to be a bit more local - but close enough to see all the sights and spend lots of money shopping for bargains!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base for the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: emmah123
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Astor in April 2007 and for the price we paid (relatively cheap) we cannot complain. The front of house staff were lovely, the beds comfortable and the room was somewhat small but fairly quiet. The bed linen and towels were changed every day when the room was cleaned and the high pressure shower was superb. The hotel is a little out of downtown Manhattan but with the subway so close, we weren't moaning. It was so quick and easy to get to just about any part of New York, and cheap too. We bought an unlimited weekly pass for $24...a bargain considering how much we used it. All in all, it was a great base for our 7 day stay in New York. The room was comfortable, clean and secure. We didn't come to the city to sit in our room all day. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lWe loved our stay here and will definately be returning.”
Reviews.Author: daisydooLondon
Reviews.Content: We had read other travellers reviews and were quite worried about staying here. However i was plesantly surprised with this hotel. The room we had had the most fantstic view of the city. The beds were really comfortable, the room was clean, bathroom cleaned daily. The staff were very friendly, any problems we had were dealt with immediately. Lifts worked well. Hotel organised cabs for return flight, standard fee $65 to Newark.. Lovely area, away from the hustle and bustle but so easy to get into the city, minutes walk to the subway. We used 103rd. Felt very safe at all times of the day. Saved a great deal staying here. Fantastic if all you want is a clean comfortable bed to sleep in, most of your other time should be spent out exploring the city there is just so much to see and do. We will definately be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect short break hotel”
Reviews.Author: NotesFromABroad
Reviews.Content: The Astor was perfect for our 4 day NY break. Spotless room & bathroom, friendly staff, the most comfortable hotel beds I've ever encountered and we liked being out of the chaos of midtown, esp. being right on Central Park. Yes, the hotel is a little worn around the edges (there was some renovation going on while we were there however) but for a budget priced hotel in New York, the Astor is great. We had a twin room near the back of the hotel so no view (not a high priority!) but it was lovely and quiet. No sign of the infamous clanging pipes! The room was made up every day with new linen and towels - even our pj's were folded crisply! Subway stops two blocks in either direction (103rd or 110th) - recommend getting the 7 day unlimited Metro card for $24. Cabs were about $13 from Broadway after dark (you have to work hard to flag one!) Grocery store for basics round the corner on 107th and took tip from earlier review and breakfasted at Saurins Cafe on 110th - lovely place. For a basic, clean room in NY, the Astor is perfect. Who goes to New York to hang around in their hotel anyway? The money you save here can be spent on enjoying the city.

Reviews.Title: “Astor on the park”
Reviews.Author: ALGB
Reviews.Content: Good points: value for money, excellent room, very friendly/helpful staff and manager, near central park. Negative: distance from midtown/downtown, single lift, location seems safe, but would not recommend night walks too far away! Not for those seeking and wishing/able to pay for swish hotel. If you just want a clean room at affordable price this is recommended. Breakfast at the Lexquisitis, round the block (153 Manhattan Ave) Banana porridge is a must! The manager seems keen to sell bus tours and arrange a cab back to airport. We agreed to the latter which was fine, but check with driver that the flat charge includes the toll price, before you get in. Tips are extra. Subway station a 5min walk away. 103rd st. $7 fun day pass for unlimited travel. Taxis are not any faster, but maybe more relaxing (but much more expensive) Would definately stay again, but may look for somthing nearer downtown if price was as good.

Reviews.Title: “More than adequate”
Reviews.Author: LorraineDonegal
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one week with my husband and four others. The double room we had was a little small but certainly not the smallest I've ever stayed in. The rooms were serviced daily and the bathroom was spotless as far as I could see. The staff were helpful, in particular, one of the doormen (I can't remember his name but he was brazilian). The only compliant I have is that on the final day of our stay we left all our lugguge with reception so that they would hold it for the day. There were nine or ten bags and we got a ticket for each bag. A different door man (not the brazilian guy) took charge of them and was suitably tipped for his trouble. Later when our limo (which the brazilian doorman orgaised for us) arrived we handed in all the tickets and were given what we thought was all of the luggage. It wasn't until we reached JFK that we realised two of the bags were missing. Of course we should have double checked at the hotel that all bags were returned to us. We had to pay another sixty dollars to have the bags sent out to the airport. Maybe the not so helpful doorman could have used some of his tip for the fare? Anyway, overall the hotel was just perfect for our purposes. It was only a short stroll down to 103rd to get the subway which we did every day. I would definitly recommend this hotel to anyone who would prefer to be a bit out of the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: ben2301
Reviews.Content: Returned last week from a 4-night stay at the Astor. Slghtly apprehensive from reading some of the negative reviews but as usual they proved to be unfounded. Hotel is clean, rooms are small but spotless, beds are comfortable, shower is powerful and hot. That's all bases covered, as far as I'm concerned - we only needed somewhere to crash at the end of the day. Coffee and internet in the basement too, should you wish. Hotel is slightly out of the way but even when we took the subway back from Battery Park (by Statue of Liberty) it only took us about half an hour. Got used to the subway very quickly - get a 7-day pass for $24, head to the station on 103rd, down to Columbus Cirlce where you can change for pretty much anywhere else. We saw a couple of shows - The Producers and Chicago and would recommend both without hesitation. Bought tickets on the day from each box office with no problem. Good places to eat - the Broadway Diner just off Times Square for breakfast, John's Pizzeria (next to St James Theatre) and Bubba Gump's (Times Square again) and the Heartland, in the basement of the Empire State Building. Would recommend the Astor to anyone - one last bonus, we arrived late at night still on UK time so I was wide awake at 6am and got up before my girlfriend in the mornings... it was nice to be able to wander round Central Park, and just sit outside the hotel and watch the city wake up. Hope this helps - feel free to email me at ben_sowden@btinternet.com if you need to ask anything

Reviews.Title: “Better than Expected”
Reviews.Author: brooksy55
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from 3 night stay at this hotel and it was better than I had expected. We booked the trip on a whim last minute, 2 days before going and were looking for something on a budget. After booking I then went onto Trip Advisor and read the reviews and started to get a bit worried - what had I done? What can I say? Definately better than expected. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly, ordering us a car to the airport and pointing us in the right direction for the Metro. Although this hotel is a little out of the way, the Metro station is 3 blocks away and the trains run fairly regularly (we waited no more than 5 minutes) and we could always get on them, even in rush hour. This was a cheap way of getting around, costing $2 per trip, anywhere. A taxi from Central Park in rush hour, still only cost us $15. The rooms were small, but cleaned every day and the bed was really comfy - a must after all that walking! The bathroom was almost as big as the room and we had no problems with getting enough hot water or clean towels. They provided us with a clock radio, whcih was also a CD player and there was a TV in the room too. The downside to this hotel is the small rooms, no coffee making facilities in the room, although there is free coffee in the lobby and the view was non-existent, but I didn't go to New York to spend time in my hotel room! I would recommend this hotel to a traveller on a budget who doesn't mind a bit of walking and who's aim is to experience New York.

Reviews.Title: “we loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: shell1431
Reviews.Content: We have returned home from new york today feeling very tired but very happy. New york was very tiering but luckily we had a lovely hotel to go back to. We couldn't of asked for more from the staff all of them were really friendly and sorted anything out for us straight away. Nothing was too much trouble. Coffee was always available and they kept our room spotless for us. We had a lovely view onto central park. We were far enough from the main centre to avoid all the noise. We felt safe in a city we didnt know. Thankyou to all the staff who made it a pleasure for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: turboclicker
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have just returned from a 7 day stay at the Astor on the Park. We found it very comfortable, clean and excellent value for money. The staff were helpful and friendly. At the time of booking we asked for and got a room overlooking Central Park. The room was fine, far from luxury but more than adequate. Although the hotel is quite a way uptown it is very accesible by subway, the station is just 2 blocks away. But we mainly used the bus M10 that stopped right outside the hotel and takes you to the heart of mid-town Manhattan. A weekly ticket for unlimited use on buses and subway costs just $24. A cab from Times Square to the hotel costs $13. We actually enjoyed being a bit further away from the tourist areas. It felt more like staying in the real New York. Some parts of the surrounding area aren't that hot, but these are easily avoided. There is also plenty around the hotel worth seeing. Columbia University, the Cathedral of St John the Divine and Morningside Park are a short walk away. Also, if you're a Seinfeld fan you will want to visit Tom's restaurant which is near Columbia University on Broadway, about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. Of course you can also visit it if you're not a Seinfeld fan and enjoy the excellent value food! The down points to the hotel were; - Blocked toilet (fairly common based on other reviews. My tip to avoid this is, um, to flush regulalry, little and often!!! - Over hot central heating (despite it being minus 10 outside)! But just put the aircon on to deal with that. - The whole hotel could do with re-carpetting. - Make sure you don't do as my wife did and use the local call number when phoning from the room using the very cheap phone cards. Use the freephone number. On some phone cards this is not that clear. We had to pay a $79 bill on checking out because of that. All in all though, considering the rate for this hotel it was a great stay. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean isn't enough”
Reviews.Author: Wannabe-Explorer
Reviews.Content: There are mixed reviews of the hotel and we had read in guidebooks do not go above 96th Street. The hotel is on the block of 103rd Street and should have served as a warning. One of the three porters was very nice and friendly, all of the other staff looked like they had something better to be doing. None of the facilities exist like in the photos and the room was tiny but clean. There was no room safe, though this was not a problem as on a couple of occasions we had forgotten to pack valuables and cash to return and find it all still as we had left it; the room service even didn't collect there tip until we wrote them a note explaining to them. The biggest problem was the heating full on or off and the noise. There is a constant banging from the elevator and the heating system is at full volume at around 3am with the occasional bang from a hallway door which shook the hotel room walls so even our ear plugs couldn't help here. We would not go back to this hotel, the hotel was too noisey and too far especially with engineering works on the subway which do not run as frequently as the London tube service.

Reviews.Title: “Would probably go back...”
Reviews.Author: ra_life
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Astor on the Park for three nights in february. It was a lot nicer than other places I have stayed in New York and had a lovely bathroom. I can't understand people complaining about how far out it is, surely this is something you check before you book? You can pay more to stay in the centre of town if you want. The same goes for there not being a restaurant - they never claimed to have one. If you want one - stay elsewhere! All the staff were friendly, the room was cleaned and there were fresh towels everyday. It was lovely and warm which was great considering the freezing weather! The only fault really was the noisy heating. You could hear it clanging and rumbling at night but it didn't bother us that much. We were pretty tired by then anyway! It might bother some people. I think we would probably go back if we found ourselves in NY again.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY”
Reviews.Author: looby/wales
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a 5 day stay in the astor on the park, the staff were excellent,however we did have problems with the toilet in our room, but in all fairness the staff came to the rescue straight away Enrique was a hero!! the problem was not fixed so they moved us to another room which was no problem but we found the room too hot so we had to ask for the heating turned down, the room was very basic, but also very clean,and clean linen every day...we felt that it was a little out of the way,but could get the subway to where ever we wanted to go ,although i would not use them at night...we really enjoyed our stay in new york,and would go back to the astor,value for money.........

Reviews.Title: “Location Location (miles from anywhere)”
Reviews.Author: mike7202
Reviews.Content: Stayed here March 2007. One of the Worst hotel we have stayed in. Ok not expecting the Ritz, however windows screwed down and 1st room stunk of paint from the rooms they were decorating(badly) room was also boiling hot even though radiator was not on (hate to think how hot it would be in the summer especially with not being able to open the window). Second room was better however still boiling hot & window screwed down, decor was a little better however it looked like Bob the builder had done the decorating nothing was finished properly . Not a good location for getting around NY, the furthest end of Central Park, therefore one of the furthest points from central Manhattan.None of the attractions in walking distance apart from the park.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst Facilities Ever Experienced”
Reviews.Author: 3sistersMelbourne
Reviews.Content: Whilst our stay in New York was fantastic, our experience with Astor on the Park was less than desirable. The rooms were tiny and the smoking rooms were unbearable to spend even one minute in. We are smokers and even we couldn't cope with the smell. There was no window that could be opened so we asked for a non smoking room and did our smoking outside. The phones in the rooms (in the whole hotel) were down for three days and no attempt was made by management to recify the problem. I was told that I could purchase a phone card if I wanted to. Family at home were upset because they were ringing and unable to contact us. I had to have a heated disageement with reception staff before they would agree to provide us with phone cards at their expense. The drink machine was out of order, the snack machine was out of order. the internet re-booted when it felt like it. The TV in the room was broken, sometimes you could get stations and sometimes not. The time spent in the shower was very limited as the bath filled with water due to bloked drains. We constantly had to ask for toilet paper, towels and face cloths, even though house keeping had been in everyday. I will never stay there again and I will tell others not to as well. Disgraceful facilities to say the least!

Reviews.Title: “Spot on”
Reviews.Author: caddersWestYorkshire
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel 9th -14th February 2007. Taxi $65 dollars from Newark . Should have taken Super Shuttle from the airport which would have worked out much cheaper. Used super shuttle on return to airport and only cost $40 including tip. Hotel check in was quick and easy . Nice clean room on 9th floor with a good view of the park and New York City sky line. Very clean room , maids did an excellent job . Didnt hear any noise as such but spent very little time in the room , atfer all you dont come to New York to sleep or watch tele in your hotel room. Hotel very close to red and blue subway line which will take you straight to the heart of the action. You can even travel directly to South Ferry (Statue of Liberty etc) for $2. Had no problems using subway late at night. We took a couple of tours with Grey line on the open top bus , very cold but very informative. We also took the bus to Woodbury Common retail park . This is a very very very cheap place to shop . Take empty bags and grab the bargains. Highlight of my stay was Top of Rock which in my opinion was much better than the Empire State Building. Overall the hotel was spot on for our stay in New York and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Small, Noisy, Staff needs a smile...”
Reviews.Author: MalibuGeoFF
Reviews.Content: I got a good deal on SkyAuction for a week at the Astor. We booked online and chose 1 bed, and I requested a feather pillow. We arrived around midnight, and the night clerk could not have had too many rooms left to arrive, yet took a while to find our booking. He then asked if we wanted one or two beds. (It started to become clear that it had been a good idea that I brought my own pillow). Although the room was prepaid, he insisted that I sign a form advising me that if the key was not returned there was a $150 charge. He gave us room 304, but looked at me like I was from another planet when I asked for a second key for my travel companion. The elevator was clean and brightly lit, but small. The hallways are done in a nice boutique style, but the building is old and the hallways narrow. Unlike newer properties where there is a buffer between your room and the hallway (usually a closet and bathroom), you have only the thin door between you and any noisy guests who arrive drunk late at night, early morning loud tourists, or maids calling 'Housekeeping' loudly at another room on your hall. The rooms are clean, the double or twin beds comfortable, the beds are French-sheeted (blanket topped with a sheet) as a bedspread would be difficult to stow in such a petite space. The Queen-sized synthetic pillows were probably the most comfortable I've ever had in a hotel, and as a road warrior, I've seen the good, bad and jet-puffed...! Our request for an extra cotton blanket happily responded to with 2! Wall mounted night tables, good reading lamps, but the phones did not work for our first two nights there. A small closet unit housed the TV, and we were given two remotes for some reason...? If you can fit 7 hangers in the closet, youll be lucky. The apple green walls were calming, and the steam heat although hissing, whistling or chirping was effective. The window A/C would do OK in the summer, but no fresh air possible. The bathroom was redone in georgeous marble squares, but when installing the full mirror, they cracked the mirror where the light fixture was mounted. Nice amenities, and very fluffy towels. Some should be replaced due to stains obviously missed by a blind housekeeper who folded them and could not have missed it. 3 towels, 2 hand towels, a bath mat, but no face cloths, it seems. It had a good tub, but the grouting between the tiles has come out in some places, and the caulking of the tub has turned black in a few places and should be replaced. The handle for the shower faucet was either not installed properly, or has broken, the maid should have advised maintenance... Maids are friendly and usually do a very good job. The coffee and tea in the lower lobby is a nice touch, but bring your own creamers from the deli unless the powdered white stuff is to your taste.The CD clock radios described in the website were not in evidence, and the requested 4 am wakeup call came at 4:40 forcing us to cab it to the airport instead of taking the subway. Good value, no frills, OK location, popular with non US guests. No safe in room. Vending machines often out of order. Internet in basement available for an extra fee. 3 blocks to the C line subway and then a few stops to Columbus Circle, 10 minutes to Times Square. A short walk to coffee shops on Broadway or all night pizza. I'd stay there again to save money, but the 2 star rating is fair.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad considering the reviews I had read”
Reviews.Author: kildaremary
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 5th Feb and the lock was dodgy on my room so the porter asked the receptionist to get me another room. She sorted this out after 20mins and I was given 805. The room was very clean, although the tv didnt really work and there was no view to speak of, although neither of those bothered me. Whe I headed out, I was shown directions for the shower and told how to get to the metro. The room was cleaned and towels changed every day - only thing was maids didnt lock the room after they had been in. It was noisy from about 7am due to the plumbing but I had taken earplugs as where I come from is the middle of nowhere with no noise 24/7. I was glad I took themthough. Didnt get hassled to book anything through them - I was there on my own and was out early each day for at least 12 hours so I didnt have that much contact with them. Only gripe - when I got there i was asked to give my credit card which they put $150 onto as a security deposit which I wasnt told about on booking - will be interested to see when I get that recredited

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this hotel”
Reviews.Author: km18766
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for anyone who wants to take a trip to New York and doesn't want to spend their entire budget on a hotel.... Likes: it is a great price, the decor is nice, very clean, safe neighborhood, across from Central Park Dislikes: far from everything else but there is a subway nearby, sketchy areas a few blocks away This is a great deal which is hard to find in NYC, it seems that the people who gave this place a bad review expect a lot of amenities, luxuries from their hotel, but with so much to do in New York, do you really spend that much time at the hotel??

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel Chain”
Reviews.Author: Sshores
Reviews.Content: This hotel chain is a ripoff. They overbook and then send you somewhere else (while this was happening to us, they sent other families elsewhere - which is ONE reason why it took so very long for them to sort it out).

Reviews.Title: “My first ever trip to nyc”
Reviews.Author: flipper_1dd
Reviews.Content: Well as everyone else ive read others reviews on this hotel so heres mine.. Me and a friend booked 3 night stay on a website where we travelled with air india (lovely) and had 3 nights in the astor, 25 to 27 to january, Got to tbe astor in a yellow cab outside of jfk ( although a random bloke came upo to us as we were coming out of arrivals offereing us a cab for $65 luckly for me I read somewhere average was around $50, got yellow cab outside, theres a $45 flat rate charge and then there toll and a couple of other things like surcharge if in between certain hours including bridge tolls our fare from the airport costed about $50.50 but as this driver was very helpful and friendly telling us about stuff on the way through our trip we gave him $60 Astor on first impression was good, before I even got out of the car, hammed took our luggage to the hotel, he was v friendly and helpful when needed as i read on here for a couple of months before i left i was a bit wary, but i didn't feel preasureised or anything with him he basically left us to it.. I found our room 801 lovely and peaceful, The jet lag got to me and my friend, so a chill on lovely double bed shower and a relaxx of watching cheeesey american tv was good. although not all channels worked and we had some spanish tv :S but it was cool. We went to look for the tube we went the wrong way (well we thought but 110 tube stations is to the left ( just don't go up any further or left as ill explain later) and 103 statiion is on the right of the hotel, although on the first night we missed this and ended up walking to 96th street, but the tube workers are really friendly and the man in 96th street even let us go through for nowt, for the tube u need to have a metrocard $7 for a day or $24 for a week, even if your there for a few days it worth getting one, watch out for the rats in some tubestations where a lot of rubbish is its a bit minging but its new york underground after all. in 801 amazingly in the night when its really quiet you can actually hear the subway trains not that it would keep you awake mind, and the buildings rattle due to all that metal underneath lol. I didnt personally have trouble with heaters or anything really the bed was lush, bathroom clean, and shower nice with hot water, my bed was made everyday although tucked underneath at the bottom ment i had to undo all the good work done by the cleaner people, my earrings or purfume iand mp3 player i forgot to put in my case was tidyied and my me to you pjs were left neatly on my bed, I was amazed by this lol as ive never seen my pjs so tidy hehe! The staff in general were fine, and friendly, not that we used them much but whenever we needed anything like to put our key away we were always delt with nicely, when it came to out last day we met mo another luggage person, he was keeping on at us to book a taxi with him, i said to him no, but he was trying to insist and trying to get my friend to tell me to get a cab with him, I said we had one already and got out of the hotel to do some last minute shopping. We did get the yellow cab drivers number when he took us to the astor as we thought it be a good idea as taxi's are busiest in the night from 12-3 but we didn't get round to ringing him (my mates phone worked in the usa, but she was worried about the cost ) All in all i thought the taxis were the most expensive thing about the trip and the tipping drove me nuts as i despise giving away extra money for a job that a person is already getting paid for (although my friend saw it differently as she gets tips when working so understood iit) my advice on taxis; is maybe get a number of the yellow cab your in if he seams ok, tube it all the way around if possible sometimes its about 10 mins to wait for a train but there all usually okay and the tube goes on 24 hours, now be careful with 123 tubes as you can end up the opposite side of town like my friend and I, also past 110 street and ending up in north ot central park (if u do its RIGHT from the top of the steps (central park is opposite dont cut through there esp at night) and when you see a gas garage DO NOT turn right, TURN LEFT as that is the way to astor you should also see 110 subway station and then a corner shop on 107 street and astor should be after. we were miles away (well it felt like it) at one point and had to get a tax. we tried to get a yellow cab to take us to jfk but couldn't because it was 3;30pm and rush hour in nyc so busy time for yellow cabs hamed offeeered to get us a cab, as with mo the other guy i was weary, and basically told hamed straight that ive been told that taxi drivers add extra on the fare when they get to the airport we told jhim we had $60 dollars for the return trup which was true and KI told him i basically didnt want to get ripped off by a taxi driver, hammed got us a taxi in the end for $55 dollars inc tolls which are $4.60 ish, and the man we had was friendly, and got lost in jfk which was like a maze lol we gave him $60 anyhow cause at least he got us there even though our plane got delayed... lol Empire State building was visited about $20 if wanted to visit 102 floor - $15 if 86 floor ok *night is awesome with hardly a queue Natural History Museum $28 for two Liberty island Ferry $11 if you want to got up the top apparently need to be there 8am :S and that an extra charge Times Sq = amazing Toys r us has a ferris wheel inside for all those big kids out there Centrury 21 awesome department store, opposite World trade centre just don't get lost in there like in Macys which is on 36th street past toys r us footlocker kifc etc in time square you eill see it eventually its hugeeee The world trade centre has a lot of piics, wat annoyed me is people are selling photos outside and making money out of it Irish bar in a sidestreet of times square was nice :-) The cold... GET ALL YOUR WARMEST CLOTHES... it can be totally freezeing penguin stylee weather.. umm anything else you need to know just ask, i will deffo go back again it basic and good for money and good for being a base for nyc all of you going have fun and don't worry too much go with the flow

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: shell10
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed at astor on the park for 4 nights, my first visit to new york for my 30th birthday. Having read good and bad reviews we like most were worried about what to expect on our arrival. On checking in staff were friendly and helped us upstairs with our bags, we had room 407 so had a park view room was small but very clean and bed so comfortable bathroom very modern and clean. We used the subway lots during our stay two nearby on 103rd and 110th and even used it late at night to get home and felt very safe this is a very cheap mode of transport as you will always have other things to spend your dollars on!!!! And taxis can be very expensive. We had an amazing time in nyc and astor on the park is just the ticket and such good value, yes the radiators are the worst i have ever heard in my life but didnt cause us any real loss of sleep. My only biggest complaint about the place is the car service they offer back to the airport, please DO NOT i reapeat DO NOT use these cars its such a rip off they tell you a price that includes everything then when you get to the airport the price has gone up $30!!!! We argued with the driver and it just put us in a bad mood so stay clear just get a yellow cab. I would recommed this place if you just want to visit new york to shop and see the sights its ideal, i would stay here again no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Great for exploring NYC”
Reviews.Author: gibsjam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in January while on a shopping trip with my girlfriend. Although being a little bit out from the main attractions, the hotel overall was fine. Rooms were clean, bed was great and there was lots of hot water so it suited me down to the ground. It costs around $12 to get a cab to Times Square and its a 10 minute journey. 5th Avenue is also a 10 min journey for about the same price. Its right across the street from Central Park which is very picturesque. Staff were friendly enough and overall its a great base to explore NY for a few days. No problems at all, would recommend. Also, check out Soho while your there. If you like trendy shops this is your place with the likes of Bathing Ape, adidas, Ben Sherman and others. If your there long enough try and check out a NY Knicks game too. Quality!

Reviews.Title: “A Pretty Good Hotel on the Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Thebic
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a double room here with two friends in January for the amazingly low price of $79/night. We basically just needed a place to crash and throw our stuff that was slightly more private than a hostel, and the Astor did the trick. Althought the beds are surprisingly big, the room itself can feel cramped as there is almost no floor space with 3 people's suitcases lying around. The bathroom was a very nice surprise, sparkling clean every day and larger than expected. The shower has plenty of hot water and housekeeping gives you those handy little bottles of shampoo/conditioner- nice ones too! There is free coffee/hot chocolate downstairs along with high speed internet- convenient but expensive at $1/ 5 minutes. The location is not especially scenic or exciting, but it was safe and only a few blocks from the subway. My biggest complaint is hands down, the loudest radiator in the entire universe. We didn't hear it at all the first two nights, but the third it was cold in the room and we got the handyman to turn on the heat. That night we awoke to this unbelievably annoying clanging of the pipes that didn't stop for 30 minutes. So obnoxious it was almost comical. When it happened the last night my friend fumbled around with it until he switch off the valve. The Astor is a perfectly fine place to stay if you find a sweet deal and don't mind commuting into the more interesting parts of town. Just make sure you know how to turn off that radiator!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all for the price!!!”
Reviews.Author: Enliven
Reviews.Content: We got to this hotel on 27 Dec 06 and were quite surprised with the size of the room we were given (901), had a double bed and a bunk bed!!! There was myself, hubby and daughter (8). A quite big room and bathroom was clean, with clean bed sheets. Noisy heating though the first night, the radiators were hissing and pipes banging like everyone says, but it was too hot in the room, so turned off the hissing, although banging still occured. On New Yrs Eve, it began to rain and when we woke up, the carpet was soaked!!! We told the reception, and as it was only on one side, we were willing to stay in that room as we only had one more night left. But the staff changed our room and this room was much nicer, bathroom was cleaner and bigger than our other one, room was smaller but seemed to have a better feel. Typical, only there for 1 night!! Nevermind, all in all, for the price we paid, cannot complain really, the hotel is in a good location, is very clean, fresh towels and sheets everyday, subway is easy to hand and lovely central park opposite. Downtown is not far at all. However, I also agree with everyone else, DO NOT GET RIPPED OFF BY HOTEL TAXIS!!! They are a rip off, we took it back to the airport, but yellow cabs are best, at least you know what you gonna pay.

Reviews.Title: “OK Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: these4walls
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights in this hotel in January room 313. The hotel is in a quiet location opposite Central Park. The metro is just a minutes walk down the road and provides quick access to the rest of Manhattan. The rooms were clean and the staff friendly. Now the not so good bits. The central heating was very noisy, it seemed to come on at about 4:30 in the morning and the pipes made a very loud banging noise, I am normally a deep sleeper and it woke me up every night. The room had an air conditioner, so if you stay in summer I don't think this would be a problem. Due to a very early flight back, we arranged for a taxi/car through reception at an agreed price including tolls. Once at the airport the driver tried to extort us out of a lot more than the agreed price. I am not sure how connected to the hotel the car company is but the air train/metro gets you to and from the airport in about the same time if you don't mind carrying your bags.

Reviews.Title: “Great base to explore NYC”
Reviews.Author: MichaelaCarlo
Reviews.Content: In summary, it was a fantastic ten days at a great little hotel…. Initially I was rather apprehensive as to the hotel’s quality as we generally only stay 5-star but as it was such a great deal we booked it regardless. And we were delighted with our find… The hotel is rather more basic than we are accustomed to, but is immaculately clean. We had booked a standard room but when we arrived, we asked for a room overlooking the park and were upgraded to a larger room (room 609). Space-wise it was fine – we had two large cases and had ample room for them. We had a super-king sized bed with a really firm mattress. Although it was the height of winter we had no need for the heating so did not encounter any noisy radiator problems people have mentioned in other reviews. The room had a wardrobe and enough shelf space for our things. The bathroom was a little on the small size but no worse than any central London hotel. The bath had lots of hot water at all times of the day and night. Twice we had minor problems with the shower and the staff sent a maintenance guy out to fix it within five minutes of our call. For me the plus was the cleanliness – it was spotless. At night the hotel was really quiet – the only downside is that being on the sixth floor, we couldn’t open the windows so had to use the AC instead. The last night was a bit chilly so we asked for an extra blanket which again arrived within a few minutes. The location of the hotel is great too. One piece of advice – don’t bother with taxis unless it’s late at night – at $15 - $20 per journey downtown we thought we’d just use the subway. If you’re there for a week, get the $24 weekly pass or if you’re there for less, a daily pass at $7 is good value or the $20 pass. We literally then travelled everywhere by subway – it took ten minutes to get wherever we wanted and at 110th street (the nearest subway station) there are several lines so you can get almost anywhere directly. The area is also absolutely fine – a few blocks further north and you’re on the outskirts of Harlem which leaves a lot to be desired but where the hotel is located is fine. Streets are clean and much more peaceful than downtown. It’s much more residential so gives you an insight into the real “New York” beyond the glitz of the touristy areas On the corner of 110th street and central park west (a two-minute walk from the hotel) is a lovely little supermarket where we bought water and fruit for the room. Opposite it is the Saurin Parke Café where we regularly ate breakfast (super fresh and good variety of food). If you carry on further up 100th street, is an AMAZING soul food restaurant (Miss Maude’s Spoonbread Too). I’d heard about this place before we left for NYC but had no idea it was only a five minute walk from the hotel – we are there twice (an enormous two course meal for two with drinks came to only $40). If you have a weary day and need to eat in the room, ask the hotel to order you Giovanni’s pizza – they kindly rang up for us and we had what the menu described as being a “small” pizza between us for only $14. When it arrived it was the size of a truck tyre and we could only manage half of it! The hotel has tea and coffee facilities downstairs and good internet access which was great for enabling us to check in online before we departed NYC. The hotel staff and exceptional and super efficient – whatever queries we had, they were really helpful. As for the lift, we had no problems – we found it worked best for us to walk down the six flights of stairs in the morning when a number of people were also leaving. Then when we came back to the hotel at night, the lift generally came immediately or was already waiting at the lobby. A major tip for you though – DON’T USE THEIR PRIVATE TAXI SERVICE! A complete rip-off – before we arrived in NYC, I rang the hotel and asked for a transfer to the hotel as we were due to arrive at midnight on Xmas day – Mohammed, the concierge was happy to help but told me it would cost $90 plus tolls ($10) plus tips (15%). He implied that we would have to use this as it would be the cheapest option on a public holiday. As we have friends from NYC, we took their advice to just get a yellow cab at the airport and were relieved we did as the entire journey only came to $55. On the way back to the airport, we left the hotel at 4am and so stupidly asked the hotel to book us their private taxi service – the receptionist assured me it was good value at only $55 flat rate including tips and tolls. All was well until we got into the taxi and when we were half way to the airport, the taxi driver told us the hotel was wrong – the rate would be $55 plus tolls plus tips, PLUS double fare for it being so early in the morning. As we had plenty of time, we insisted that he took us back to the hotel as we were not going to get ripped off. He took us back on the longest route perhaps hoping we’d miss our flight. Back at the hotel, we then flagged a yellow taxi in the street (surprisingly there were plenty so early in the morning) and it cost us only $45 flat rate and got us there with enough time. The key question, would I go back to the hotel? If we’re in New York for another week to ten days, then definitely. If it’s for a short trip, then maybe one of the swankier hotels downtown would be worth a try.

Reviews.Title: “A great base while staying in New York”
Reviews.Author: Saff-O
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Astor via the Opodo website where it came up as recommended by them. The price was extremely reasonable (£300 for 3 nights inc New Years Eve). I was concerned due to the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor but have to say I really really enjoyed my stay there and will definitely book to stay there again when returning to New York. Our room had a comfortable double bed with views of central park. The room was small compared to other destinations but not for New York. The bathroom was relatively new and everything in the room seemed in good condition. It was all kept very clean and the bedlinen smelled really fresh. 103st subway was a 2 min walk and there are plenty of grocery stores nearby. We did not experience any problems in the neighbourhood and there is a brand new condo complex nextdoor to the Astor with prices starting at £2.5M so it can't be that bad an area! Staff at the Astor were extremely helpful, contrary to some of the other reviews I have read, especially Mohammed who ensured our luggage was safe after check out until our evening flight so we could make the most of our last day, he also advised us on what time we should be leaving for the airport and ensured a private car was ready to take us. It's true you could book excursions through him, but why get so offended at him asking if you were interested like some reviewers seem to have?? We said no thanks and he remained equally friendly and helpful for the remainder of our stay. All in all, it's a cute little hotel at a great price, not central location but hassle free travel to midtown. I've stayed at much worse bigger hotels in NY at higher room rates. Don't go there expecting 5 star facilities but I don't know why you would want to spend that long at your hotel when there's so much to do! I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: Nick_LHR
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here in November. The staff were very accomodating when we booked in after our late arriving flight and were generally very helpful and accomodating. The hotel was nice and very clean. The hotel is not in the centre of where all the action is going on in NY but we actually preffered this as we got to see a bit of the less touristy side of NY. In any case, it is close to both 103rd and 110th Street Stations where you can pick up the 1 train however we generally walked through the Park down towards 96th Street where you can pick up an express train into Mid-Town. The hotel is opposite central park which is also a bonus and we had an oblique park view also taking in the Empire State which was realy good. Bad points were that the lift is slow, although this was more quirky and amusing than irritating, our hot water cut out at one point but the staff quickly fixed it and I was once accosted by a very mild beggar outside the hotel but he went away when asked politely so hardly a major issue. The staff also tried to plug taxis quite a bit which was annoying seeing as the subway is very close and can take you pretty much anywhere on Manhattan. The room was not huge, but comparable, if not bigger, than many European hotels of the same standard. Overall we were very pleased with the accomodation. Although it is not the best hotel I have ever stayed in it was extremely good for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: dannydillenger
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my time at the astor on the park hotel recently. I am aware reviews can be personalised and may not reflect a very universal opinion, and experiences can be different for whatever reason. There a a few aspects about this hotel though that i can assure will be to everyone's satisfaction (unless you are a handful of these strange regular hotel-goers who expect the earth). Firstly the staff are great. Very friendly, helpful and courteous. I arranged a few things with the hotel including the classic new york sightseeing tour and transportation back to JFK airport. Secondly, the place is very presentable. Rooms are cleaned once a day from what i could make out and the whole place looks quite modern and well kept, certainly nice enough for me. This could be a matter of debate, but i thought the location was rather good. Upper west-side offers a trendy, quiet and tidy alternative to the beating heart of new york (midtown). The subway at 103th st, numerous cabs and buses means transport was EASY to anywhere. Our room over-looked central park (which was a bit of a bonus) and there was very little traffic at night. Buses were about the only thing that could wake you up (apart from the radiator which i will move on to in a bit). After reading some reviews before my trip i will attempt to challenge/expel some of the negative comments i read. Firstly, the lift is not that slow (and even if it is, who cares its a lift!). The location according to some people is way too far away from the action, in response to that i will say you are experiencing more of new york by staying in a residential area, and as pointed out earlier it is accessable and easy to get around. Granted the hotel is close to harlem, but where harlem ends upper west-side begins. Also, a lot of NYC including harlem has cleaned up its act, though saying that it is still prudent and general common sense to know where your going at night. Staying at the Astor every night felt completely safe. The radiator in our room did make a noise one night and it is loud. i woke up disorientated thinking it might be construction workers outside the noise was that unusual, but like i said it was once and didnt last long. There is an odd way of working the shower, but once i mastered that i had a hot shower every morning. Reception does actually tell you how to work the shower when you check-in, as well as a diagram on the front desk (so dont be stupid like me and just pull down on the bottom of the bath tap)! Room temperature was fine, no problems there. No safety deposit box, but then again no apparent risk of personal items being stolen as long as they are kept away. Even though you do have to check-out at 12 and you have a much later flight, the staff will gladly keep hold of your bags till then and organise hassle-free transport back to JFK, which was $50. Flat rate in a cab to the airport is $5 less but i believe you have to pay the toll fee (whatever that is)? There you go, thats my evaluation...enjoy your stay like we did if you go.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel for the price paid”
Reviews.Author: chunkymonkey158
Reviews.Content: There seemed to be a lot of negative reviews of this hotel so I dreaded what we would find when we arrived for our holiday in New York. However, we were pleasantly surprised. This may not be the best hotel in the world but for what you pay, I think you get a reasonably good deal. The hotel is situated on the West side of Central Park in upper Manhattan, in an area that is a little insalubrious at night. However, we had no problems and even coming home late at night, everything was very quiet and we never felt afraid. The hotel, has the normal features - a lobby, reception, a bellboy/man, a basement area where you can access the internet, get complimentary tea and coffee from a machine and go to the toilet. Our room was satisfactory. It was clean, provided a tv with many channels, a cupboard for storing clothes, one bedside table, an ensuite bathroom which was clean and all the utilities worked well. The few negative comments that I can make about this hotel are as followsl; The room got quite cold as we were there in November and we had to request an extra blanket as they only provided several sheets for the bed. Our cupboard door came off the hinge and we had to request someone to come and fix it. There is only one lift in the whole hotel and although the hotel is not huge, the one lift can take a long time if there are a lot of guests using it. The views from our room were not very spectacular. We just had a view of grey rooftops which wasn't very inspiring to wake up to on a grey November morning. The hotel staff were not always as helpful as they could be. We found New Yorkers to be the friendliest, most helpful people, but the hotel staff (many of whom were not from the USA) were often quite rude or unhelpful. That's about it. I would definitely recommend this hotel. Its not the Ritz but you get what you pay for and I think this hotel has a very reasonable rate for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Dis-astor on the park”
Reviews.Author: PAUL DUNS
Reviews.Content: Firstly the good points about the hotel...the room was clean and the bed was very comfortable...also even though the hotel was at the upper end of central park a 5 minute walk and you could access the subway @ 103rd street..However our toilet clogged up once...but the worst thing about this hotel was the noise from the radiators...and i mean noise a constant clanging and banging all night long..i have never ever experienced any thing like this in any hotel i have stayed in the world over...for 2 of the 5 nights we stayed we did not sleep...it was if a brass band had decided to pitch up and play in your room...we complained and the staff informed us that this was ther norm as the "building was old". I cannot stress the noise level of the radiator system.....needless to say i will not be staying here again and would not recommend this hotel to anyone...this hotel in my opinion should be renamed the Dis-astor on the park...

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ER+GC
Reviews.Content: Having read countless reviews about this and other New York hotels we were slightly worried. However there was no need. The hotel was fine. The room (406)had a view of Central Park,was a decent size,had a kingsize bed,was clean,good bathroom with endless hot water. Maid changed towels and made room daily. Subway was 5 mins walk away (turn right out of hotel and walk to 103st). Travel time to midtown 10 mins. An ideal base away from the hustle and bustle but close enough not to be an issue. Would go back again. Dont be over critical the room is just your base, if budget is not an issue try Trump Towers !!!.........mind you i suppose some would even critcize that.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect......”
Reviews.Author: Shinnygirl
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5-day stay in Astor on the Park. I had booked the hotel before reading the reviews on here and when I did, I actually thought about cancelling. Thankfully I didn't. I could not fault this hotel, nor could my three friends. It was ideal in everyway. Four girls on a shopping Trip to New York, we stayed in a two double bed room (room 601) - Yes it was small, but that was the only issue with the room and besides, we only planned to sleep there!! The room had two double beds, which were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was perfect; shower/bath/toilet/washbasin/hairdryer, fresh towels everyday and little shampoo/body wash bottles. An Iron is available on request and they left it with us for the duration of our stay. We got a room at the back of the hotel, so it was really quiet. We had four great nights sleep after our busy days shopping. The staff were very friendly. Any request we had was always answered in a helpful way. The only gripe I do have is that we were encouraged to get Taxi’s after asking if the Subway would get us to certain places. Turns out in some cases we didn’t need the Taxi and could have hopped on the Subway, we were a little annoyed at this. So, maybe try to figure this out yourself ! This might be the only downside of the hotel, it is a little far away from everything, but if you don’t mind walking or getting the Sub, then you’ll be fine here. By the way, the Sub is on 110th street (about 3 streets away, a 3 minute walk) We generally tended to walk wherever we were going and get the Sub or Taxi back (lots of shopping bags) Down in the basement the hotel has a sit down area with tea/coffee making facilities, a vending machine with drinks and sweets. It also has two computers with high-speed access to the internet (which came in very handy when we had to order stuff online which the hotel staff signed for on our behalf while we were out). The cost is $1 for 5 minutes. There is also a printer available. An ATM machine is right next to the computers. There is also a toilet in the basement. If you want ICE, then this is were you also go to get it. You'll have to ask for it as it's in the door marked "employees" we had to open the door and ask for it though as they couldn't hear us while they were doing laundry. Lastly, Central park is right on your doorstep. If you walk up to 110th street then over to the east side of Central Park you’ll happen upon the bigger of the two ice rinks! And yes the dreaded lift was slow, but you know, walk up the stairs if you have no bags and you are capable !! Check out my photo’s too.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay in New York!”
Reviews.Author: Liz_renn
Reviews.Content: After hours looking for a reasonably priced hotel, came across the Astor. After booking it, noticed many of the negative reviews and got worried! It was a girly trip - me and my mum so basically a lot of shopping was on the agenda! I think the location was great - a few mins from 2 subway stations and a 10 second walk to central park! If I stayed right in downtown, I dont think I would have done so much. We ended up staying out all day and into the late evenings - why go all the way to New York to spend it in a hotel? The hotel was basic, but perfect for what we needed - a huge bathroom, two twin beds which were really comfy, and tea and coffee downstairs with internet. Dont get worried about negative comments. You have come to enjoy the most amazing city in the world, not to spend all your time in a hotel you can get anywhere!!

Reviews.Title: “We had a Great Time and we are Eager to be back!”
Reviews.Author: Krika
Reviews.Content: Facing Central Park, just great!- tick Close to B&C subway stations - tick Helpful and kind staff, especially Alain Amid, who gave useful hints for my debut in NY - tick Clean bed, towels and bathroom - tick Great shower - tick The rest is up to your flip-flop and the streets of New York ! Ah! Don't miss Giovanni's Pizza. Simple place, warm people and great pizza, of course!!!!! It is located few blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value; would go again”
Reviews.Author: Readeo
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very small but neat and clean; bathroom was almost as big as the room with a tub. It was off the beaten track but we'd stay there again. It was quiet and convenient to subway and only about 15 to 20 minutes from Times Square and rest of the hub-bub. Cab was $12 to Times Square. If you don't mind walking a few blocks, breakfast was excellent where the staff suggested. Staff helpful. Not fancy, but you get what you pay for. This is a moderate hotel so if you're looking for fancy, this aint the place. If you're looking for a clean room, and are on a budget or just don't want to spend money on a hotel room, this is an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price, but far from perfect”
Reviews.Author: Igu
Reviews.Content: Spent few nights here on Sep 2006 with my wife. Hotel is very basic with only minimal services (no restaurant, minibar or wi-fi). Room was very small but clean without much storage space. Air-conditioning unit was very loud and we had to turn it off for the night. The toilet got also clogged once, but was fixed quite quickly. Staff was friendly and gave good advice on local restaurants etc. The location of the hotel is a bit far away from the "tourist area" of NYC but also quite quiet and peaceful with the Central Park right opposite the entrance. Nearest subway station is about 5 mins walk from the hotel. OK for few nights, but wouldn't recommend for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel in a friendly neibourhood”
Reviews.Author: dottyd2006
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel in late September this year to get married at the hotel, and found it to be alot better than most of the reviews on here. First of all, the location was not as bad as i had expected, the subway was only 3 blocks away and it took you into the city or if you wanted to explore nearly all the way to the bottom of manhatten. We found this mode of transport to be very cheap and quick. The hotel rooms are smallish, but there is room to move around and we found the bathroom quite a decent size and very clean. There is only one elevator but this did not seem to be an issue when we stayed, a couple of times we were waiting for it when it turned up with staff and all the cleaning products in. But they always moved all of their things out and let us use it first. The staff are friendly and helpful, one of the doormen organised us a car to get to our location for the wedding and he did us an incredible deal (only $20)! On the first night we got there too tired to go out and the reception had no problem in ordering us some take out, they provided the menus and even telephoned it through for us. All in all we had a wonderful time in New York and as we stayed for a week the price of the hotel was just what we needed. If we visited again for a long period of time i would stay here again. But if it was just a short break i would probably pick a higher star hotel just for a bit more luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: MrMidge
Reviews.Content: Good little hotel, clean, comfortable, friendly and just enough in the rooms for a short stay, ie tv internet access. Bit noisy due to air con systems throughout the hotel. but hey its New York who cares.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: katykate
Reviews.Content: The taxi driver had a look of pity on his face when i said i wanted to go here. Arrived early in the evening to find receptionist arguing with a guest about a fax he didn't receive. Not a good first impression! Checked in fine and was told had a complementary upgrade to a Queen X room, thought things were looking up, got up to my room (which took forever, slowest lift in the world) was freezing cold and had a disgusting smell! I had to sleep with a t-shirt over my nose it was that bad. Jumped on my bed only to find it had been made of bricks! Very very uncomfortable. Carpets were foul, paint coming off walls, there was a leak on the landing by the lift where bits of plaster were coming off, told the receptionist she didn't seem at all surprised or bothered. The drinks vending machine stole my money but nobody cared. I will say though, that the bathroom, as tiny as it was, was always very clean and the porters/doormen were helpful and nice. God knows what original room would have been like? I paid £111 a night for this room and felt competely ripped off! I also would't say it was conveniently located, taxi or subway ride to anywhere really.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely for Low Budget Travellers”
Reviews.Author: denzil16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in in Aug 06 - originally planned and paid for 4 nights, but changed hotels after 2 to a 4*. The rooms are small, although bed and bathroom were clean, but the carpets desperately needed a good clean/updating. TV reception was extremely poor. The hotel staff were very helpful, and we booked a helicopter trip with them, plus bus tour with no problems at all. In terms of the area itself, there is nothing around it, except for apt blocks and other bargain hotels. Had to walk 3 blocks to find somewhere reasonable to eat. The subway was close by, which we needed to take in order to get to central Manhattan, as this is a long way out. I believed this hotel was 3* although far closer to 2*.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bill111
Reviews.Content: I recently was visiting new york and decided to stay here, (HORRIBLE CHOICE) anyways as soon as i got there it smelled like a barbershop, the room was really small, and smelled of cigarette smoke. Also i found a COCKROACH on the nightable. I showed the people at the front desk, and demanded a refund, i checked out that night and stayed at different hotel. This hotel also wanted to keep $199 for the first night, and i was only at the hotel for literally 40 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Good but basic.”
Reviews.Author: acsis
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in August with my wife and daughter. I was a little apprehensive when I first arrived, initial impression was not that favourable. I have to say that the Staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The room was very basic and quite small. The Aircon was a little noisy but given the weather I can get over that. The TV reception was appalling, it looked like it was on a signal splitter that wasn't working. Given the UK airport security situations and my wife's inherent fear of flying, not being able to pick up all the news was not such a problem and anyway, who needs TV in New York! Position was a little out from where we wanted to be but budget constraints limited flexibility anyway. The subway service into and out of downtown was fine. Taxis wern't too bad either. only marginally more expensive than getting the subway for all three of us to/from Columbus. Overall, i would say that the Hotel was good, staff were great, but don't expect too much. Oh and the complimentary coffee was always empty whenever I wanted/needed some!

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money”
Reviews.Author: -Citygirl-101
Reviews.Content: I took my two teenage daughters in for the night. Room very clean and spacious. Staff super friendly and helpful. Area is not the safest at night but ok during the day. Evevator a bit slow. Nice extras such as herbal teas, hot chocolate etc in lounge. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, but wouldn't stay again!”
Reviews.Author: garfieldhouse
Reviews.Content: This hotel was OK, but not brilliant! I stayed in a room above a central quad looking onto other rooms and the rooms were basic but cheap. This I didn't mind as you don't go to New York to see the inside of a hotel room. Facilities were basic but the hotel was clean and the stay was quite present. However, the main negatives were the fact that the plugs in the bathroom sink and bath didn't work and the very noisy air conditioning unit from the basement rooms made a racket all night and it was difficult to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get scared away!”
Reviews.Author: powerrose
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my family and I last week. I live in New York so I knew the area and was fairly sure it was a good deal. Then I read some negative reviews here and freaked out. Here is the truth: The room was nice, clean, roomy, and quiet. Sure, compared to a Howard Johnson in the suburbs, its TINY, but if you know anything about New York, you'll know that the room was actually roomy. Actually, the bathroom was bigger than my New York bedroom. The AC worked well, was no dirty or noisy. We were right next to the elevator and never heard a single sound from the hall or the neighbors. The area is great...Central Park West is pretty much the most upscale part of New York. The staff were also really nice. They gave great directions and came together and went completely beyond the call of duty when our suitcase broke. They probably would have reconstructed the suitcase for hours if we had let them. In conclusion, this is a fantastic hotel in a great location....the price is a STEAL. Don't believe the negative reviews and feel confident in staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TonyPR
Reviews.Content: I'm very surprised by some of the negative reviews. I stayed at this hotel for eight nights in June, and thought it was great for the most part. Some of the negative comments, it seems to me, may be coming from people who have never stayed in hotels in New York--nearly all hotels in New York are small (and, honestly, I didn't think my room was particularly small). The most important thing for me in a hotel is cleanliness--and this hotel was certainly clean. The bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was excellent (again, compared to other hotels in New York where I have stayed) The A/C was a window unit, and yes it was a little noisy (as those units tend to be), but I was actually appreciative because it helped block out some of the street noise on Central Park West (another common problem in New York). This is a three-star property, and as such one shouldn't be surprised not to find particular services (e.g., room service, traveller's check cashing, etc.)--indeed, many if not most three-star properties don't offer these types of services! But hey, this is New York City--it's not all that hard to find something to eat 24/7. For me, the location was a bit of a problem, but I can see how it would be wonderful for some people. It is right on the upper west corner of Central Park--and the park is definitely lovely for a morning walk, or for people watching during the day. For me, most of the things I wanted to do were in the West Village or Midtown. Subways are great during the day, but you may have to wait a bit when they switch to late night service at 11:00 p.m. (which means that if you are at the theatre it may take a little longer to get back). I knew this going in, but couldn't pass up the amazing rate that I found online ($87/night for a hotel in Manhattan!). As a frequent traveller to New York, though, it was a pleasant surprise to find out some things about a part of town that I had never visited (do walk by the Dakota on CPW and 72nd Street where Rosemary spawned her devil baby, and where John Lennon was shot). Another possible negative is that the elevator can be a little slow in the mornings--especially when the housekeepers start using it. Again, having stayed at properties in New York with no elevator, I just rolled with it. All in all, this was a great experience, and I was a little nervous given the rate (and some of the bad reviews that I had read here). I also wanted to say that I was actually in New York for a week before for a seminar where my accomodations were provided. Because of this, I had made several reservations, and then visited all of the properties to see what I wanted to do. Astor was, by far, the least expensive (I also had reservations at the Hotel Pennsylvania, the Ramada New Yorker, and a real dive--the Chelsea Star--all of which were twice the price as Astor) and by far the nicest of the lot. Would I stay there again--yes.

Reviews.Title: “What you see is what you get”
Reviews.Author: YorkshireCouple22
Reviews.Content: The Astor on the Park was a basic hotel with minimal facilities (i.e. TV, Cd Player, fresh towels daily, pay per minute internet) Out of all the receptionists we met during our 4 day stay, not one had a kind word or even a hint of a smile. They were rather unhelpful when we asked about money exchange and directed us incorrectly down the wrong street. The concierge was friendly but we soon realised he worked on commission based sales of trips so we ended up stalking, navy seal style through reception on a morning to avoid him. Taxis to the hotel were a fortune so we ended up staying in at night with a bed picnic of beer and Reese's Cupakes. The bed was comfy but I think there may have been some health and safety issues regarding the heating. The on/off dial was ancient and red hot. I burnt myself trying to switch it off as the room reached sweathouse heat. Ok for budget travellers with no expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you are obese or clostrophobic, you do not want to stay here.....but we found this to be a fine little hotel for our visit. Everything about this hotel is tiny: lobby, elevator, stairway, hallway, rooms.....but it is clean, the staff was friendly and helpful, and the bed was comfortable. The only problem we had was that the window air conditioning unit did not cool as well as we would have liked, but we were so tired from our wanderings in the city that we slept great anyway. Please note that this hotel is not near ANY famous attractions.....but it is a mere 3 blocks from a subway stop that can take you anywhere!! And there are many restaurants within a 6 block walk. We found this hotel to be charming and quite suitable to our needs (sleeping, bathing) while in New York City. It is reasonably priced, and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Faso82
Reviews.Content: We've been here for 4 nights (16-20 May); and we've had a really great time... Room (803) was quite large for 2 people, and we also had 2 single beds with the same price of a double room (584 euro). Toilet was clean and towels were always fresh! The room was deadly quiet, and all the staff was very friendly, and has always gave us a hand!!! There are 2 subway station nearby, but no good restaurants... Anyway, i would stay there for my next trip in NYC!!! A great little hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “OK for the single/ budget traveler”
Reviews.Author: screamingmimis
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed 2 nights at Astor over Memorial Day weekend for about $200/night. At the time, the average going rate for a decent hotel in Manhattan was at least $250, so we decided to save some money and chance it. What I can tell you is you get what you pay for. We booked the stay online and got confirmation of a room with 2 double beds. When we arrived, we were forced in to a room with just 1 double bed, as the receptionist said they were overbooked. So we decided to camp up in the unacceptably small room on the 7th floor (for 3 people) while we worked on getting the room we were actually confirmed for (ended up being Room 702). The doorman was very nice in bringing our luggage up to the room and ended up helping us get the room we needed with 2 double beds. The pictures on the hotel's website display a simple modernity within very small rooms, which is an accurate portrayal of what the rooms were really like. They were clean and livable, and the bathroom exceeded my expectations (e.g. no hair, no rust). Towels were freshly laundered. There was even a tv, which I didn't see from the website photos, although the reception wasn't great. Bring a few cds with you, as the cd player was a nice touch for a budget hotel such as this. What the hotel didn't have that would have been nice (I suppose they could be considered luxuries) is a concierge service and water. I needed the phone number to a Tribeca restaurant and didn't want to spend the money to use the internet in the basement downstairs, so I called the front desk and never got a call back. We were also very thirsty in the middle of the night, but there was no water in the hotel (the vending machines only have juice and soda). But there is a very cute mom+pop convenience shop down the street at 107th that makes great sandwiches and has all the goods you'd need for a snack. Also, the elevator is very small, which means it may take a while for it to arrive on your floor, and exepct crowding with people and their luggage on your trips up and down. I read on other reviews here that several people also experienced the overbooking dilemma that I did, so be prepared for the worst. We checked in at 5:30pm, went up to the room to freshen up and then came back down to the lobby at 7pm, and the lobby was jampacked with travelers just arriving and waiting for their room assignments. Location also wasn't great if you want to head in to the main part of the city and the Lower East Side and such - a cab ride could cost upwards of $20 and it seemed like many drivers were reluctant to drive so far north on Central Park West. We hailed cabs in the evening for our dressy nights out when we didn't want to take the subway, but during the day the subway was closeby (just 2 blockst away) and convenient, although the weekend schedule was limited and it took 30 minutes to get down to Soho and beyond (which seemed long when you were trying to squeeze in a lot of activities before catching the early evening bus back to DC). In short, I've stayed in much posher hotels than this with far better service, so Astor on the Park pales in comparison, but for the money, it wasn't a bad value. I would stay here again only if I was traveling solo and didn't need help with any travel plans in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the feint hearted”
Reviews.Author: SeaSider23
Reviews.Content: Astor on the Park, New York We have just spent 5 days at this hotel and although the price should have given the game away other reviews we read before going seemed OK. Our experience of the doorman, was helpful in trying to get you on trips - but getting specific information about going places the maps we already had were more informative. The room was clean but needed some tlc, eg the hanging space/shelf unit had a wedge placed to keep it balanced. For information the room we were in was 713. The last two nights of our visit were blighted by four youngsters in the next room to us calling out loudly and using inappropriate language. Yes we did complain to the hotel on the second night and were told that we couldn't move room to get a good night's sleep prior to our journey home. The morning of our departure we met the manager Robert by chance and he expressed surprise that we weren't allowed to move room, something he said he would be looking into. He offered us a room to shower in later that day as recompense. We would not recommend this hotel to anyone as it could possibly spoil their enjoyment of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view...needs to sort out the finer points...”
Reviews.Author: Hard_Woman
Reviews.Content: We too had an issue with booking in. We had booked a twin room but were told on arrival that there had been a mistake and they did not have one available. They offered us a queen bedroom or the possibility of going to another (unseen) hotel. At no point did the receptionist apologise for their mistake and gave the impression that she was rather annoyed with us about the whole thing. After standing our ground for some time they eventually 'found' a room for us on the 7th floor with a double bed and bunkbeds. This room was quite big and was cleen, but the carpet was wet on one side of the room. The internet access in the basement is useful and quick but a bit expensive at $1 for 4 minutes. The location is great - easy for travel and brilliant if you want to spend time in Central Park. For a budget hotel this is acceptable but not brilliant.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in New York City!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: During our first trip to New York City we stayed at the Astor on the Park Hotel. The hotel was nicely located on the Upper West Side with Central Park right opposite and it was easily accessible to the Sub Way, which we found was a great way of travelling around the city! We found the hotel to be reasonable for the price we paid and was nice and clean. Our room on the 4th floor was of average size with a comfortable double bed, air conditioning, sky tv, wardrobe and a lovely en-suite bathroom. The negative points were the fact that the room could've done with a lick of fresh paint, and the view we had was of a brick wall opposite!!!
