Whilst staying in the hotel we did have a few hours of no hot water and no electricity, but needless to say it was all sorted straight away! The only facilities the hotel actually provides is tea/coffee & vending machines and also internet access. We found all the staff at Astor on the Park to be very accommodating and friendly, especially the doorman, Mohammed who gave us great tips and advice!!!! Overall i would say that the hotel was quite basic but was good for a base to sleep and change, which is all you need when you stay in New York City!!! We would definately stay at the Astor on the Park Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water Hole in The Wall”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found the Astor to be a very small, small hotel, eruo style furniture, carpet can do for an upgrade unless you keep your shoes on the entire time before getting into bed. Nice front desk staff, very helpful. Subsequently they had no hot water. If I pay two-hundred a night or two-thousand a night or even two dollars a night.. I expect to have hot water.. No explanation from the Astor. They are working on it.. ok while they work on the boiler .. than the Astor needs to work on this bill... The front desk has no access to the computers to make bill adjustments, etc.. Not a place for children, , Expect to pay for internet access if you bring your laptop.. The location was ok if you view the hotel from outside ..Overall. I will never advise or recommend such an horrific place to anyone.. Not even a doggie motel.. Learn from these reveiews..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Suprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews,we were as others have said a little concerned.But these worries were soon forgotten! The Hotel was ideal for what we required,granted the room was on the small side,but you had your own bathroom and shower and because you are out sight seeing all day,a bed was all you needed. The subway was only a short distance away aa was all the shops/delis and resturants you needed for breakest or dinner. The Hotel staff were all very friendly and helpful.All in all a memorable first time in New York!

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: tarka00
Reviews.Content: Despite reading all the negative reviews, I and 2 friends stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Contrary to previous reveiws, all the staff were pleasant and helpful. The concierges were especially good - recommending local restaurants and trips. Rooms are small, as in most New York hotels, and we were given keys to two rooms to choose which was best. After two nights the manager gave us a larger room which had become available. Rooms and bathrooms very clean and there was no traffic noise from outside. No problems with noisy pipes either. Hotel is ideally located for Central Park - directly opposite. It is about five minutes walk from subway and then about six stops downtown. If you're staying at this hotel, there are some great little cafes, bars and restaurants within 5-10 minutes walk so you don't have to go downtown to eat. If you want a good, value-for-money hotel in NY there's no problems with Astor On The Park.

Reviews.Title: “Really Really Bad...”
Reviews.Author: QnChunkie
Reviews.Content: I had a truly terrible experience at this hotel, and I am not very picky. Beyond the teeny tiny rooms and the pipe in the bathroom that was so hot that it literally burnt my skin, the radiator was making horrible noises during the early morning hours and when I asked the front desk to do something about it they told me that later that day their "engineer" was going to have a look at it. I told them that they could have whomever they wanted check it out, but that I didn't want to have to be awoken to it again. When I called the front desk again that evening to make sure that it had been taken care of they assured me that it had and sure enough the very next morning at 4:30 it started clanking SO loud that it woke me up, again. After calling the front desk to report what was going on and telling them that I wasn't buying the "engineer" story a second time, a guy came up with a bucket, and emptied the radiator of the water that was within. To top off the entire experience, when I was packing my bag to leave I saw a huge roach crawl out from under the bed. It really is that horrible and anywhere else is worth the little bit more you are going to have to spend.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I paid $81/night and got a double bed room on 3/10 and 3/11/06. When i arrived to check in, they only had me down for one night but thankfully i had a print out of my expedia confirmation. The staff called expedia and quickly resolved the issue with no problem. The room was cheap for such a great, quiet location; there's a bus stop right in front of the hotel and there's a metro stop on 103rd st and 110th (the hotel is between 106th & 107th). The staff was friendly and was more than happy to assist with any request. The rooms were tiny (i would NOT recommend this room for anyone expecting to spend a lot of time in their hotel room) and there was no closet, safe or comforters on the beds - but you're in new york city so why would you want to spend a lot of time cooped up in a hotel room? We used the room for sleeping and showering only. The room was neat and the beds & bathroom were clean. The staff was very helpful in arranging transportation to the airport during checkout; i took a limo to la guardia for $45 and my friend took a bus to the airport in New Jersey for only $20. This room is perfect for those on a budget looking to spend their money on shopping and dining. Save your money for the cabs and stay at this hotel room! I would definitely stay there again - just make sure you bring a copy of your confirmation receipt! Enjoy, and have fun in NYC! =)

Reviews.Title: “Prepare to get up 6am every morning!!! Noise problems”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: 2 Main Problems!! I stayed there for 3 nights this early March. Firstly, the day time receptionist lady is extremely unprofessional, unfriendly and unapproachable. Secondly, there are some pipes problems which is noisy enough to wake me up at 6am in the morning. I stayed in Room 210, then when I requested a room change, the receptionist REFUSED to change the room for me and stated that due to the hotel building is very old, every room would have the same problems. So, clearly she already knew about the problem but despite there are other live-able rooms available, she chose to give me that room. It is until she was off and I spoke to the night time staff that they are able to change my room, to Room 1004, which turned out to be a perfectly fine room without any pipes problems. Somehow, the day time staff are nightmares but the night time ones are completely the opposite. I'd say that given the price I paid, it is quite a bargain. I would recommend this hotel if you prepare minimise your interaction with hotel staff as little as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as suggested”
Reviews.Author: PunjabiNo1
Reviews.Content: I was staying at the Astor last week for my first trip to New York and must admit, i was a bit worried by all the negative reviews that have been posted. On the first night, it seemed like they were all coming true! The whistling radiators, nowhere nearby to eat! But then after a good night's sleep (the beds are clean and comfortable) and a shower (the showers are really nice here!) i felt much better and then set about exploring NYC. And it's then you realise that the Astor is an ok place to stay. Once you learn how to use the subway and explore the city, the Astor becomes a really nice base. There are two decent cafes two streets behind the hotel, there is a grocery store nearby and of course, the hotel is right opposite the park, which is lovely in the mornings! But most of my trip, i found i was in central New York rather than in Central Park West (the location of the hotel) as it is a residential area and all the sights and the main attractions are further downtown - so much so, you'll hardly want to stay in the hotel area! You do get used to the noise and the rooms are clean, and towels good. I would say if you are expecting a hotel with breakfast, and extras to hand, the Astor is not for you. However, if you already know New York well and just want to enjoy the city and just need a simple base to rest, or you are prepared to find your own way and need a good starting point, the Astor is fine! One tip - if you do use the subway to get to the hotel, go to 103rd street and catch the 'C' train which is local and nearer the hotel rather than 'A' which is express and will land you up on 126th (which is what happened to us and we had to walk all those blocks back up!)

Reviews.Title: “whistling radiators!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the astor for 4 nights in october because there was literally nowhere else with rooms in the whole city. there was absolutely no amenities within the hotel, and the room we had was very small but i found it clean enough. one problem was that you cannot control the central heating which is constantly on all night. every half an hour or so, the radiator goes a bit mental and starts whistling and hissing, loud enough to wake you up! because of this we tried to open the window in the room and the hall outside...which promptly fell out! needless to say i didnt let them know about this, but even after 2 days, they hadnt noticed and the window was just left lying on the corridor floor! the hotel is pretty poor, and is a it in the arse end of nowhere, but we didnt want to do the touristy things anyway, and set about touring the bars and restaurants of the upper west side and harlem which we found really cool and full of locals rather than tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for money if less noise!”
Reviews.Author: Linda33glasgow
Reviews.Content: We payed a reasonable amount for a week's stay.But no amount could make up for the continuing banging through the night.As we went in February which is cold the heating was on which makes a noise like someone in the toliet hitting the pipes with a hammer.After four nights of none sleep we had to ask for a change of room,which they did with no complaints.After this our holiday began.There is clean towels every day the rooms are reasonably clean.BEDS ARE CLEAN.The subway is near,the staff are helpful,coffee and tea downstairs is free,you can ask for a heater if you are cold,there is plenty hot running water.I myself have read some of the other reviews and notice people saying there is no near shops but if some people are willing to explore two blocks behind the hotel has loads of shops that my husband and I walked to most nights for something to eat.So if you don't mind being a little out of the buzz and for the money and right room the hotel is worth the money. My friend got a hotel in time square and couldn't sleep for sirens and noise so there's a thought!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Emmie-Scot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during the heavy snowfall in February, the heating didn't work properly, and when it did, it banged all night, other guests were getting annoyed at the noise and started banging on their floors at 2am. The hotel staff did try to fix the heating, it came on for a few hours each night but not really enough given the sub zero temp outside. We didn't sleep much due to the noise of other guests and the noise from the heating. The hotel was clean and tidy and our beds were made every day, the room was very basic but for the price you cannot expect more. Staff were friendly and helpful and kept our bags at the hotel on our last day as our flight wasn't until the evening. Beware using their car service to the airports if you get travel sickness, the person who took us to JFK was a manic driver and I was ill by the end of the journey. Nearest underground station is a couple of blocks away and we didn't have any trouble using it. This hotel is suitable for people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “The Astor is bad, even at a discounted price.”
Reviews.Author: hollyg2
Reviews.Content: We've been to New York many times, so don't feel the need to stay in the middle of everything. If you've never been to NYC you really should choose a hotel closer to the action. Spend the extra cash and enjoy your hotel. This one leaves a LOT to be desired, so is hardly worth the inconvenience of the location. We booked the Astor after reading about it here. We requested a room overlooking the park as suggested. Our first night they didn't have one, and they moved us the next day. We should have stayed on the inside. The heat was broken in the room - we had to keep the windows open and the noise outside was unbelievable - not just traffic, but people yelling outside all night. Noise INSIDE the hotel was just as bad. The radiators banged and there was a drilling noise for a lot of one evening. If you're a light sleeper, don't expect much peace here. The walls are paper thin to the hallways and the adjoining rooms. And since it's a discount hotel, expect a lot of younger hotel guests. We could not get ahold of anyone at the front desk - ever. We couldn't get a wake up call, or someone to explain to us how to set our in-room alarm clock. We couldn't get them to deal with the noises. We couldn't get them to fix the radiator. We couldn't get them to fix the television. (We were exhausted one night and just wanted a night in, but no dice - the tv didn't work and the room was a noisy sauna) We couldn't get anyone on the phone for anything. The staff mill about like they are college students in between classes. They gossip amongst each other and complain about the other employees. Loudly, while they're ignoring you. They don't know where anything in New York is. Only a couple actually spoke english. It's difficult to get directions to the drink machine, never mind directions to Times Square. The staff are very unprofessional, and we were hassled non-stop by the doorman - different ones, when we could find one - to book their in-house limo to the airport. It's the only thing they cared about. We eventually DID use their limo, and by the time we got to JFK I was ready to boot. The smell, the lack of suspension and the chaotic driving all made it a ride from hell. You can book a car service for free from the internet terminals downstairs - I highly recommend skipping their car service. Housekeeping was great. Our room was always immaculate, the towels were nice and the bathrooms were spotless. The linens were also of a good quality, the beds were quite comfortable. Nothing went missing, and we tipped them at the end of the stay. If you're low maintenance, this may be a good bet for you. If you expect any kind of customer service from your hotel, don't book the Astor. The subway is a quick walk from the Astor, although I wouldn't want to do it at night alone. There were shady characters loitering about the subway entrance quite often. One night the man across from us was going through a womans purse and discarding things from it. A cab is about 10 dollars to times square. There are great restaurants starting in the w90s, but you have to go up a block - there's nothing but residential almost all the way of the park, not even a starbucks. You can get coffee, sodas and internet access in the basement. There is a store not far from there, but there is NOWHERE to eat for blocks and blocks. If you stay here, be sure to walk through Harlem to Amy Ruth's restaurant on 116 and Lenox.

Reviews.Title: “I Am A Travel Agent”
Reviews.Author: FRICHARDSON
Reviews.Content: I work for First Choice Travel agents,and i treated my mum to a christmas shopping break, i felt so ashamed for booking this dump, it is no way walking distance to any shops, restuarants, bars or anything excited, the hotel has no bar or resturant, the staff are completly useless, the rooms have very little heating and the lifts are not suitable for the size of the hotel. This hotel is well below parr and i would not sell it to any of my customers, it was so bad i received a full refund, please i promise you do not book this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but could do better!”
Reviews.Author: H.Fitz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with some friends a couple of weeks ago and it wasn't too bad but I don't think I'd go back there. The staff where helpful when they didn't have our reservation and we ended up in a room with an amazing view of Manhatten. I would warn people of the concierge who tried to sell us something everytime we stepped into the foyer - he even interupted a phonecall! The lift is the noisest and most unreliable lift I've ever come across. Which was confirmed just before we left when it broke down and we had to trek up ten flights of stairs. The concierge did help us with our bags though. They also decided to start banging holes in the wall half way through our stay which wasn't great, it left the place in a bit of mess. Be warned of the groups of American teenagers who might stay and shout 'drink, drink, drink' through the night. I would stay somewhere else next time so I could be more central, although its easy enough to get the subway. Oh and the maid did throw away a bag with food in that I'd bought. When I went to tell reception the guy was so serious and sincere about it that I suspect he was taking the piss out of me for complaining about something so small. A couple of towels also went missing and no one ever got back to us about it. Don't leave things lying around. I'm being a bit unfair though. The hotel suited us fine because we were never really there - we went for the city not the accommodation. If you want a reasonable, budget hotel and you don't mind a few hiccups along the way then you'll be fine here - and you get free coffee! Enjoy New York - it's fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley horrible”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything from the reservation to the location to the elevator were horrible at this hotel. I have traveled extensively and have not been at a hotel this shabby in years. Would NOT reccommend.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL FROM HELL!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Having read many poor reviews about Astor on the park,it definately lived up to it's bad reputation!. When we arrived we were checked into a room on the 5th floor and the one elevator they had was'nt working.We were'nt offered any help with our luggage at all.When we got to our room we opened the door to discover that somebody else was already staying in it.My husband went back down to the reception area only to be told that the person that had allocated us the room was on their break and until they came back there was nothing that could be done.After waiting half an hour my husband re-appeared with a key for another room, i have to say i was so relieved as we'd been travelling for 8 hours. Sadly it was short lived when we entered the room it was clearly filthy with urnine all over the toilet seat, dirty towels on the floor, need i say more.We finally got a room with a broken shower and clanging water pipes.Booked into a different hotel the following day and had an amazing stay. Astor on the park may be good for young couples trying out the club scene in New York but thats all.If you can afford a little more then it's definately money well spent!.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great view”
Reviews.Author: itsnojoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Astor the week of Thanksgiving. Our first room smelled of paint - front desk happily moved us to new room. New room had a balcony which overlooked Central Park and gave great skyline view of city. Room had a queen sized bed which we used for sleeping and a twin sized bed which we used for luggage. Housekeeping staff did an amazing job - very clean everyday. TV got very few channels...but who comes to the city to watch TV?!?! Elevator is very tiny and very slow. If you are looking for a clean room to sleep in, the Astor works.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it and I'm really fussy!”
Reviews.Author: AW1
Reviews.Content: I've just come back from New York and stayed at Astor on the Park for six nights with two girlfriends (we're all aged 22-23). I don't mind admitting that I'm really fussy and was honestly dreading staying there after reading some of the reviews on this website, however I needn't have expected the worst as the hotel was fine for us. For me the facilities were level with those of a typical 'chain' hotel in England and in a modern style too. The bathroom was really nice, new and clean, our room (1001) was a good size with views over Central Park and the Manhattan skyline from the balcony and the staff were also very friendly. There is a subway station at 103 street about three blocks away and about five/six stops takes you to Times Square, although this maybe isn't ideal for people on a shorter break than us as we did get fed up of the trek back to the hotel to get changed before going out at night. I don't want to make this seem a bad review but some things to be aware of: the lift - is a bit scary and woke me up at night every time the doors shut. It broke on our last day and we had to walk up and down to the tenth floor although fortunately the staff helped us with our cases! Don't take your own towels as these might end up in the hotel laundry like ours did by mistake (their's are good anyway). Location isn't great for restaurants, shops etc. nearby although the A train runs from Downtown all through the night and there's a handy corner shop at the end of the block. I was also under the impression we were lucky to get such a big room so ask for 1001 if there's four of you and you and two don't mind bunks. Enjoy New York it's amazing!

HotelInfo.Name: Astor on the Park
HotelInfo.Address: 465 Central Park West, New York City, NY 10025
